Preface

In the year 636, the Bards measured their talents with quills and texts. After much thought and deliberation, the jury and people of the World crowned Nolliuos grand winner of the Bardise tournament. The Bards' Flute and this book were given to him as a testament to his talents.

Given the quality of the works, several texts caught the jury's attention, including those of Hujikan, Doux-Leurre and Madahine. Those texts are also in this collection. Thank you to all participants for their contributions!

The Trial

Create a text from the following things:

An Eniripsa wakes up and finds himself amnesiac – everything around him vaguely reminds him of something, and he knows that it comes from his past, but he does not know how:

- a Twiggy shovel;

- an empty Bwak egg;

- a Brakmarian cloak;

- a letter of introduction from a captain of the Bontarian Guard;

- the yellowed and apparently often-handled portrait of a middle-aged Ecaflip woman.

The Eniripsa gets up, and sees that he is in pain due to one of his wings being half-broken. He sees that he is in the middle of the streets of Astrub, in front of the statue of Sram.

Nolliuos

I would have liked to tell you a story in the style of "Once upon a time, in a kingdom far, far away..." Only what I'm about to tell you isn't more than twenty-four hours old. I don't even know if "Once upon a time" is an adequate introduction, as my tale is so far removed from any fairy tale that us Eniripsas are accustomed to telling.

This place we are in, in front of the statue of the god Sram, is quite fitting for my story. Deceit, betrayal, women not wearing much... Yes, my past is worthy of the everyday life of a Sram. Am I boring you? You're right, what's the point in spouting on about the nature of my story, if I'm not even going to bother telling you the story?

So, once upon a time, yesterday morning, there was a young Eniripsa – full of life, panache and mistresses. Aaaah, Miss Tigry...

There's her portrait, just next to my foot. My apologies that I can't hand it to you, but her idiot husband wasn't exactly delicate with my wing. Oh dear... what would become of my immoral life if he knew that I've got the habit of ending up in his wife's arms before every lunchtime?

Oh, I know what you're thinking. She's too old for me. But I'll tell you one thing: a middle-aged Ecaflip woman is worth more than three Fecas who exude a love of life. It was even me who ended up begging for mercy! So much delight... it was almost obscene!

Why did the cuckold lay into me? Oh, that's quite simple. You see that Twiggy shovel there? Just under the cloak? Well I had the misfortune of borrowing it from him without asking him first. And all that because a young Iop girl who was a bit cracked (yes, it's a euphemism) asked me to go and dig up some Earth Bwak eggs. You think I'm bonkers, don't you? But she was so stunning in her Brakmarian cloak, her long black hair getting mixed up in the fabric, her almond eyes, pointed breasts, narrow waist... and those legs, oh those legs! Never ending! No one could deny those thighs anything.

Of course the idea of finding Bwak eggs by digging at the foot of the mountains made me laugh... But what wouldn't I have done to taste that mad Iop's forbidden fruit!?

But you know what's worst? She was right. We did indeed find eggs when digging... freshly laid, what's more. When I asked her what she was going to do with the eggs, it was in that moment that I understood exactly how stupid Iops are. Oh I love them, don't get me wrong... especially naked. But all the same, to eat Earth Bwak eggs, you've got to be cooked in the head, and have a stomach that's both bigger than a Pandikaze and made from Lousy Pig leather! So if you're wondering about this empty shell just in front of you, don't worry: its inhabitant also ended up getting cooked...

No really, it was a spectacular day. Full of laughs, surprises and craziness...

In the evening, we ended up here at Sram's feet, with a few flasks of Pandapills that my charming Iop companion had made sure to bring with us. We were blind drunk, singing "Pandapills, Pandapills, tralalalalah" at the top of our voices, when Miss Tigry and her lawful husband arrived. Furious at seeing me more drunk with a Iop who was younger than her, she didn't take long to find a way to exact her revenge:

"Oh, darling! Your Twiggy shovel!"

"You little midge! You're the one who stole it from me!"

I didn't have time to stagger to somewhere safe: he'd already grabbed the shovel and started hitting me with it. Falling to my beautiful Iop's knees, I saw the contents of my bag emptied in front of her, allowing her to see the letter from the Bontarian Army – a summons to enlist with them.

I saw the sense of betrayal in my sweetheart's blue eyes. She drank one last, long mouthful of Pandapills, and threw the flask right in my face. After a few kicks to my already broken wing, she left... without even taking her cloak...

Hujikan

*Sound of a tom-tom being hit frantically*

- Abawana, Abawana...

- Oh look, travellers!

- Good day to you, brave adventurers! I, Huji-ji the Pandawa poet, would like to tell you the story of the fabulous Flith-Voyth, the amnesiac Eniripsa.

*Long musical interlude on a tambourine, lute, and another carnival instrument*

- There once was an Eni most fair, who was found passed out in the square. When he finally stirred, his memory was blurred, and he didn't know how he'd got there!

And a damaged shovel was found, stuck straight upright in the ground – it called to mind an old spoon, so rough and shoddy was it hewn. Without waiting, he rose from the ground, looked left, right, and all around. His wing seemed to him injured, from a cause not quite remembered. And though he thought til his thinker was sore, he had no idea what the fates had in store.

*Takes a breath*

- And he'd roamed 'round the town, picking up many items he found. But little did they assuage his stress, and were by and large quite worthless... A broken shell, its host long fled. A jet black cloak from which evil bled. An Eca's picture in a beat-up frame. The seal of a serviceman of notable fame.

*Resumes playing the lute with calm and innocence*

- The poor Eniripsa with the memory rent... had met a soldier with a missive from Bonta sent!

- The dire cloak had attracted the stoic soldier's stare; and 'twas by this cloak that he dragged our hero through the square!

- The saintly man then stopped – in the City of Mercenaries, those hailing from Bonta or Brakmar had best be wary. So be it! Resigned, he looked 'round, then gently set our Eni down.

- The man doubtless understood this charade, and our hero questioned him 'neath the arcade.

*Takes a breath and resumes his singing with even greater intensity*

- They were face to face, before the Kikim Inn, the Eni'd cheated the barkeep... So he fled, joined the enemy. This letter was brought by a Piwi, running toward danger deep. So drunk was our man, his vision beset, he called on a man who he'd never met. The Brakmarian soldier read the note and the name there signed, and tried to cut the nurse, who fled someplace hard to find. He surely felt safe there in a deep and infamous mine. But the overworked miners who chased him were far from benign. Our fairy had no option but to beat them blue with a shovel he'd found that looked rather new.

- And now it seemed his only option was to flee from all the workers so bitter and angry. Once he finally found his way out, he was surprised by a Kwak, giant and stout! Drunk and afraid, he did something dumb, and took from the beast her feathery young.

- The Bontarian was well-hidden, and watched this all unfold, before knocking the Eni out, and sending him to the hold.

- But through luck, a slow Sram released the fairy, in place of the boss he'd been sent to free.

- The poor Eni, now verging on sobriety, was abandoned 'neath the statue of a certain sneaky deity...

- The moral of this story is: If you stop at Kikim Inn for a glass, Sram might show up, so best watch your...self.

*didiliiiing dliiiiiing*

Oh alright, I'll go back to my tavern...

Doux-Leurre

With a groan, Oligo the Eniripsa got back to his feet. He didn't know how long he'd been unconscious, but his right wing and his head were hurting really badly, and his stomach was complaining with hunger. With a grimace, he looked around him, and realised that he was in Astrub, at the foot of the statue of the god Sram. It seemed to be staring at him teasingly. Night had fallen, and the few people who went by hardly even glanced at him.

"But what am I doing here?" he asked himself. "And what is..."

Several items were scattered at his feet, so he bent down to pick them up and examine them: a Twiggy shovel, a Brakmarian cloak, a photo, a letter, and a sort of large eggshell, as black as burnt ebony.

These trifling things seemed familiar, but he couldn't remember anything from the previous few days. In a lantern's light, he examined the photo: there was quite an old Ecaflip, looking relaxed, sat on a wooden log, in front of what seemed to be some treetops. He put it in his pocket, and read the letter. It told him that he had been invited to meet Just Issforowl, a captain of the Bontarian Guard. Deciding to find out how he has arrived in Astrub in as bad a shape as a Poutch Ingball, he gathered his things up, and headed towards the west, towards the majestic Bonta.

The fortifications of the beautiful City were visible to him at daybreak. He sped up. Once he reached the gates after twenty minutes or so, a member of the Militia came up to him and blocked his path.

"Who goes there!?"

With the most important appearance as his aching body would allow, Oligo held the letter to the soldier's face.

"I must see the captain, Just Issforowl, for some business of the utmost importance!"

The guardian, recognising the stamp on the letter, stepped aside.

After finding his bearings thanks to the advice of a few Bontarians and with the help of his official pass, the young Eniripsa arrived at the door of the captain's office, knocked, and entered. A gigantic Iop turned around, and seeing Oligo, opened his eyes wide and rushed at him.

"Oligo! Have you come back alone? Where are Imar, Srever and Flechevive? Do you have the egg? Are you hurt?"

"Sir, I came here hoping to find some answers, not questions..."

"What do you mean?"

"I woke up in Astrub last night; I don't know who you are, I barely even know who I am, but I was hoping that you'd be able to shed some light on my situation, because in my things, there was... this letter."

The captain took the letter from him.

"Well of course, that's your summons. Do you mean to say that you're amnesiac?"

The Iop's worry was written all over his face.

"Absolutely, sir."

Looking aggrieved, Just Issforowl fell down into his chair.

"It's a disaster... You were gone for sixteen days. As I'm speaking to you, the Brakmarians have surely got their hands on the egg."

Oligo grabbed the black shell that he'd been keeping in his saddlebag.

"Do you mean this?"

"By Jiva," exclaimed the captain, "the Black Egg! It's empty?"

Oligo, with a piece of the shell in each hand, shrugged his shoulders.

"Could you finally tell me who I am, and what I'm doing with this shell, cloak, and shovel in my belongings?"

Just Issforowl turned towards the large window the sun was shining through, which lit up his heavily-scarred face.

"You are Oligo, a Tweasuwe Huntew. One of the best. I was ordered to hire you and Imar, another hunter, an Ecaflip, to find the Black Egg before the Brakmarian troops."

"Djaul knows what would happen if it fell into the wrong hands... You were being assisted in your task by two mercenaries: Flechevive, a Cra, and Srever, a Sram. Their feats of arms are well-known, and I'd be surprised if your mission failed with such talent at your side."

"What's this black egg?"

"It is said in the sacred texts of the Bonta Library, that every ten-thousandth new moon, the legendary Black Kwak comes out of its underground sanctuary and lays an egg. It is also written that..."

The captain didn't have time to finish his sentence before someone knocked at his door. An Ecaflip slid into the room. Oligo instantly recognised her as the one from the photo. She only seemed half surprised to see him in the captain's office.

Her face and clothes, real, full of light and not at all discoloured by time, suddenly made the Eniripsa's memory return: the black egg and the power that the coveted Black Bwak gave to its bearer; meeting White Jackie, the Bontarian scout posted in the Imp Village; camouflaging the group using Brakmarian cloaks; the two days and nights spent digging for the egg in the Sidimote Moors; finding it, and the foul betrayal by Srever the Sram, and his accomplices hidden in the undergrowth.

"Captain. Oligo. I suppose you've told the captain about our misadventures?"

"But what are you doing here?" exclaimed the Captain. "Why aren't you continuing your mission?"

"There is no more mission, sir. The Brakmarians set an ambush, orchestrated by Srever. He took hold of the egg after we found it and dug it up. He was in league with the Brakmarian troops from the start... Flechevive has been captured, and Imar is..."

Outside, the warning trumpets sounded abruptly. The Iop jumped, his hand already on the sheath of his giant sword. Surprised, Oligo fell into step behind him, followed by White Jackie. They climbed the stairs of the ramparts four by four, and what they saw rooted them to the spot.

A hundred or so Brakmarian soldiers on Whitish Fangs were rushing towards the City in a cloud of dust, screaming.

But the most impressive thing was the gigantic dark-coloured Bwak leading them, tearing at the blue morning sky with its hellish wingspan, with a hooded Sram on its back, holding a short-sword gleaming with magic in each hand.

"Tremendous," White Jackie sighed unavoidably.

"Archers, to your stations!" screamed the captain, smiling with excitement despite the horror that this monstrous image inspired in him. He unsheathed his gleaming blade and hurtled down the stairs, without stopping to shout orders at his men, frozen with terror. He surreptitiously thought that it was the last time he'd trust a Sram.

When the first Whitish Fangs reached the south gate of Bonta, Oligo remembered the teasing stare of the Sram statue in Astrub, and started praying.

Mahadine

"Hey, wake up!"

"Hhhmmmmm... Mum, I'm sleeping, leave me alone!"

"Get up!"

An Eniripsa is sprawled out on the floor. A Cra girl is on her knees next to him, trying to wake him up. The Eniripsa opens his eyes, and makes a slight movement of surprise: he's lying down on the cobblestones in a dark street of the World...

"Where am I?" he mumbles, looking lost.

"You're in Astrub. You know, the most populous village in the region..." the young Cra says ironically. She hesitates, then adds:

"So... Are you lost, little guy? Do you want me to help you find your mum?"

"Do I look like a little kid to you?" the Eniripsa replies, blushing.

"That's easy to say! All Eniripsas have childlike faces..."

He sighs. "I don't remember anything," he suddenly says out loud, breaking the Cra's awkward silence.

He looks around. He sees some Srams jeering, looking at him from next to a strange statue, smiling. He has a piece of crumpled paper in his hands, and is sat on a piece of dark fabric. He reads the paper:

"I, Amayiro, head of the Bontarian militia, attest that from this day, the 28 of Frauguctor 636, the Soldier S. U'PEWWY is reassigned to the contingent of the Bontarian militia."

"U'Pewwy? As in Sumry U'Pewwy, the author of The Little Trinkess?" asked the Cra, who had also read the piece of paper.

"U'Pewwy is a Wabbit... And his book is called The Little Twinkess, you ignoramus. Do I look like a bunny or what?"

"Agh! Not so amnesiac after all! He can flaunt his literary culture, but can't even be bothered to remember his name!"

The Eniripsa tries to get up.

"Ouch! My left wing, it hurts..."

"Which one?"

"The left one, I told you!"

"You have two sets of wings, idiot. Your Eniripsa wings and some little white wings, there..." she explains calmly, accidentally gripping the angelic left wing.

"OWEEEE! Be careful, will you?"

"Oh hey! I'm a warrior you know. Not an Enursiripsa. You on the other hand don't look like much of a great warrior... here's your weapon, it was lying around next to you," she adds, holding out a Twiggy shovel.

""Huh...? Err, thanks," he replies, incensed, looking at the shovel.

"I also found some Bwak egg shells, and... this."

The Cra holds out a picture of an old, clever-looking Ecaflip to him. Without so much as knowing who she was, the Eniripsa suddenly feels ill, turns pale, and curtly grabs the picture from the surprised Cra's hands, then shouts:

"Don't dare touch that again!"

The Eniripsa's scream cut short the conversations, and the passers-by looked at him, surprised. He awkwardly tries to get up, but the sudden movement revives the pain in his wing, and he can't manage to move.

"It looks like you're suffering," the young Cra sympathises with him in a compassionate tone. "Come over here, you might be able to lie down," she says, pointing out an unsold house joined to the walls.

She picks up the dark cloth, then under the teasing watch of Sram, takes the Eniripsa inside, and sits him down on the bed. Then, she starts meticulously combing every nook and cranny of the room.

"What are you doing there?" he enquired, disappointed.

"I'm checking that no one's listening in on us," she replies with a calm voice.

"Errr, you aren't thinking that you and me are..."

"No," she stops him. "Don't worry. I'm Bontarian too. Tell me... the fact of your white wing being broken leads me to think that you've fought a Brakmarian... And yet, the divine statues in Astrub generate a zone of non-aggression." She stops for a second, just long enough to observe the Eniripsa's face. "A Brakmarian, of a similarly low level to you, was murdered not far from here yesterday. It's you who killed him, am I right?"

The Eniripsa suddenly turns very pale. He starts looking slightly worried, as his memories return. "So, you're..."

"... Mah Taharih, of the Brakmarian Secret Service. My wings are a lure." She pauses again, then curtly shouts: "Come here, you others!"

Two warriors appeared from upstairs like a bolt out of the blue, and spread their demonic wings as scare tactics.

"Here are Monn and Pehnni, your 'executioners', Mister U'Pewwy... since that's your name. You see, while reading your book, 'The Little Twinkess', I realised that your style was not natural... seeing as it was coded, and you were divulging the names of our agents infiltrating Bonta. Nice idea, hiding code-words in a bestseller. Nice idea too, passing yourself off to your readers as a Wabbit... such a crazy idea that it cleared you of all suspicion."

"Only, you needed proof of your integrity... such as the cloak and plate of one of our spies... whom you murdered yesterday evening, not far from here, and whose cloak is in my hands," she delighted, clutching the Brakmarian cloak in a theatrical manner. "If it reassures you, that duffer will be replaced from tomorrow. As for his plate, you must have hidden it before passing out, but we'll track it down, don't you worry about that. That being said, I don't understand why there were bits of Bwak eggshell near you. On the other hand, this picture..."

"... I recognised her straight away. It's Miss Typhiante, head of the Brakmarian General Staff... since she's been in that position, our failures keep on adding up... but now I understand why, it's because she's a spy as well. Oh, but tell me... Am I right about all this?"

"You... you're wrong!" stammered U'Pewwy, looking beaten.

"Not very convincing. Tell me, did you know that after a sharp, unexpected pain – such as fracturing your wing – you can sometimes lose your memory? It's temporary, of course... you've already recovered yours. But we have ways of erasing it permanently. Killing you would be crude. Spy wars are too refined for that..."

The she turned around, and went downstairs. The two warriors forced U'Pewwy to drink a strange potion. Before passing out, he thought: "Silly girl, your spy's plate is in my accomplice's hands, on his way to Bonta... as for the Bwak egg, it's an antidote that I discovered to your dear "Memory Potions"... my memory will come back in a few days' time... You got Miss Typhiante, but she'll laugh..." then he lost consciousness.

He woke up the next day, near the statue of Sram, lying down on the cobblestones. He couldn't remember anything.

135.subTitleId: How to raise your favourite pet
135.contentId:
Preface : p1.


Presentation : p3.


How to Feed your Pet : p4.


How to Solve Malnutrition : p5.


What to do in case of injury : p6.


Diet of the Gobtubby : p7.


Fight with your pet : p8.


Information about Bow Kennels : p10.


Conclusion : p12.


Unfortunately, as every year, a new sort of plague spead through Amakna. But the variant of Aperiel 463 had been quite surprising: the plague only affected the pets.


Symptoms were terrible. It all began with physical disorders: some became humongous, bare-skinned. Others became as swift as the wind, but at the same time extremely sensitive to the cold... No matter what their symptoms were, they all ended up dying.


Then Silouate, guardian of Aperirel, tried to save those poor beasts casting a spell on them. Every pets either slightly or heavily touched by this illness experienced a sort of rebirth. This was the only solution to counter the flail which was killing them one after the other.

But Silouate did not stop there. In order to prevent such a carnage from happening again in the future, he decided to link the resistance to illness of those little beasts to the much more powerful and efficient one of the inhabitants of Amakna.


But Silouate had not planned that his spell would reinforce the links between the inhabitants and their pets. It took them only two weeks to become completely dependent on their master...


That's why, nowadays, a pet can't be expected to survive long if it's not treated with great cares as those described in this book.

Love is essential for you to breed your pet properly and to gain his love in return.


Tips on how to love your pet are not within the competence of this book. Love can't be taught, it's more about natural instinct. Instead, this book will give you all the information you need to know how to correctly feed your pet which is the second most important thing!


This book will explain to you how to feed a Gobtubby, a terrible soul eater!

Soul eaters are not like other pets. They generally feel a terrible hatred for their fellow creatures and feed themselves with vengence.


For your little soul eater to feel full, you'll only need to take him with you when you go kill some of his fellow creatures ... he'll get to eat all the souls you'll set free.


A soul eater accepts to eat souls of his family members at any time of day and night. He can fast for a month maximum, but he can also eat an infinite number of souls in a very short amount of time. A soul eater will never grow obese.

After eating a certain amount of souls, the characteristics of your Gobtubby will increase.


If your soul eater becomes skinny, you must give him something to eat. So take him with you and kill some of his family members to feed him and make him look normal again.




In case of injury, a special diet should be given to the Gobtubby. Only Eniripsa powder can heal your pet. You can purchase this powder in Bow Kennels.


If your pet is injured, you can also leave him at the Bow Kennel to prevent his state from worsening while you go get him some Eniripsa powder.

The diet of the Gobtubby consists in eating his family members' souls.

Such a diet enables him to bring you more life.


Here is a list of the creature souls the Gobtubby can eat:


Gobball

White Gobbly

Black Gobbly

Gobball War Chief

Royal Gobball

Jack O'Gobball


Some of the souls are richer than others and enable your Gobtubby to evolve more quickly.


Your pet will help you out during your fights. It can either protect you or help you make more efficient attacks.


But, you should be extra careful. Indeed, everytime you'll lose a fight against a creature or if another adventurer attacks you, your pet is injured.


If you don't heal it straight away after each defeat, you're putting your pet's life at risk and you might definitely lose it. Usually, the only way to heal your pet after a defeat is to feed him with Eniripsa powder.

However, it is agreed that in willing fights opposing adventurers, pets should never be taken as targets. Therefore they can't be injured, even in case of defeat.


If you want to be sure not to hurt your pet, just don't take it by your side while fighting and leave it in your inventory.

The Bow Kennel is a place dedicated to pet breeding.


You can leave your pet here so that it can be taken care of while you're away. However, your pet won't improve or evolve while at the Bow Kennel since it will be separated from its master.


You will have to pay a fee to leave your pet there, but you will also have to pay when you come pick it up.


The amount of money you'll have to pay will be calcultated according to the length of the stay of your pet. The more you leave your pet to us, the more expensive it will get.

The Bow Kennel is also the place where you can purchase Eniripsa powder to heal your pet.


Adventurers' map usually shows the most renowned Bow Kennel. It's located next to the door of the city of Sufokia.


Some adventurers reported that there are Bow Kennels in every big city.

Before we end this book, you need to know one last thing about the physical constitution of the Gobtubby. Once its growth is completed, its capacities are at their utmost. Nothing else can be done for its development.


But, you still have to look after him. Indeed, if you reduce your care once your Gobtubby is fully grown, it could be very dangerous for his health. Therefore you must keep on feeding him with the souls of his family members for him not to waste away.



Good luck to you and your soul eater pet.

Preface

Unfortunately, as happens every year, a new type of Black Plague ravaged Amakna. But the one that struck in Aperirel of 463 was quite surprising: the plague did not affect people but rather their pets.

The symptoms were terrible. It would first manifest as a bodily imbalance. Some pets would grow huge but their skin would burn. Others became quick as the wind yet extremely sensitive to cold... But they all inevitably died.

Silouate, the guardian of Aperirel, attempted to cast a spell to save the poor beasts. Any pet stricken with the disease, no matter the severity, experienced a sort of rebirth. It was the only way to stop the plague, which had been killing them off one by one.

But Silouate didn't stop there. To prevent a similar catastrophe from happening in the future, he decided to partially link these small creatures' disease resistance to that of the people of Amakna, which was much higher and more resilient.

What Silouate didn't foresee was that his spell would strengthen the bonds between pets and people. Within two weeks, pets had become completely dependent on their owners...

That is why, to this day, pets have little chance of surviving if they don't receive the special care described in this book.

Introduction

First and foremost, to take good care of your pet, you must love it, otherwise your pet will not love you.

This book doesn't provide any tips or advice on how to love your pet, however, as that cannot be learned. Instead, we're going to look at the second most important condition: proper feeding.

This guide tells you how to feed Treechsters, fearsome soul-eating critters!

Feeding Your Pet

Soul-eating pets are quite unique, to say the least. They generally harbour an impressive amount of ill will for their own, and they can only feed on vengeance.

And so, to gain nourishment, soul-eaters need only to accompany you when you kill monsters of their ilk, at which point they will feed on the souls you've freed.

Soul-eaters will gladly consume the souls of their own species at any time of day or night. They can fast for long periods, and are also able to devour large numbers of souls in a very short amount of time. It is impossible to make a soul-eater overweight or underweight.

After eating a certain number of souls, your Treechster will see their characteristics increase.

Treating Injuries

When injured, your Treechster will need to follow a special diet of Eniripsa Powder, which can be used to heal pets. You can purchase this powder from the Bow Kennel.

If your pet is injured, you can also bring it to the Bow Kennel to keep its condition from worsening until you can get Eniripsa Powder for it.

Your Treechster's Diet

The Treechster's diet consists of the souls of creatures of its kind.

This diet enables it to be more powerful.

Here is a list of the creatures whose souls Treechsters can eat:

Trunknydum

Treechnid

Venerable Treechnid

Dark Treechnid

Treechnee

Dark Treechnee

Ancestral Treechnid

Soft Oak

Some souls are richer than others, allowing your Treechster to develop more quickly.

Using Your Pet in Combat

Your pet will typically help you in combat by defending you or helping to make your attacks more effective.

Be sure to keep a close eye on your pet, though, because it will be injured every time you lose a fight against a creature.

If you don't heal it after each loss, it will eventually die, and you'll have to find a way to revive your pet.

In general, the only way to heal a pet after losing a battle is to feed it Eniripsa Powder.

Customarily, when adventurers fight one another, pets are never targeted and therefore cannot be injured, even in the event of defeat.

If you want to be sure your pet doesn't get injured, simply keep it in your inventory rather than having it by your side during combat.

About the Bow Kennel

The Bow Kennel is a place generally reserved for raising pets.

You can leave your pet there so it's safe and well-fed while you are away. However, your pet will not improve while in the Bow Kennel, as it is away from its master.

You typically have to pay a fee to drop off your pet, and then another fee when you pick it up later.

The amount you have to pay will depend on how long you're gone for. The longer your pet stays in the Bow Kennel, the steeper the fee.

The Bow Kennel is also where you can buy Eniripsa Powder to heal your pet.

The most well-known Bow Kennel is usually marked on adventurers' maps. It can be found next to Sufokia Gate.

In conclusion, we must point out a physical limit to your Treechster's constitution.

Once its growth is complete, its capacities will have reached their maximum and it will be difficult to improve it further.

But be advised: if you stop caring for your Treechster properly once it has reached this state, its health will suffer greatly. You therefore need to continue to feed it the souls of its own kind regularly so it doesn't wither away.

Good luck to you and your soul-chomping pet!

141.subTitleId: Or How to Choke a Greedovore!
141.contentId:
Preface: p. 3


The Bed of Wild Strawberries: p. 5


Preparing the Palate: p. 6


The Main: p. 7


The Accompaniment: p. 8


The Sauce: p. 9


The Drink: p. 10

Preface by Mouss Bouff



I've travelled the World of Twelve as thoroughly as one can – from the dark forest of Nolifis Island to the misty Sidimote Moors – and I've had all sorts of unforgettable experiences in the marvellous places I've visited. But the most important of them all is the fleeting feeling that seemed to be by my side all along. This feeling grew, little by little, until it blossomed into an idea and, when I got home, a fully-fledged recipe. I'm a chef. For as long as I can remember, I've loved eating fine food and preparing innovative meals.

On my travels, I learnt so many recipes that I would never be able to prepare them all again – I just wouldn't have time! But that matters little, as I have already reached the summit of culinary excellence. By carefully mixing together precise quantities of ingredients, I invented the most delicate dish the world has ever known. It may be arrogant of me, but I believe it to be better even than the legendary cosmic meatballs. I named the dish Filtounga, after a Pandawa friend who was the very first to taste my creation.



This name is a word from an indigenous dialect and so I don't know exactly what it means, but I like to tell myself that it represents a cry of enormous, irrepressible happiness. My greatest regret is not having been able to prepare the dish for a second time, because the ingredients are so rare and hard to get hold of.

Filtounga – The Bed of Wild Strawberries



Before starting the recipe itself, it's a good idea to arrange things so that the meat doesn't actually touch the dish it's served on. The way to do this is to spread the plate with a thick layer of fruit jelly – strawberry, to be precise; it's the only one that will do. Although you can buy premade jelly, the true epicure will prefer to make their own using freshly gathered strawberries and barley sugar.



During this stage, I'd advise you to lock your children in their playpen. You don't want the base of the dish smeared with tongue and finger marks.

Filtounga – Preparing the Palate



Filtounga is an incredibly rich dish. As a result, you absolutely must prepare your palate for the explosion of textures and savours to come. Once you've daubed the plate with strawberry jelly, it's time to cover it in fine slices of brawn embellished with a trickle of lemon juice. Casually scatter a few raw Grawns to absorb the excess lemon. This sumptuous brawn-lemon-Grawn mixture will get your tastebuds fired up for the treat to come. It also looks rather divine.

Filtounga – The Main



Once you've got this sweet, savoury, delicious bed in place, you can start cooking the meat. For the best results, burn some Ancestral Treechnid wood in a Legendary Crackler stone kiln. Obviously, kitchen equipment of this standard isn't easy to come by, and a common but high-quality oven setup will do almost as well. Select as many choice cuts of Dragomeat as you think you can handle and bring them to the boil in a pan full of walnut oil. Simmer for two minutes or until the kitchen is filled with the subtle stench of Bwork armpits.



Remove the meat from its oily bath and gently pat it dry. Then place it carefully on the dish you prepared earlier.

Filtounga – The Accompaniment



The simplest part of making this delicate dish is preparing the accompaniment. Follow the recipe to the letter, because not just any old side dish will do! You'll need mashed potatoes, Babbage leaves, Greedovore flowers and Kraloves. Crush the cooked potatoes by hand. Add the Greedovore flowers to the potatoes and continue to mash until smooth. Once smooth, just spread it in a thick circle around the cooked meat, adding a few Babbage leaves and raw Kraloves here and there for appearance.

Filtounga – The Sauce



When you cook the meat, it releases hardly any juices, so you'll need to prepare a sauce. There's only one sauce that really brings out Filtounga's flavour properly, and luckily for you, it's quite easy to make. Melt some squares of dark chocolate. Whilst you're doing that, brown a few onions in the pan. Juice some aubergines. Once the chocolate has completely melted, pour it over the fried onion and add the aubergine juice. Bring the mixture to the boil – when it's ready, it will have taken on a beautiful purplish shade. Add some sesame seeds to the sauce.



Terrific! The sauce is now ready to pour lovingly over your Dragomeat steaks!

Filtounga – The Drink



The dish is now ready... but no meal is complete without a good drink. I've only ever tasted one that goes perfectly with my Filtounga: a tankard of Pandapiler, whose inimitable strength, colour and finesse will delight your guests. Of course, it's an acquired taste, so keep an eye on how much your diners have of it.



Well, that's all! Serve the Filtounga lukewarm, and get ready for the feast of your life!

142.contentId:
INGREDIENTS and EQUIPMENT: p. 3


MASHING and BREWING: p. 4


HOPPING and FERMENTATION: p. 5


SKULLS, TASTING and BELCHING: p. 6

INGREDIENTS


Hops


Yeast


Bwork urine


Blood from a red goblin or a white goblin



EQUIPMENT


Blue still


Orange still


Purple still


Scalpel (to bleed the goblin)


Pliers (to hold the goblin down)

MASHING


Crush the hops and heat it using the purple still.



BREWING


Add the Bwork urine and raise the temperature to 63°C. Maintain this temperature for 30 minutes whilst brewing (at this temperature, starch is transformed into maltose, a fermentable sugar that will become alcohol during the fermentation stage).

HOPPING


The wort must now be brought to boiling temperature using the blue still. When it starts to boil, add the goblin blood to give the beer its characteristic colour. Leave to boil for two hours in order to remove the bitter resins.



FERMENTATION


Cool the liquid back down using the green still. Once you've got it down to a temperature of 25°C, mix in the yeast. Throw the goblin into the still. Once you spot the tell-tale sign that fermentation is complete (the Goblin has been devoured by the yeast and is no longer moving), the beer is ready.

SKULLS


Your ex-enemies' skulls must be completely cleaned of fat and grease, otherwise they might prevent the beer's head from forming fully. The head is important as it protects the beer against the effects of oxygen in the air. Besides, it makes the beer look even more delicious, and tastes nice too!



TASTING


Once the skull is full, make sure you take a good, long look at the beer, contemplating its colour, its foam and the way it reflects the light, before breathing in its aromas and, finally, lifting it to your lips to discover its taste, strength and texture.



BELCHING


Never forget to burp into the faces of your entourage to remind them that he who talks the least drinks the most!

In a bowl, mix the flour, eggs and Mimilk together with a whisk. You should get a smooth, lumpless dough. Add the melted Fattrool and a ladleful of magical cure. Let the dough rest while you go for a fight.

144.contentId:
Of all the legends told by the inhabitants of Amakna, only one has survived the ages.

(Part of the text has been scribbled out or is covered with a sticky substance.)

Before Goultard became a barbarian...

Lost in the middle of the Sidimote Moors, in the heart of hostile mountains, the village of Gisgoul was surrounded by tall, pointed ramparts, as was the barbarous fashion at the time. The ramparts protected villagers from the toothy creatures prowling around the area. The story of Goultard begins inside these very ramparts...

At the time, Goultard was just a small, turbulent Iop who spent his time disobeying his mother, Cabotine. On one occasion, he ventured outside the protective walls of the village, accompanied by some of his friends. They had a game that they enjoyed playing together, and its rules were simple. Throw balls of mud at each other, and count the number of splotches on their clothes. Whoever had the most splotches won!

Goultard teamed up with Pluzo and Macide, two young boys the same age as him. But as they prepared their stock of sticky mud balls, the terrifying Lagoon suddenly appeared, a huge monster of immense strength and foul breath. Goultard did not bat an eyelid. If this Lagoon wanted to play, he would have to pick up balls of mud, just like everyone else! We know little of the struggle that ensued, but Goultard discovered that day that he could be as strong as ten Bworks when needed!

(The rest of the book is completely unreadable. All that remains legible is the author's signature: H. Manbillin.)

Reading these pages has put you in the mood to find a copy of the original manuscript in the Amakna library.

Set off on the quest to discover Goultard's past.

145.contentId:
De Lagoonis et Krituris Profundis

It didn't take long for Goultard to slaughter the gigantic Lagoon, but the inhabitants of the village were distraught. "Alas," they cried. "This victory does not bode well!", and indeed, a terrible threat now hung over Gisgoul...

Lagoon was the son of the redoubtable Kriture (the same, just bigger, fatter and stronger). Kriture surely would not hesitate to avenge his offspring! As far as the inhabitants of Gisgoul were concerned, there was no doubting that Goultard had just condemned the entire village.

A terrible decision was taken: deliver Goultard and his mother to the fearsome Kriture. Some villagers thought the fate assigned to the mother and son was cruel and unjust. Others felt it was the best thing to do...

When he managed to defeat the enemy a second time, opinions were no longer divided! It was now clear: the power Goultard held far exceeded those of the greatest beings in the world. At least he had nothing to fear any more. Where could such strength, worthy of a god, come from? It's a mystery!

As the years went by, his power grew and grew. The children of Gisgoul Village had found their benefactor...

(Extract from Goultard's Childhood).

Reading these pages has put you in the mood to find a copy of the original manuscript in a bigger library.

146.titleId: How to Travel Without Ever Losing Your Way
146.contentId:
Wally's Good Word: p. 3

The Bwork Camp: p. 4

The Swamps: p. 5

The Dreggon Peninsula: p. 6

Wabbit Island: p. 7

Moon Island: p. 8

The Koalak Mountains: p. 9

The Dreggon Sanctuary: p. 11

Kwismas Island: p. 15

Dear reader, I have written this book because I, Wally Elconom, proclaim myself to be a learned geographer and one of the most knowledgeable men in the World, if not THE most knowledgeable.

In these pages, you will find material that will not only enable you to travel easily, but will also make you think about the vast world we call our own!

This will be all I will write on the subject, but please be assured that you will always be able to find me in Amakna Library if you require more information. Furthermore, it would be very much in your interest to do so!

The Bwork Camp

To the north of the Labyrinth and accessible via Crackler Mountain, you will find a small village of indomitable Bworks who are still resisting invasion. As the learned Acidrik Gutsplitter writes: No creature gifted with any sort of intelligence will last very long there. This says quite a bit about the intelligence quotient of the average Bwork.

Bwork magic, art and, notably, the art of combat are quite unsophisticated, but uncommonly powerful. You should think twice before venturing into the camp!

The Swamps

The Swamps are infested with Crocodyls, Mushds and Arachnees. This might not mean much to you, but more experienced adventurers will know exactly what I'm talking about!

At the very depths of the Swamps, a greenish light glows. Stuck in the stone, Crocobur, Crocoburio's sword, awaits the valiant warrior who will be able to dislodge it from its stony prison.

The Dreggon Peninsula

This beautiful peninsula is located in southern Amakna. The only way to get there is to pay no heed to the knight who is standing guard.

Bandits sometimes like to prowl this area... but there are worse things to fear. Legions of Dreggons have been slaughtered in this part of the world, unfortunately for its inhabitants. It would appear an evil Dofus is behind this scourge... After all, any proper adventurer knows that a Dofus is a dragon egg that a love-struck dragon will offer to his sweetheart. However, it may come as a surprise that these eggs never hatch: that's the key to their draconic power! That's right: keeping the dragons captive in their shells is what makes these eggs so powerful.

The fact that small dragons (with a fiery temper, despite their diminutive size) have seen the light of day is no doubt the work of an evil genius, or an apprentice getting up to no good with his powers.

Wabbit Island

Getting to Wabbit Island is easy: all you have to do is take a boat from Amakna Harbour and pay a modest sum to Lily, the rather pretty captain of a boat full of emigrants who leave of their own accord to pillage Wabbit treasures.

There, you'll find a silky-tailed but oppressed people known as the Lenalds. The island has been invaded by cruel Wabbits, which are kind of like genetically modified Coneys.

You'll need bravery, strength and healing potions to cross the island and reach the royal residence of the Wa Wabbit. The Wa Wabbit rules his bushy-tailed subjects with an iron paw, like the good tyrant he is. Anything that doesn't look like a female Wabbit or Cawwot from up close or far away disgusts him and, if you plan on entering his castle, you'd better know what you're doing, because the Wobots, the Wa Wabbit's personal bodyguards, will show no mercy!

Moon Island

To get there, you'll need to contact Charlie's Agents, who will organise the trip for a modest fee.

You'll be greeted by a vision of paradise the minute you first set foot on the fine sandy beach. In the shade of the Kokoko palms, you'll be able to enjoy the scenery while preparing yourself to meet the natives: they've really got living down to a fine art on Moon Island! The pirate LeChouque will receive you in the customary manner and the Kanniballs will surely invite you in for a bite to eat (of what, though, it's best not to ask).

The seaside might be peaceful enough, but the jungle at the heart of the island is a different story altogether. It's the home of the legendary Moon, of whom, incidentally, very little is known, apart from the fact that he possesses a legendary hammer.

The Koalak Mountains

Once upon a time, there were four Sadidette sisters who were curious, but not very sensible, who liked to frolic about on the road to Cania, and flirt with the boys. One day, distracted by their innocent games, they were led away by some strapping, leafy young men, and the little group sunk into as yet undiscovered territory, not very far from the Sidimote Moors... it was a very long time ago! What became of the Sadidas, no one knows... As for the Sadidettes, all we know about them is that they took an oath to remain mischievous children forever.

The problem is that, quite a while ago, these young Sadidettes fell far from the tree, as the Sadidas say: they renounced the teachings of the spirits of Nature, much to their parents' displeasure. Over near Sidimote, they met the beautiful, high-spirited Skeunk, an Eniripsa who was an expert in potions and medicinal plants, always accompanied by his Crimson Coney (whose name is Purpole).

Skeunk became the hidden force behind the four Sadidettes: their mentor. Since then, they've tried a thousand and one ways to use the magic of the gods Sadida and Eniripsa for their own purposes. Their greatest success has been mastering elemental magic to the point where they can each dominate one of the four primordial elements, in the same way as the Elemental Dragons and Pandawushu Masters... Rumour has it that Skeunk stole a precious item from a creature called the Koolich...

The Dreggon Sanctuary

A village hidden within another. There is so much more than meets the eye when it comes to the ruins of the old village of Amakna, on the Dreggon Peninsula. They're all that's left of a dramatic history, the remains of a divine punishment inflicted on a people who were too proud for their own good.

Indeed, underneath this village lies an immense cavern: the Dreggon Sanctuary. Previously, the Dreggons lived there in peace. One day, the inhabitants of Amakna discovered the sanctuary and its dragons. By some genius or madness, they had an insane idea. Worse than that, an idea of sheer lunacy. The first thing that came to their minds when they discovered the existence of these dragons and their sanctuary, hidden from the eyes of the gods, was this: "Dreggons lay eggs. Dofus are dragon eggs. Dreggons can, therefore, lay Dofus, if we help them to."

What happened next remains unclear, even to this day.

This breeding, like the existence of the Sanctuary, became one of their most closely guarded secrets. Things carried on in this way for several generations. One disastrous day, however, the Dreggons decided they no longer wanted people to play with their eggs. They revolted and started massacring their breeders. They felt this was the very least they needed to do to stop their discontent from falling on deaf ears.

The wise men could see ruin and famine coming... The entrance to the sanctuary was condemned and a Kanojedo was built on top of it to conceal their reprehensible activities. But they had underestimated the wrath of the gods!

In one of his manuscripts, the eminent philosopher Platow recalls this sad period of history. Unfortunately, only fragments of this manuscript have been found. Here's one of them:

So, the god of gods, Osamodas, who reigns according to the laws and who knows about these sorts of things, noticing the unfortunate state of a race that had been so virtuous, resolved to punish the Dreggon breeders to make them more temperate and wise. To this effect, he brought all of the gods together in their most precious residence, the one that, situated at the centre of the universe, overlooks everything involved in its creation. Having brought them together, told them..." This extract of Platow's work ends on these words.

In any case, you can be sure that Osamodas spoke to his divine colleagues. And what he said to them that day was not very auspicious for the inhabitants of Amakna. The Sanctuary was reopened by the gods. A wave of Dreggons thirsty for vengeance and massacre descended on Amakna Village... which soon found itself reduced to scraps. The fastest inhabitants were able to flee and hide in what we know today as Amakna Castle. The less fast were all invited to the Dreggon feast, as sausages and steaks, all roasted until burnt to a crisp.

So, this is how the chapter about the history of the Dreggon Sanctuary ends. A mystery that lives on... Did the breeders get what they were looking for after all? Did they manage to create a Dofus? The mystery has never been solved.

Kwismas Island

It was a Descendre morning in 636 that started off just like any other. Elliot Nagrond, the guardian of the world's north-west lighthouse, showed up, at the top of his workplace as usual. He searched the sea and the horizon, just as usual, watching for the return of the fishermen. However, this morning did not turn out to be like all the others after all, since, as he stared out onto the still faraway and unexplored surface of the ocean, the morning fog lifted and gave way to a new image: a gigantic block of ice in the distance, proud and cold, in the middle of the sea where there had been nothing the previous evening. The rumour of this discovery spread very quickly throughout the whole continent at the same time as an unprecedented cold spell. And it only took one day for all the adventurers, geographers and academics to flock to the coast in the hopes of finding a place on one of the charter boats going to this mysterious island.

When all the brave voyagers set foot on this new ground, they were taken even further by surprise. Indeed, they discovered that it was far more than just an island on which to spend their winter holidays! There was all sorts of unknown wildlife there... And although the strange creatures that lived there scared the adventurers at first, they soon became a surprising and inexhaustible source of wealth. As a result, all through Descendre, the world's population converged on the island and hunted the local fauna tirelessly. What no one took into account however, was the hunger of Djaul, the demon protector of Descendre!

That's right: in spite of appearances, this island was not a gift from the gods! Indeed, Djaul (who took his demonic duties very seriously) was responsible for making the island of ice sail right up next to the Amaknian continent. He was counting on the biting cold to freeze the hearts and souls of the inhabitants of the World of Twelve! And in doing so, the insatiable Djaul hoped to lengthen the month of Descendre...

Yes, his evil desire was to eat into a few days of the month of Javian... But Jiva, the beautiful warrior, defeated the demon, as well as the ice and snow that he brought with him, threatening the whole world. Had Djaul forgotten what Jiva told him, "He who freezes last freezes best?" Nobody knows, but he swore he would not give up...

The effervescence surrounding Kwismas Island, which got its name from the date of its discovery, faded as quickly as it had appeared. The adventurers went back to the continent and their normal business. A few academics were, however, interested in the origin of this strange island that had suddenly appeared from nowhere. After all, Djaul must have dragged it from somewhere... One of the many theories was that this was nothing more than a piece of ice that had broken off some faraway, undiscovered continent... The learned Sadida behind this idea, Ougga Lileo, was subjected to mockery and misunderstanding by his peers. As an aside, though, there was one young man who ignored the general scoffing and was interested in Lileo's theory...

This young man, Kriss Toff, later became a famous pioneer... Which all came down to one simple phrase that, thanks to him, became famous: "An ougga in the hand is worth two in the bush.".

147.contentId:
Public Notice.



I, Cantile, Mayor of Frigost, invite the inhabitants of Frigost to take part in a farming competition. Though fertile, the soils of our beloved isle can no longer compete with the production methods on the continent.

As such, any person who provides an ingenious system for increasing the crops in our fields will be generously rewarded. Any ingenious idea will be noted down by H. Frost, our archivist. A panel of experts will be put together and will review the applications in sixty days.

Cantile, Mayor of Frigost. Maysial 550

148.contentId:
Preface by H. Frost, archivist

My name is Hugo Frost, I am the archivist for the town of Frigost. On this day of the fourth of Jullier of the year five hundred and fifty, my job is to note, in this book, all proposals linked to the agricultural competition.

My role will also consist of recording the decisions of the jury concerning each of these inventions.

Page 4: The machine which stops time

Page 5: The good hunter

Page 6: The raging inferno

Page 7: A very relaxed solution

Page 8: There are those who dig

Page 9: Grains of discord

Page 11: A convoluted proposition

Page 12: Hedge-trimmer

Page 13: A rose between two thorns

Page 15: A beastly solution

Page 16: The frugal shield

Page 17: Cultivate doubt

Page 18: Magic Beans

Page 19: The one thousand and one day Count

Page 21: Conclusion

The machine which stops time

Candidate: Bonnie Barrow

Proposal received:

Bonnie Barrow: "Good morning members of the jury, Mrs Mayor..."

"I am here to share with you my idea to make our harvests richer and more abundant. As you all know, I am a disciple of Xelor. I am convinced that by using Xelor's limitless powers, we can freeze time around the crops. So, once the plants have reached maturity, they will stay that way so we will be able to have as abundant a harvest as possible."

Jury's decision: This idea will not be chosen because of its unrealistic nature. How would you actually be able to stop time in all Frigost's fields? And what would be the real benefit, as this method would only actually freeze plants at a certain stage of their growth, but would not actually increase growth. And if we were to use the powers of Xelor to accelerate time, we'd have to use it on each plant individually. And for a field of wheat, that could be a little tedious.

The good hunter

Candidate: Clyde Parker

Proposal received:

Clyde Parker: "Hello ladies and gentlemen. Well 'ere's what I think. It's the parasites what are eating at ya. You only 'ave to look at the fields. These beasties go after your crops like an Enu after a kama. So, my idea's this: I'll 'ide in a tree by the fields and BAM! Soon as I see one of 'em beasts move, I'll shoot 'em! And if I don't see 'em move, I'll shoot 'em anyway. I'm a good Cra, me, ya know. I see somethin', I shoot it."

Jury's decision: Although not very original, this idea has brought to light a very well-known problem for farmers: animals destroying the crops. The solution is to build fences and place scarecrows in the fields. By doing so, we will avoid what you could call: 'a cra-ss accident.'

The raging inferno

Candidate: Jean-Pierre Kofkof

Proposal received:

Jean-Pierre Kofkof: "Members of the jury, I have the solution. You're going to understand, it's very simple. Have you ever heard of slash and burn? No? That's a shame, there's nothing more magnificent than fire. Yes, magnificent! We set fire to all these fields and then we replant them. Yes, set fire to everything, that's the answer. Burn it, burn it all... Ahem, excuse me, so, we burn everything, but in a very controlled way, of course. So then everything will grow better. Normally, you'd have to leave the earth to recover for a year, but this is a waste of time. We'll burn everything, all the time! I'll do it if you want. No?"

Jury's decision: Even coming from a Iop, this solution seems a little extreme. And, unless you want to eat nothing but popcorn all year, a little dangerous too.

A very relaxed solution

Candidate: Bea Fortax

Proposal received:

Bea Fortax: "Hello, I'm going to sit down, I'm so tired. Well, I've been watching you fidget all day, it's exhausting. I'm so tired. If you want abundant harvests all you have to do is ask Sadida. Just pray for them in the way which suits you best. I'll show you. First of all, a little nap, like this..."

Jury's decision: Since after her demonstration of taking a nap, Bea Fortax went to have a lie down, she still hasn't explained the rest of her idea. Exhausted by so much inactivity, the members of the jury are going to take a break themselves.

There are those who dig

Candidate: Paul Igamus

Proposal received:

Paul Igamus: "Hi guys! You all know me! Igamus, Paul Igamus. Your little problem has a very simple solution. I know that the soil in our region is packed with richness. For Enutrof's sake! All we have to do is dig to extract it, gems, minerals and other precious stones. With the money you make from this, you'll be able to buy whatever you want, including cereals if you like. Since I already have a great deal of experience in this domain, I would be happy to oversee it all. Not just anyone can look for gold, you know. Of course, I would be expecting a modest salary in exchange, let's say, half for me and half for you. That's fair. Well, don't take too long making your minds up: time is money."

Jury's decision: We don't think it's very sensible to be digging on an island. We might pierce a hole in the bottom and sink!

Grains of discord

Candidate: Fred Handed

Proposal received:

Fred Handed: "Greetings, esteemed members of the jury. I hope you will not be offended if I continue to wear this veil for the duration of our meeting. We humble disciples of Sram are accustomed to keeping ourselves masked at all times. Please do not consider it a sign of blatant disrespect. But allow me to come to the point. To overcome our distinguished agricultural rivals from the continent, a very simple solution has appeared to me. With the help of some of my fellow Sram disciples, we could borrow, at a most advantageous tariff, the continental farmers' harvests. I will leave you with the details so as not to take up any more of your precious time. Then, once sufficient time has passed, we can sell on our spoils at a good price."

Jury's decision: Following the departure of this candidate, the members of the jury spent considerable time looking for certain of the personal effects which seem to have disappeared. Needless to say, this caused them a great deal of annoyance and, as a result, they have decided not to proceed with this idea.

A convoluted proposition

Candidate: Firmin Tayshion

Proposal received:

Firmin Tayshion: "Alright guys? I was at the pub, sort of a temple for us Pandawas, when I heard about this competition. That reminded me of a technique I developed to improve hops fermentation. If you manage to increase your harvests with my idea, we could produce three or four times more beer than normal. We could even provide free beer for the poorest among us, a kind of popular pint, if you like! Here, taste that, I've brought you some of the first samples of my nectar."

Jury's decision: It's true that it's more a man's drink, there's Api in it, isn't there? Hic!

Hedge-trimmer

Candidate: Mac Spayne

Proposal received:

Mac Spayne: "Hello chickens! I'm not going to make a big song and dance about this but I have THE solution. We're going to do it the Sacrier way. All your plants, yeah, cereals or whatever you call them. We'll give them a good roasting and it'll work for them like it works for us Sacriers. What doesn't kill us makes us stronger, right? I mean, look at my biceps. That's not some saggy Kaniger! We can do the same with those wet lettuces of yours. We can turn them into men."

Jury's decision: We'll keep the suggestion in mind for making soups or vegetable stock.

A rose between two thorns

Candidate: Jon Burrowman

Proposal received:

Jon Burrowman: "Hello, hello, don't you all look lovely in your little robes. Oooh, I like this room, apart from the decoration. It needs a bit of colour, some pink, some yellow, brighten it up a bit. But we're not here to talk interior design. So, we're going to take good care of your little plants, aren't we? I've already got a plan to make them all bigger and stronger, just like you, you're all muscly, hmmm delicious. Anyway, I'm getting a bit side-tracked... Well, here it is, my petals, we're going to treat them at the root, the base of the plants and the silt. That's very good for the stalks to grow supple, strong and shiny. There you go my loves, that's all. You can get in touch with me whenever you like, especially you, you big butch man. Well, I'm off then."

Jury's decision: We're already using manure to fertilise the earth and the soil. However, could this technique also be used on hair? "Do you think you're worth it?", replied Mrs Mayor.

A beastly solution

Candidate: Diana Joan

Proposal received:

Diana Joan: "So what's this all about, you want to increase production?! That's right up my street, I'll make those crops of yours fall in line! And they'll be begging for more, I can guarantee it. We'll use animals as whips, that will help the peasants work more quickly. Don't worry, I'll be in charge of those beasts... The animals, not the peasants... So, are you all in agreement with me? It would be better for you, unless you want to be on the wrong end of my whip."

Jury's decision: Whenever we try to use animals to work in the fields, it always ends up with the same results: some of the crop gets eaten by the animals themselves. Furthermore, it would seem the disciples of Osamodas don't have the same precision with their whips as their god. Their whips have a tendency to hit anything around it.

The frugal shield

Candidate: Casper Kolator

Proposal received:

Casper Kolator: "Greetings! Kolator, Casper Kolator. Disciple of Feca, reporting for duty, Captain! Permission to speak, your honour?! Thank you, lieutenant. To protect the crops, we will form a line of defence at the border. I promise you, you're in no danger while Feca's guarding you. What?! There's no barbarian invasion? In that case, why have I been assigned to this post? With all due respect, General, this is yet another case of an administrative blunder. May I be dismissed? At your command, Admiral."

Jury's decision: Now we understand why the sheep march in such straight lines. These shepherds aren't what they used to be.

Cultivate doubt

Candidate: Quentin Flush

Proposal received:

Quentin Flush: "Friends of the game, hello! I would like to propose a little bet, I am sure we can beat those farmers from the continent. I've found a method, a bit risky of course, but you know the old Ecaflip adage: nothing ventured, nothing gained. In other words, if you try your luck with me, and I'm prepared to bet big that you will, you could double your money. I know you're clever enough to take a chance without having heard the specifics, so I'm not going to insult you by telling you what my idea is. Place your bets!"

Jury's decision: "Heads, we let him go, tails we don't keep him. Anyone got a coin?"

Magic beans

Candidate: Jamie Coggut

Proposal received:

Jamie Coggut: "Ladies and gentlemen, I am very pleased to meet you. Sadida is going to help you through his devout servant: me. Fertility, love, luck at games, Dragoturkeys that never die, Coggut can help you with anything. Give me your seeds and after a few cross-breedings, spells which only I know the secret of, your seeds will be protected from all animal attacks and evil spells. These magically modified organisms, the MMO, as I like to call them, will guarantee you victory and happiness. Have faith in me. Am I not Jamie, the lucky charm?"

Jury's decision: "A friend of mine consulted him for her horoscope. He was wrong about everything. It's kind of ironic."

The one thousand and one day Count

Candidate: Count Harebourg

Proposal received:

Count Harebourg: "My peers, I would like to pay you my respects. I am Count Harebourg and am here to help you with your quest. It is through a combination of Xelor's powers and the talents of the best artisans and countryfolk that we will manage to surpass our continental rivals. I have devised the most fabulous machine you could ever imagine. A machine that controls time. By subtly manipulating the passing of time, I will be able to prolong the seasons. We will be able to make the sunny days last and our crops will benefit from the better climate. Just imagine, dream of lingering summers. The constraints of winter will pass in the blink of an eye. It may even be possible to have several harvests in the same year. Friends, friends, I offer you my best wishes and leave you to your deliberations."

Jury's decision: This was considered to be the best proposition, especially given the insistence of Mrs Mayor. Count Harebourg will, therefore, be officially declared the winner of the agricultural competition for the year five hundred and fifty.

Conclusion

I, Hugo Frost have recorded the entirety of the interviews which took place as part of the agricultural competition for the year of five hundred and fifty. Following the votes of those who followed the considerations, the jury, presided over by Mrs Mayor, elected Count Harebourg as the winner of the competition. His proposal will therefore enter into development as soon as possible, according to the conditions established by Mrs Mayor and with the support of the citizens. This marks the end of the agricultural competition.

Septangel 550



I'm so excited! An important man from the Island of Frigost, Count Harebourg, has just told me he's interested in my work! He'd like me to join him and help him finish a very big project! Me, Hazieff Taroun, the greatest volcanologist in the world, on the world's most volcanic island! Ah, I can't wait to go!

Octolliard 550



It's been a few days since I arrived on Frigost. The island is quite simply fascinating! When I saw Mount Scauldron for the first time, I wanted to explore it straight away! Such a big mountain, standing so proudly, ready to spew out jets of lava at any moment... I've been dreaming of this for years!


Frigost's richness isn't just limited to one volcano, though. I've already noticed that the island is packed with geothermic elements, each one more impressive than the last: hot springs, geysers, fumaroles, acid lakes... There are so many wonders here I don't know where to look!


Oh boy, I need to calm down, I have so much work to do! Count Harebourg, such a great man, has explained his project in detail. I'm going to have to find a way to capture geothermic energy one way or another.

Maysial 551



Ha ha! I think I've found the answer! I've tried several types of equipment in the Tears of Ouronigride region and the tests are more or less conclusive. It's taken me months to get here, but this is it: I've found a way to store the soil's heat so that it can be turned into energy. The Count will be so pleased! Now all I need to do is climb Scauldron to see what's available on a larger scale. If everything goes well, the volcano's lava lake should be able to provide us with an almost unlimited power supply. I can't wait!

Novamaire 551



Everything's finally ready! I've finally managed to get all my equipment set up in the volcanic crater and the first few experiments have been very promising. The Count is delighted. If everything goes to plan, the machine will officially be switched on next month. Ah, I'm bubbling with impatience! I can't wait! I'm sure this invention is going to work brilliantly! Ha ha!

150.contentId:
A Land Like No Other

Frigost. With a name like that, you'd almost expect to be landing on some kind of iceberg! But, apart from a couple of very cold winter days each year, there's no ice or snow here at all! On the contrary, Frigost's climate is so mild you're can't help but enjoy yourself here!

Itinerary

Having landed at the island's charming little port, take your time and have a stroll around the lively village streets. The Neo-Frigostian architecture, unique to this island, is worth a look! If you don't know where to stay, ask the locals. You'll get such a warm welcome from the Frigostians that you'll have found food and shelter in no time!

Once you've settled in, go for a walk by the Fearless Fields. Lovers of new technology can familiarise themselves with the remarkable local agricultural techniques. The farmers here are way ahead of their time!

Need to relax? Communicate with nature? On the island you'll find numerous coastal walkways and paths which snake through the enchanted forests. The Mystified Forest to the north-west of the island is particularly worth a visit! There's talk that fairy-like creatures live there... Maybe you'll be lucky enough to see some of them!

Not the type of walk you had in mind? You prefer wild and dangerous landscapes? No problem! On Frigost, there's something for everyone! Go to Alma's Cradle and discover superb black sand beaches. Its melted rocks and sorry appearance make it one of the Brakmarians' favourite holiday resorts!

Don't miss:

The Boiling Lake

Not so long ago, this place was a collection of craters which was home to the first Frigostian village. Unfortunately, the exploitation of geothermic resources resulted in a flood. Nowadays, the boiling waters of the lake are reputed to cure stiff joints.

Tip: underneath the surface, you can still see the ruins of the submerged village.

The Tears of Ouronigride

Legend has it that, centuries ago, Ouronigride the dragon came to cry at the north of the island (or to blow his nose, depending on who you ask). From his tears (or nasal mucus) were born a multitude of geysers and hot springs which make this a paradise for steam bath and natural jacuzzi lovers!

Mount Scauldron, a volcano that's worth a visit!

A Frigostian proverb says that, when one volcano becomes extinct, another awakens. The problem with Mount Scauldron is that it can awaken without warning! In the meantime, if you don't mind braving the flow of lava, why not go up and have a look round? It's a great picnic spot. Hot ambiance guaranteed!

Tip: Clear view of Frigost Castle, unfortunately closed to the public.

152.contentId:
Nestled at the bottom of a crater, the Submerged Village wasn't always so... The heat it gave off and its protection from the cold meant it made a welcoming refuge. And, believe me, given the short-but-harsh winters that the Frigostians knew at the time, that was exactly what was needed! This crater, like the other two, was the result of volcanic explosions. Ah yes, for on top of its moderate climate and icy winter, Frigost was also known for significant volcanic activity.

The presence of Mount Scauldron, a supposedly extinct volcano, is still a reminder of that today.

But the Frigostians should have been more careful, as playing with the island's climate is like playing with fire! As it was considered Amakna's main competitor, Frigost benefited from extremely technologically advanced agriculture. As a result of this, there were a great number of experiments aimed at making the winter season milder. Eventually, after endlessly teasing Mother Nature, the Frigostians pushed her to the limit. The water levels rose, transforming the village and the two other craters into a gigantic lake. Of course, this flung the doors wide open for a new hobby: fishing. But the inescapable, immediate truth was that they needed to find a new place to live.

When the terrible accident happened, it was inevitable that some people would perish, drowned in this aquarium filled with boiling water. Others managed to cling to debris, floating to the surface of the crater where they could reach the shore. And then there were those who didn't even put up a fight: incapable of abandoning the homes they'd lived in for so many years, they allowed themselves to be quietly engulfed, floating away into memories of the past...

Whatever happened, the survivors needed to find a new place to shelter. They decided to build a village, which has since served as the hideout for Count Harebourg's critics. But that's another story...

153.contentId:
By order of the count, I, Kole Crane, foreman of the Sakai mine, officially declare the end of mining this 12 Novamaire in the year 551.


For the record, the mine was acquired by Count Harebourg himself in the year 550. It was then dug out by three teams of miners who took turns day and night to extract coal. The ore was ferried up to the Island of Frigost, to the site of the count's invention.

The ore requirements were initially estimated at 500 kilos to be extracted every eight hours, to power the invention. Finally, the requirements were revised downwards, the Count having found another source of energy. In Novamaire 551, the operation was stopped and the teams returned to the main site. The surplus was sold on the markets of Frigost and Amakna.

Signed: Kole Crane.

154.contentId:
I don't understand. I must have turned it every way I can think of, it doesn't make any sense. I was supposed to jump out of Emrub and arrive in the real world, the one you made us leave all that time ago.

But instead of that, a whirlwind in the mists of my village sucked me up, and I found myself in these desolated lands, eaten away by ice.


What did you do to this world Baltazar? Why don't you come and explain yourself?

Over and over again, always the same experiments. What is it he wants from me? I had his machine in my hands, and despite studying it furiously, could find no use for it. Cyd would have been able to help, but me? I'm useless.

Count sent me to an island called Sakai. There's an old abandoned mine where he asked me to wait. He thinks I'm unique, and that people with bad intentions are going to want to exploit my powers.

I discovered that the world was inhabited. I've even met the inhabitants of this country they call "Frigost".

The gods exist, I am in their kingdom: the World of Twelve gods! They have many disciples – not always all that clever though. Brutes with swords that call themselves Iops. The long-haired ones, the Sadidas. The dwarves whose eyes light up when they see gold, the Enutrofs.

The Xelor calls himself "Count Harebourg". He seems to be quite an important person.

158.contentId:
I was right!!

Do you see that, old Dragon? I dared to cross the limits of our world. The vortex of mist called out to me, as it was written. I jumped from Emrub.

I have been searching this world of ice for answers ever since. It may be cold and empty, but I am finally free.

And I am far from you.

160.contentId:
I am Dyhas, the intrepid adventurer, and I am always ready to explore new horizons!


I have been given the opportunity to take part in an expedition, a voyage of discovery to the famous Sakai Island. I heard about it today from John Lorke the sailor. His description of the island quickly piqued my curiosity! Just imagine: an island with a harsh winter climate; the perfect place to strengthen the body and mind!


So I asked John to take me there. He gave me a discount on the ticket and everything... I simply couldn't resist!


If all goes well, we'll leave for the island paradise in two weeks! I've already started packing my bags!

1st day



During the journey, John told me about his previous stay on the island and shared his observations with me. He advised me not to venture too deep into the forest. Apparently, ferocious monsters lurk there. Pfft! Ferocious? Probably plain old Crackrocks with a layer of frost over them!


The crossing was long, but it was worth it! The island looks really beautiful, although I haven't had time to visit it yet. I thought it a better idea to set up camp before night fell. The real exploration will begin tomorrow! I can't wait! I've already scoped out some places that look interesting and I hope to discover something!

2nd day



The day started beautifully! The island hides many more secrets than I ever dared to hope. The vegetation is highly resistant to the cold – much more than I am, anyway! The forest is huge. I made sure to retrace my footsteps for fear of getting lost. On my way back, I crossed snowy plains where the wind was so cold that I almost froze solid! I quickly returned to the harbour and the abandoned inn. The island looks completely uninhabited, but fortunately, I have enough food to last a good while. I like it here.

3rd day



I made a strange discovery today. I found some unknown symbols engraved on some stones near my camp. I've only seen three so far, but I wonder if there might be more. I haven't managed to decipher the origin of these mysterious symbols.


Tomorrow I...

Phew! I really thought that I wouldn't make it out of there! They almost got me! Next time, I'll avoid approaching them, especially when they're in small groups. It turns out my hiding place wasn't as good as I thought it was. I should be more careful... And I left all my things there too! I was foolish to take so much equipment. I returned to the mine entrance to extract a piece of stone, and heard noises coming from inside. My curiosity prevailing over my fear, I put my things on the ground and I went inside. The mine was closed down and very little light could penetrate, yet something seemed to burn and illuminate the gallery's interior. I approached the light source, carefully, and what I saw amazed me! Goblins!

Goblins live in the depths of this mine, on this deserted island! I immediately hid behind a piece of rock and observed them. One of them spoke of a huge gold nugget hidden in the mine. This revelation immediately motivated me to find out more!

I will try to approach them a little closer, and will continue my report later.

The torches are always lit, but it is strangely cold. A cold different to that outside. I don't like it!

Unfortunately for him, hidden amongst the crops were several MMOs, organisms magically modified by Jamie Coggut. Eating them led to irreversible changes.
