212.contentId:
Information Sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Sram: p. 6

Typical Expressions: p. 8

The Sram's Profile

Speciality: Sneaky, Thieving Tactician

Strong Points: hitting, binding, positioning

Key Characteristic: Strength, Agility, Intelligence

Primary Spells: Tricky Trap, Deviousness, Invisibility

Favourite Tactics:

  1. placing traps in strategic places so that enemies will set them off by stepping over them
  2. moving around invisibly
  3. pushing opponents away
  4. summoning a double to encumber or block the enemy
  5. inflicting severe damage at short range

Introduction

Neither young nor restless, the bald without the beautiful...

Beware of any Srams who seem to be sending sneaky glances your way. Before you know it, you'll be stripped of your cherished belongings, especially the most expensive ones! If you only learn one thing about followers of the skull-headed god, let it be this: they love everything that dangles, especially rounded pouches... They're also always on the lookout for loose tongues, because anyone who might be a source of useful information interests them... Riffling through the tails of a tunic, feeling the bottom of a pocket, exercising their nimble fingers, and finally holding long-desired jewels in their hands are just a few of a Sram's favourite things.

Robbers, pilferers, shoplifters, snatchers, plunderers and cheaters! They are often where we don't want to see them: in bank vaults, dark alleyways and at the end of our pouch strings.

What you looking at?

To master their art, Srams submit themselves to a severe training regime that would make mere mortals go white with fear. To be honest, when Srams first find out about it, they go white with fear too, but since they have such a pale complexion, no one notices. The neophyte's aim is to become extremely supple and to control his senses and his Chakras perfectly. Believe me, it can be really useful! Mastering this art will enable him to dislocate a joint so as to voluntarily sneak into very narrow places. Srams are not afraid of tight spaces... as long as there are kamas hidden inside. This set of secret techniques is called the Kama Sutars.

The Worship of Sram

The God Sram

The god Sram is unshakeable. He never reveals his emotions and always speaks in the same monotone without ever losing his cool. It's a quality he actually passed onto his disciples just like he did with his physical appearance, but the latter tends to be a less desirable trait.

Don't be fooled by appearances when in the presence of the god Sram, because he can make you believe anything about him - as long as it serves his own interests. The fact that people think he's an absolute idiot from the cosmic sticks doesn't bother him at all. In fact, he is calculating, manipulative and merciless. Don't you forget it!

The Sram Temple

Reminiscent of the old step pyramids whose sides used to flow with the blood of sacrificed beings, the Sram Temple towers up in the Crackler mountain. It looks as though it has been ravaged by darkness and wild vegetation, but the shadows on its walls go a lot deeper than those cast by the sun... Followers who visit this temple have curious powers. They can spring traps up from the shadows and can melt into the shade. This last power offers an infinite source of pranks to mischievous Srams.

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Sram

An old legend says that Srams aren't scared of anything, but in fact, they're as scared as anyone else... it's just less obvious. As a result, there are loads of expressions:

By Sram's nose and beard: be tricked; the ultimate Sramery as Srams have neither noses nor beards...

To lie like a Sram: Srams are famous for skilfully manipulating others. Telling lies is one of their specialties.

Once a Sram, always a Sram: proverb taught to young Srams to encourage them to steal. "No matter what you steal, whether it's a Tofu or a Gobball or both - once a Sram, always a Sram".

There's a bone in my soup: something strange is going on... something really strange!

To be hollow-nosed: is said of a Sram whose intuitions are usually good.

To grow old bones: "He won't grow old bones, this one!" His adventurous behaviour is going to cost him his life!

Am Sram Gram: the full expression is "to draw lots with Am Sram Gram". This is actually the Sram version of the Eenie Meenie Miney Moe rhyme. They usually use it to draw lots to find out who will start a perilous mission.

To offer one's own bone: when a Sram offers a bone to a Sramette, it's like saying ""I love you""... a sign of deep affection.

Sram touches one without moving the other: composure and staying still are two of the most important qualities for a Sram spy. This is the winning Sram comeback in response to an aggressive comment: "I'm gonna smash your skull, Sram!" "Sram'll touch one without moving the other...!"

I'm licking my bones just thinking about it: what a Sram usually says when craving action.

213.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Cra: p. 6

Typical Expressions: p. 8

The Cra's Profile

Speciality: archer, long-range attacks

Strong points: hitting, binding, support

Key characteristics: Intelligence, Strength, Agility

First spells: Magic Arrow, Poisoned Arrow, Retreat Arrow

Favourite tactics:

  1. harassing opponents by making arrows rain down on them

  2. keeping the enemy at a distance by pushing it back

  3. stealing life

  4. inflicting penalties on the adversary (reduced range, slower movement, decreased action...)

Introduction

Only an arrow will do

It's hard to tell what's going on in a Cra's head when you're not one of them, but let's just say they seem to be gifted with the innate science of the projectile. A young Cra can shoot down a Moskito with spit weighed down by sugary sweets. The meetings behind the public urinal at the Trool Fair made Cras famous (because their jets are very long, if not the longest). Cra archers can carve a projectile out of just about any material, including the rarest ones, just by following their instinct. For instance, a Treechnid branch, once carved, can be of a surprising long range. Cras' craftsmanship became renowned thanks to their bow jobs, in which they take both pride and pleasure.

Show me your arrow and I'll tell you who you are

Hair blowing in the wind, slender silhouette, chiselled muscle structure, chest thrown out: the Cra disciple is proud, that's for sure. They are precious allies against melee attacks. Standing back from the ruckus, they shoot their feathered arrows into any opening left unattended, and they really hurt! That's why they're so popular for hunting and combat groups, in which they are known to have saved many allies. Of course, when Cras are forced to enter close combat, they find it harder to stand their ground... but you can't have it all!

The Worship of Cra

The Goddess Cra

Her beauty is as fearsome as her arrows... apparently, only her disciples can look at her without falling head over heels in love! Her followers must develop a pure, unfailing devotion to her... which isn't as easy as it sounds when she's demonstrating how to handle bows as effectively as possible...

The Cra Temple

Built just an arrow's flight from the Xelor Temple and designed in real Cra style, the temple is full of everything an archer disciple craving thrills could hope for. Incidentally, this temple looks more like an arms factory than a place of worship. The explanation is simple: Cra archers believe that skilfully bashing out bows and arrows is the best ways to honour their goddess.

Typical expressions - How to speak Cra

To hit the Moskito in the eye: to fire right on target.

Take a bow! Take a bow!: Cra war cry to be shouted either before a fight or after a rousing speech by a fellow Cra.

One opponent, one arrow: axiom of Cra philosophy.

Another one that Bworks won't get: is said of the last arrow shot, leaving an empty quiver.

An arrow shot and a relieved Cra: describes an urgent situation for which a solution has been found.

When the bow is bent, you have to shoot: in other words, you are responsible for your actions.

When you just have to fire at someone, go for a chubby one: Cra logic.

To pull on strings: to play with the emotions of others to get what you want.

To overbend the bow: this expression wouldn't be used very often as it is considered sacrilege among Cras. If you happen to hear it, it means to know no limits, to go too far, as in "I can't believe he actually did this! This time, he really overbent the bow!"

214.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Ecaflip: p. 6

Typical expressions : p. 8

The Ecaflip's profile

Speciality: master of chance

Strong points: hitting, binding, healing

Key characteristics: Strength

First spells: Heads or Tails, Ecaflip's Luck, Catnip

Favourite tactics:

  1. hoping that a spot of luck will allow his attack to do major damage

  2. moving by jumping from cell to cell

  3. laying his life on the line by risking serious spell repercussions

  4. casting spells with unpredictable effects on allies and enemies alike

  5. increasing his performance, and his chances of winning, with bonuses

Introduction

For All the kamas in the World

What's the life of a disciple of Ecaflip like? It's a life of getting into sticky situations, landing a windfall and then swiftly losing just as much if not more... If you're in a tavern and you hear somebody betting kamas, you can be sure there's an Ecaflip around, he'll either be betting or looking carefully at the scene, rolling a coin between his fingers... A happy Ecaflip gambles all the time, for everything and for nothing - but be careful, he takes gambling very seriously. He can even risk his life on a throw of the dice. Do you know anyone that crazy? Pretty sure I don't.

The Ecaflip mind set is clear on one thing: there's no such thing as a coincidence. To the layman, they appear to leave things to good fortune or misfortune, but the Ecaflip disciple knows that when he decides to play, it's his destiny!

For a few kamas more...

Ecaflips are great warriors skilled in both team fights and solo fights. It ought to be noted, though, that if an Ecaflip is going to fight with other adventurers, his teammates would do well to have a similar life philosophy... Although Ecaflip magic is renowned for its destructive powers, it is also governed by the laws of fate and can backfire on the allies that it's supposed to support, hence the misunderstandings and even the insults exchanged on battlefields. It's true that when an Ecaflip prepares to cast "All or Nothing", it can be quite harrowing for both enemies and allies!

The Worship of Ecaflip

The God Ecaflip

Only confirmed gamblers can appear to the god Ecaflip. They are the only ones who will find mercy in the eyes of the god and who can receive his favours. As for the others, some clever kitties will be shown what their future holds, but you can bet that the god Ecaflip, always a bit mischievous, will send anyone he doesn't like to the beyond... but give them a chance to escape...

The Ecaflip Temple

West of the Amakna garrison, overhanging the Asse River, stands the Ecaflip Temple. According to Ecaflip tradition, the architect who designed it had to bet its construction spot on a throw of the dice, knowing that his god would express himself through them. The god chose to have his temple built over the Asse waters. As a result, its construction was a pretty bold undertaking, since Ecaflips don't really like water.

Typical expressions - How to speak Ecaflip

To be as lucky as an Ecaflip: it's true! Ecaflips can be very lucky sometimes, and it's enough to make other warriors envious!

Not keeping the change: means "to play fair and square".

Weighted die: refers to both hypocrites and traitors.

An ace of spades: is said of an Ecaflip perfectly equipped for monster tracking, or who likes heavy metal.

Pussyfooting around: lovey-dovey behaviour popular among young Ecaflips.

Cat got your tongue?: If you don't have pointy ears or a bushy tail, then beware of this question ... the god Ecaflip only knows what could happen to your tongue!

Once wet, twice shy: expression of distrust. After all, Ecaflips are wary around all liquids and avoid any kind of long-lasting contact with water.

The Spade Club: a derogatory expression used to talked about fallen opponents in a fight.

To Ecaflip out: an expression which describes an Ecaflip whose sixth sense is warning him of something... or who's just a scaredy cat!

To lay one's cards on the table: to show one's talents as a fighter.

215.contentId:
Information Sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Eniripsa: p. 6

Typical Expressions: p. 8

The Eniripsa Profile

Speciality: healer

Strong Points: healing, binding, support

Key Characteristic(s): intelligence

Primary Spells: Curative Word, Forbidden Word, Frightening Word

Favourite Tactics:

  1. healing allies or playing vampires by stealing enemies' health points
  2. boosting action points for themselves and their allies
  3. preventing enemies from moving or attacking
  4. reducing future damage early, rather than healing too late!
  5. removing bewitchments with their rejuvenating skills
  6. frightening enemies off

Introduction

Hand on your heart...

Wow! These guys aren't like the others! Whereas most adventurers cross the World with the hope of punching you in the face (or kicking you in the backside), Eniripsas use their hands for something completely different: they heal the good, the bad, and sometimes (actually, often) even the ugly!

With one hand on their hearts and the other cupped like a megaphone, Eniripsas base their magic on words which can heal or hurt according to their needs. Needless to say, when they open their mouths, everyone listens carefully...

Is that all you have to say?

All Eniripsa magic relies on their words, which have become famous all around the World. Some are famous for their "good words" and others for their "bad words". Some Eniripsas even become word hunters, collecting verbs and foraging for forgotten languages. Eniripsas are often seen talking to shady and disreputable people, but they're just trying to get precious vocabulary from them...

The Worship of Eniripsa

The Goddess Eniripsa

Eniripsa is a witty divinity who is curious about anything and everything. Some people even believe she's a little too curious, claiming that she loves to meddle in other people's business... The other gods appreciate her ineffable kindness and extreme sensitivity, but be careful, as being "sensitive" isn't the same as being "faint-hearted". As a matter of fact, an Eniripsa can mend a freshly ripped open paunch without batting an eyelid.

The Eniripsa Temple

Not far from the Osamodas Temple there stands a strange edifice with a roof of glass and pillars lit up by a soft, warm glow. The whole building seems to emanate peace. This is the sacred place where Eniripsa's disciples come to worship their goddess. Ruffians, barbarians and Iops will hurry past, looking down, as they feel uneasy and somewhat humbled by all that harmony and sensitivity. Those who do decide to take a look inside certainly feel comforted by all the colourful flowers – though some of them are too proud to let themselves be treated by the Divine Practitioner.

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Eniripsa

Having one's heart in one's mouth: during fights, Eniripsas sometimes heal desperate cases. A missing arm here, a leg there. Their allies' anatomy is rearranged so drastically that sometimes their hearts end up in their mouths. But don't worry, an Eniripsa can put it right.

Putting one's heart into one's work: Eniripsas love their work, and this expression proves it. What's more, they usually sing jaunty tunes as they wade through guts and smashed brains on battlefields.

Sticks and stones might break your bones, but harmful words are better: Eniripsas are perfect wordsmiths. When they want to be insulting, their Words really hit where it hurts: "Your exhalation is as malodorous as that of a Bwork – it's as though you regularly consume household refuse. And you're a minger!"

Use veiled words: be diplomatic. "What an odd fragrance, worthy of a representative of the Bworks... Could your rear orifice be as round as a full moon in Aperirel?"

The heartless are at a loss for words: Eniripsa proverb warning of the consequences of renouncing one's goddess.

Crossed hearts: expression used to describe mutual love between two Eniripsas.

Cure-all: Universal medicine and the cure for all, sought by Eniripsa alchemists. Also used to refer to an exciting situation: "Wow, what a cure-all! I finally learned the Cawwot spell!"

As altruistic as an Eniripsa: Expression derived from Eniripsa enchantments (which, it must be said, often benefit their allies).

Textual healing: an expression which highlights Eniripsas' way with words as well as their love of soul. Not to be confused with "Healing text", a euphemism for the incomparable beauty of Eniripsas and how they turn a phrase.

How do you want me to say it?: expression used to imply that the listener is unable to do something easy. Taken from the famous song, "If I say it, they will come; all will see how you are dumb. If I say it, they will go; all will see what you don't know."

Youth for a day, youth for eternity: expression emphasising the loyalty and fidelity Eniripsas have for their allies.

216.contentId:
Information Sheet: pg. 3

Introduction: pg. 4

The Worship of Enutrof: pg. 6

Typical Expressions: pg. 8

The Enutrof Profile

Speciality: treasure hunter and manipulator of abilities

Strong Points: binding, hitting, summoning

Key Characteristic(s): chance

Primary Spells: Living Bag, Shovel Throwing, Coin Throwing

Favourite Tactics:

  1. attacking using mighty shovel blows in the teeth or coins in the eyes
  2. changing a battle's course by altering the fighters' abilities
  3. protecting themselves using a Living Bag
  4. using Ghostly Shovel to try to remove bewitchments
  5. leaving victorious battles with bulging pockets thanks to a living chest that happens to love prospecting...

Introduction

Fingers in the Air!

A long time ago, Enutrofs set up a sign language based only on movements and figures they traced with their fingers. Their reason for creating such a language remains unknown, but some say that Enutrofs can use it to communicate without any of the creatures wandering about the Abyss realising it. Others believe that Enutrofs combine geometrical figures drawn with their fingers to encrypt access to their treasures. Others prefer to think that it's a ritual way of shielding the nose from the after-effects of the sickening explosions of underground gases (the notorious firedamp farts that have left many an adventurer unconscious). Whatever the truth is, it was this habit that gave the Enutrof religion its name.

A Finger in Every Pie

Enutrofs are interested in any goods, items, and creatures that they can turn into kamas. Besides that, the first thing Enutrofs do when they meet other adventurers is to get their measure with a single look. It's true. In the eyes of an Enutrof, an adventurer is a rich source of goods, often bedecked in items. Enutrofs also talk a lot: often all sorts of nonsense about this and that, but also about things they're interested in, like the price of Gobball wool in Astrub, or if it's possible to find Treechnid Amber at a good price near Bonta, those sorts of things... If adventurers listen carefully, they may well be able to get their hands on knick-knacks and charms... for a small fee, of course.

The Worship of Enutrof

The God Enutrof

A huge, divine dragon, his body is a mixture of molten magma and melted gold, and he can change anything he wants into shiny gold. That's where his disciples' insatiable desire for gold and treasure comes from. Being an avid treasure hunter, he travels all over the vast Universe and its numerous worlds, looking for rare and precious substances. He understands the souls of Dragons well, since he's related to them.

The Enutrof Temple

The god Enutrof is pragmatic, so it should come as no surprise that his followers converted part of their temple into a mine. They even added a section dedicated to the knowledge of underground worlds. Naturally drawn to deep caverns, Enutrofs started to criss-cross the bowels of the World: zigzagging in between lumps of earth and blocks of clay, cutting a path through masses of shale and manganese, dissecting mineral blocks – it was such a huge job that we ought to be thankful to the Enutrofs, as nobody else would have done it. These cavern-dwellers learned all there was to know about stones and gems – to their great advantage, obviously – not least because very often the carcasses of creatures dead for many years were well preserved, with all their treasures intact. Drawing up the long inventory of their discoveries, Enutrofs became experts in item recovery.

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Enutrof

Enutrofs from Astrub have a pretty weird accent, and often throw in strange slang expressions too.

Methinks...: when an Enutrof gives you his opinion, it's because it's in his best interest. Beware!

My! Ya not f'om around he'e, so me repeat it aaall again foya: Enutrofs from Astrub often use a dialect that is hard for foreigners to understand. Ask them even just once to repeat what they've said and they will make you feel like a real country bumpkin for not understanding the local lingo.

A cheap joke: Enutrofs' favourite type of joke, these are ten-a-kama.

Talk to my shovel, my head's on sick leave: indicates a considerable lack of interest.

Put to bed with a shovel: dead or seriously wounded. "A battle 'gainst Dark Vlad? You's lucky we didn't put you t'bed with a shovel that night!"

To have bags under one's eyes: simply means "to always be sniffing out potential ways to get kamas". Usually used approvingly of young Enutrofs: "He's a good lad, bags under his eyes already!"

Opening a can of worms: creating a difficult situation that might lead to serious repercussions. This expression comes from when underground Enutrof teams would collect handfuls of worms and fling them at one another, usually leading to light-hearted tussles.

Calling a spade a spade: being blunt or forthright, which Enutrofs tend to be, until money comes into it, at which point they become real smooth talkers.

To shovel lots of kamas: when digging, Enutrofs can value, at a glance, the amount of kamas they'll make from what's inside their shovel. Hence the expression, "I shovelled lots of kamas today!"

Pulling something out of the bag: coming up with a brilliant plan B (or C, or D...). When treasure is involved, even plan Z is not unheard of. However, these plans may be dangerous to non-Enutrofs. Variation:

Let the cat out of the bag: finding out that brilliant plan B (or C, or D...) was not as brilliant as once thought. Often used when moving on to the next letter in the alphabet, usually in combination with the former: "I almost pulled it out of the bag, but instead I let the cat out of the bag. Time for plan G."

217.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Feca: p. 6

Typical expressions: p. 8

The Feca's profile

Speciality: protector and defender

Strong points: support, tank, binding

Key characteristic: Intelligence

First spells: Earth Armour, Natural Attack, Aggressive Glyph

Favourite tactics:

  1. reducing damage inflicted using magic shields and various elemental armours

  2. placing glyphs which slow down or injure all fighters in their areas of effect

  3. blocking attacks by reflecting spells back at the caster

  4. blinding enemies to reduce their ability to act

  5. declaring truces between fighters

Introduction

Feca helps those who help themselves

Fecas are excellent protectors. In fact, they pride themselves on being brilliant guards to whom even the wisest adventurers entrust their most precious items with complete confidence. Their reputation is firmly established in this field, even though they're usually not looking for honour or glory and would rather stay in the shadows.

Honest, loyal and upright, Fecas only have one defect: they can't stand being made to look like fools. Never compare a Feca disciple to a walking locker or safe, as you might just be asking for a staff blow in your face or across your bum cheeks, which would be a lot more painful and would make you look silly in front of everyone.

Shepherd staff

We've already noted that Fecas like discretion - it's pretty obvious, for Feca's sake! When bearded wise men entrust you with precious items to protect, you don't go shouting it from the rooftops of Amakna. It's also in Fecas' nature to be good shepherds, and, by extension, good priests and spiritual guides. They either bring the lost sheep back to the right path or lead them to the slaughterhouse. Fecas are appreciated within groups because of their protective powers but also because they master the staff like no one else.

The Worship of Feca

The Goddess Feca

Though her disciples sometimes catch her admiring herself in the reflection of her shield, they never make any comments. The goddess Feca is a bit of a flirt but is also quite touchy and temperamental. She is extremely distrustful towards Rushu, the sovereign demon. She always suspects that he's preparing a dirty trick, despite his innocent expression (I mean, what kind of demon has an innocent expression?!).

The Feca Temple

The Feca Temple can be found on the Asse Coast. There are few Gobballs and Gobblies around it, placed there by Feca disciples to act as guards. If you've ever come up close to one of them, you'll know that their bites can be pretty painful. And if you haven't, it'd be a good idea to keep any muffin-tops and beer bellies under wraps whilst approaching the temple, because these animals will chew on anything.

Typical expressions - How to speak Feca

May the goddess shield you: a polite expression used when parting ways with a fellow Feca.

Using only one's shield: is said to either refer to a tough action or an action that requires great physical efforts to be carried out.

As tasty as a boiled Gobbly black pudding: gastronomic praise. Boiled Gobbly black pudding is a meal very much appreciated by Fecas.

Black Gobbly of the family: a rebel who behaves unlike the rest of his fellow Fecas.

Shepherd's piebald: when a Feca comes back from battle covered in marks and bruises reminiscent of a piebald Gobball. "He was only up against two Arachnees but have you seen him today? Shepherd's piebald!"

Counting Allister's Gobblies: a trick to send Feca children to sleep.

Speaking Gobballdigook: being so annoyed or upset that all you can do is babble incoherently.

Feca pure wool: to be fit to be a Feca representative.

To push the Gobbly too far: to exaggerate a little too much.

218.contentId:
Information Sheet: pg. 3

Introduction: pg. 4

The Worship of Iop: pg. 6

Typical Expressions: pg. 8

The Iop Profile

Speciality: close combat warrior

Strong points: hitting hard, support, positioning

Key Characteristic(s): strength

Primary Spells: Pressure, Jump, Intimidation

Favourite Tactics:

  1. doing damage
  2. hitting again and again and inflicting well-placed injuries
  3. amplifying the strength of allies' attacks
  4. teleporting onto enemies to teach them how to die
  5. pushing enemies violently, preferably against hard stone walls

Introduction

A Sword, Enemies: Life Is Great!

One thing's for sure: you can't change a Iop! Once you appreciate this and are fully aware of it, you will get along with them much better. To be more efficient and gain time, some Iops reduce their vocabulary to about twenty words, which is enough for their daily needs: eat, drink, sleep, and fight. Eat again, drink again, sleep again and fight again... eat some more, drink some more, and fight some more. They do know how to use their weapons, though, and that's enough to keep them happy. To give them some credit, they have a great range of insults that they tend to use when fighting: scabby Gobbly, Larva liver, Bloplicker, Trool droppings, and so on. And all in all, Iops simply love their lives!

The Glory and Darkness of Iops

Their impetuousness can make them the best of warriors... and the worst! Some Iops, such as the knight Rish Claymore, are famous for their strength and bravery. Others delight in violence and barbarity and have written their names in bloody letters on the wall of the World's history. Eratz the Protester might be the best example.

The Worship of Iop

The God Iop

The name "Iop's heart" has misled a lot of people, because if you think a Iop has a heart, you're mistaken! For some people, the heart symbolises love, friendship and little girls running through sunny, flowery meadows, but not for Iop and his disciples; this vital organ only interests them when they can rip it out of their enemies chests, still beating! Another characteristic of the god Iop is that he despises the weak. It's kind of mean, but that's just the way he is, and he'll never change!

The Iop Temple

According to legend, this temple was built in one day by Iop himself, but this appears to be another cock-and-bull story invented by a Iop drunk on his ancestors' glory. Indeed, research in the archives of Amakna would suggest that this edifice was built by a number of courageous followers. I can picture those proud builders: sweating, with aching muscles, harassed by Moskitos, running the risk of slipping on greasy Larvae and smashing their faces off the ground, stinking of Arachnee, and fighting the surrounding vermin every inch of the way, just to be able to celebrate the glory of Iop at the end of it. You know you're a Iop when you'll go through that just to hear divine words of wisdom such as "Fighting feels great, doesn't it?" or "A fist-fight a day keep the sadness at bay." You really do need to be a Iop to appreciate the finer points of such philosophy.

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Iop

Iops don't have a huge vocabulary, but there are still a few colourful expressions around.

To have blood on one's hands: not necessarily a good thing for a normal person, this is a sign that a Iop has had a good day.

Get an eyeful of metal: when an enemy surrenders too rapidly, without fighting enough in the Iop's opinion, a blade is placed under the enemy's nose – or in their eye.

That wouldn't break three legs on a Tofu: used to signify that something is disappointing: "Hunting Arachnees wouldn't break three legs on a Tofu."

You're in agony... so what?: reply to be addressed to an opponent begging for mercy.

I could taste the blood: an expression of impatience.

One-hit wonder: an enemy who dies after one attack. Always a mixture of pride and disappointment for Iops.

To be a Iop-brain: for a Iop, this means "to be on form". For anyone else, it means "to be so out of it that your brain just isn't working."

I hit, therefore I am: axiom of Iop philosophy.

Yeah, yeah, when Bworks fly: to put off what you have to do until another day.

Djaul in Descendre, tons to lay inta: Iop proverb referring to Descendre and its protector. When he appears during this season, winter will be full of fights... a good thing, since fights mean glory!

219.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Osamodas: p. 6

Typical expressions: p. 8

The Osamodas' profile

Speciality: creature summoner

Strong points: summoning, support, healing

Key characteristics: Vitality, Intelligence

First spells: Summoning of Tofu, Ghostly Claw, Bear Cry

Favourite tactics:

  1. summoning an army of creatures to confront large numbers of enemies

  2. slowing down enemies' progress by sharing out their summons' attacks

  3. reviving allies fallen in combat

  4. healing allies or increasing their health points

  5. whipping stubborn summons

Introduction

You either got it or you don't (a summons)

Osamodas are probably the only adventurers who can spend time in the Evil Forest at night without being scared of the ominous cries that echo through the trees. Cawing Crows? Whispering Evil Tofus? Winking eyes? Nope, nothing scares them, because they know everything about all creatures. They can read the hearts of beasts like open books. Any creature endowed with an ounce of common sense will avoid an Osamodas' gaze for fear of surrendering itself to him. After all, who knows what an Osamodas might do with a captured creature...

Osamodas's followers have a power that anyone would love to have: they can summon creatures and use them in fights. It's rumoured that these excellent tamers cut their clothes from the skin of their enemies, but you'll have to ask an Osamodas whether it's true or not... And you'll see for yourself when you end up as a boot or a fur-lined beanie!

How to train your inner dragon

Osamodas claim they are distantly related to dragons, and it's true that their tails are quite dragon-like, as are their horns and breath. These attributes all help them to win the trust of animals more easily. Osamodas's worshippers venerate dragons and there are statues of the magical creatures adorning the entrance to their temple. Their god doesn't take offence at this since he likes them too! As a matter of fact, his followers' most powerful summons is a Wyrmling. To their owners' great joy, these young Dragons can crush enemies to pulp any day of the week, except Sunday, when they'll be turned into roasted kebabs, as this is the traditional feasting day.

The Worship of Osamodas

The God Osamodas

Silent and solitary, Osamodas prefers the company of creatures to that of people, and he passes this liking for monsters onto his disciples. He can summon any creature in the Universe as he knows them all and speaks their languages. He used to be an aggressive god who got carried away easily, and he has quite an eventful past as a conqueror of universes. Legend says that his long coat is made from skins cut off his enemies. Even if you don't believe that, he's a scary guy with an imposing reputation!

The Osamodas Temple

Three dragon statues guard the entrance of the Osamodas Temple. People say that the three dragons were originally painted: one was white, another black and the last was multicoloured. But during one celebration in honour of the god, a jovial race through Ingalsses' Fields degenerated into a terrible dispute which brought all sorts of spite and bad feeling bubbling to the surface... Fights started, Tofus and Gobballs were summoned, and the chaos spread right to the temple. Soon, the statues were spattered with Tofu blood. You can still see traces of the race in the Ingalsses' Fields: two circles linked by a straight line... Tourists tend to think the symbol has something to do with aliens... Hammer Smiths might find it interesting to talk to Zeurg, who keeps an eye on things in the temple and possesses all the necessary tools to practice this profession.

Typical expressions - How to speak Osamodas

Summon's been eating my porridge: a famous line from an Osamodas fairy-tale, which is also used to complain whenever a summons misbehaves itself.

To have other Bow Meows to tame: to have other things to do.

Locking horns: when two Osamodas fight over a girl... can be used literally or figuratively. As for female rivals, they tend to go in for tail-pulling.

As meek as a Tofu: this is a very ironic expression as a tamed Tofu is a merciless, bloodthirsty, fighting creature.

To rain Bow Meows and Bow Wows: is used to describe bad weather.

To cry Boowolf: to raise the alarm when there's nothing to be alarmed about.

I'm so hungry I could eat a Boowolf: to be famished.

To be like a Moskito without wings: to be destitute, dispossessed of one's properties.

To look like the Bow Meow that swallowed the Tofu: to look very pleased with oneself.

Star-crossed larvae: an expression that Osamodas use to describe a lovelorn couple whose relationship is simply not meant to be.

Plenty of other Prespics in the field : an expression meant to comfort a former star-crossed larva, but which probably only suggests that they'll get stung again. Aww.

220.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Sacrier: p. 6

Typical expressions: p. 8

The Sacrier's profile

Speciality: enduring pain-sufferer

Strong points: tank, positioning, hitting

Key characteristic: Vitality

First spells: Forced Punishment, Sacrier's Foot, Attraction

Favourite tactics:

  1. taking hits to hit back even harder and really punish enemies

  2. getting enemies' attention by pulling them closer

  3. changing places with other fighters, or sacrificing themselves to protect allies

  4. increasing the power of allies' attacks by suffering damage on their behalf

  5. dodging attacks

Introduction

The Sacrier - a great buddy!

Sacriers are always on the lookout for other adventurers to fight with, even though their physical appearance doesn't always help - they're not exactly ugly... especially the girls... but they're not the best-looking class either, especially if you always trust first impressions. Meeting a Sacrier in the moonlight is an especially nerve-racking experience: his proud, muscular, sinewy silhouette, his forearms covered in a thick layer of blood, his glassy eyes gazing into yours... in short, you'd be better off on his side than against him! Fortunately for them, Sacriers have a great sense of humour. Grinning from ear to ear, a Sacri will never tire of asking you to hit him ("Go on! As hard as you can!") and is one of the rare examples of adventurers who will play the "Stop hitting yourself!" game all alone. In company, he'll delight everyone with his jokes about massacre and bloodshed, and his favourite party trick is juggling his enemies' organs. In short, he's a great guy to have around, and the perfect warrior companion!

It's incredible how much you can do with meat

Curious by nature, Sacriers are fascinated by anatomy. Spiteful gossips say it's actually an obsession, hence their reputation as weirdos (as admiring swollen muscles or the working of joints is pretty odd...). Sacriers are renowned for being caught poking and prodding at things and generally putting their fingers everywhere, to the delight of some men and the terror of more women. Though their habits might seem confusing, they're very useful for the magic they practise!

They are naturally good butchers, since they have a passion for chopping meat, and gutting carcasses with their bare hands. If they embrace their spiritual path, they can become very clever soothsayers. As they do not fear blows or injuries, they are great on the front line and are very much appreciated by groups of adventurers.

The Worship of Sacrier

The Goddess Sacrier

One of the last to enter the Pantheon of gods, this beautiful, rebellious and opportunist goddess endures suffering with serenity. Paradoxically, though, she can't stand seeing human beings in agony. Most of the time, her fanciful shows of mercy towards the weak and the oppressed are closely followed by vengeful anger towards the strong and oppressive. Her intense beauty and her masterly fighting techniques make her a fervently venerated goddess. She sometimes appears on deserted battlefields to drop a tear of sympathy on the earth where blood and defeated soldiers lie.

The Sacrier Temple

The Sacrier Temple was built under a waterfall, and the only indication of where to find the entrance is a symbol painted on an overhanging rock. The reasoning behind this concept is a well-guarded secret and you'll be hard pushed to find a Sacrier who will explain it to you. In the mean time, we'll just have to suppose that they have a good reason for going to such efforts to hide their hideout. Perhaps it has something to do with the fact that the goddess Sacrier's arrival in our World aroused Rushu's anger... in the list of things a place of worship should be protected from, a demon's vengeful anger must be fairly high...

Typical expressions - How to speak Sacrier

The word "blood" obviously features quite often in Sacrier discourse... not in every expression, but in most of them, to be honest. Here is a little anthology... they tend to speak for themselves:

Blood is thicker than water: this you would say to a Sacrier whom you trust.

I call this one the heart-stopper!: if a Sacrier says this to you, one foot raised, you really, really ought to run...

Hit me, baby, several more times!: cry used by Sacriers in battle to anger and spur on their enemies.

To sweat blood: Sign of great personal effort and exclamation of joy after a tight fight, for instance "Raahh! I gave him a real hammering! I sweated blood!"

To be of true blood: this is the ultimate praise a Sacrier father can say to his son. It means he's really proud of what he has achieved.

Burst a blood vessel: take one too many hits and go berserk on the enemy!

To bruise someone: to greet someone in a friendly way. The ritual consists of hitting a soft body part with a hard one. For example: to hit a cheek with an elbow, a stomach with a knee, and so on. Be creative!

That freezes my blood: I'm bored. "There are no Gobballs left, I've got nothing to do... it freezes my blood." The opposite of:

That makes my blood boil: that makes me extremely angry. Can also be used when the Sacrier is excited.

221.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Sadida: p. 7

Typical expressions : p. 9

The Sadida's profile

Speciality: voodoo mage and summoner of dolls

Strong points: summoning, binding, hitting

Key characteristics: Strength, Intelligence

First spells: Bramble, The Block, Paralysing Poison

Favourite tactics:

  1. playing with dolls which fight at their sides

  2. poisoning enemies

  3. immobilising enemies by creating weeds which entangle them

  4. transforming into trees to protect themselves

  5. stealing life from summons

  6. lifting inconvenient bewitchments

Introduction

A strange name

The followers of the god Sadida are gathered under the name "Sadida's Shoe", which means, in Sadida language, "Those whose shoes, soled with wind and laced with greenery, can create dew and joy within the god Sadida's heart, from the innermost depths to the edge of the forests, scented with exquisite and musky fragrances". This funny expression always puzzles people. The first thing you need to know about Sadidas is that they're extremely touchy when it comes to the soles of their feet. Some people say they're hard with calluses, while others say that it's the most sensitive part of their body. It might also be to do with the smell. But no one knows for sure except the Sadidas themselves. Of course, if you ask one of the leafy god's temperamental followers yourself, you'll regret it. In the end, it's your choice: live in ignorance, or run the risk of getting a thorny whack in the privates. Not hard to choose, is it?

Dream-passers and protectors of the land

We often think Sadidas sleep all day long. The truth is, what we believe to be deep sleep is in fact a very intense activity similar to dreaming... Sadidas claim they are "dream-passers". A dreaming Sadida can make a tremendous effort in the ether to harness the energies that will bring his dolls to life. He is also fond of the teachings spread by forest spirits and lesser gods. They advise him where to find the plants he needs to make his ointments and poisons. This vegetative condition enables him to converse with plants and trees. If a Sadida needs to pick up a plant or cut down a tree, he will always ask its permission, as a Sadida is in perfect harmony with Nature. Some reckon they also take special care to do it because they have the power to change into a tree and that there's something not quite right about hitting a peer with an axe.

Some Sadidas set themselves up as protectors of the land. They use their Sylvan Power spell, which enables them to change into a tree, to melt into the background and remain watchful, scanning their surroundings. Ever felt like someone's watching you when you're in a supposedly deserted forest? Now you know why!

The Worship of Sadida

The God Sadida

People say that "there are two things you can't look at directly: the Sun and Sadida", and that that's why this god always wears a mask, so that gods and mortals alike can converse with him. Sadida is the plant god par excellence. All he wants to do is make things sprout, blossom and bloom. His disciples get their powers from plant life and learn to use them to the fullest. Sadida can be seen from time to time during spring nights when the moon is full, dancing on the ridges, followed by a string of buds and flowers...

The Sadida Temple

Sadida's followers built their temple close to the evil forest. We don't know much about the curse that hit the forest long ago, only that the temple and the followers formed a sacred rampart against it... Now, the forest is known for being home to all sorts of evil creatures. Good thing the Sadidas are there to make sure they don't escape!

There is a colossal tree inside the temple, and some say it's the Soft Oak's sap-brother. It's as least as old. Others reckon it's an avatar of Sadida, quietly waiting for the day when the god will need to take on an earthly form...

Typical expressions - How to speak Sadida

Sadidas often use expressions referring to the plant kingdom and Nature. Here are a few examples:

To have green fingers: is said about Sadidas who are skilful at flower and tree arranging. It's a compliment, honest!

To hit the flowerpot: refers to a Sadida who's successful and/or lucky.

To get all sappy: describes a Sadida who is in love.

Burning bush: any sign from the forest spirits which spurs a Sadida to take decisive action. In slang, this can also refer to a painful Sadida infection.

To be knee-high to a grasshopper: said to describe a very young Sadida.

A thorn in one's side: a persistent enemy who hinders a Sadida's progress in a fight by just not dying!

Letting grass grow underfoot: an activity often done by Sadidas who have mastered the art of casting brambles underneath their enemies.

Weeding out: refers to a Sadida who fights to get rid of undesirables.

To touch wood: something a Sadida does to ward off evil spirits to make things he wants happen.

Ahhh, it's a jungle out there: an expression uttered by Sadidas when they eventually wake up, pull open the curtains and survey their much-loved kingdom.

To be a bad seed: describes a Sadida who has stopped teaching sessions with his master or no longer listens to the spirit of Nature.

Coming out of the woodwork: a rite of passage whereby an adolescent Sadida leaves his home to travel the world and start his life as an adult.

Snake in the grass: a sneaky person who can't be trusted.

222.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Xelor: p. 6

Typical expressions : p. 8

The Xelor's profile

Speciality: manipulator of action points

Strong points: binding, support, hitting

Key characteristics: Intelligence, Wisdom

First spells: Slow Down, Counter, Hand

Favourite tactics:

  1. slowing down enemies by preventing them from acting

  2. teleporting wherever they like on the battlefield

  3. transforming into a walking mummy to increase bonuses and resistance

  4. rebounding part of received damage

  5. increasing allies' action points by decreasing their own

Introduction

Your time will come

Xelor's worshippers venerate everything to do with telling the time: clocks, chimes, hands and so on. They consider all timepieces to be representations of Xelor himself... although some apparently think that they are also reincarnations of their ancestors... Scholars still haven't got to the bottom of this strange group which plays with time like children play with ants and magnifying glasses. At least they don't have to worry about being on time for appointments!

For whom the bell tolls

Xelor disciples protect their bodies from the danger of time warps with bandages. This process is important for a number of reasons. The slightest crack between two wrappings could create a major mishap: any part of their body which is not bandaged can't travel in time at the same speed as the rest of the body! A lapse in concentration could cost them dearly. Now we know why Xelors dress so modestly!

Xelors are often appreciated within groups of adventurers as they can increase their allies' ability to act.

The Worship of Xelor

The God Xelor

Xelor is the master of Time. He is responsible for the Divine Clock, which sets the rhythm for the World's time. His face remains covered, hidden under a large pointy hat, and his hammer is stamped with the seal of the infinite.

He looks threatening, and it's a good thing, as the demons of the hours, who love to kill time by being mischievous, might have misbehaved even more otherwise! Just like his disciples, he wears wrappings, except that his crumble to dust as soon as he moves...

The Xelor Temple

The Xelor Temple is perfectly located for all its disciples' needs. Just a short distance from the centre of Amakna, everything is within walking distance: the library, the bank, the marketplace and, of course, the tavern, famous for its beer and lively nights. East of the Temple, the port of Madrestam offers one-way travel to the Wabbit Islands for Xelors craving adventure. Homebodies can stay at the temple to recharge their batteries with all sorts of clocks that adorn the inside of the edifice. Aren't Xelor architects fantastic? They really have thought of everything!

Typical expressions - How to speak Xelor

Time waster: a Xelor who manages to manipulate time but who doesn't put it to good use, in other words, a disgrace.

Your time has come: a retort of intimidation or an omen, depending on the powers of the Xelor speaking.

To set the clock straight: to make sure everything has been understood correctly.

Thirteen o'clock: to postpone, as in "we'll deal with it at 13 o'clock."

Even a broken clock shows the right time twice a day: you can't always be wrong. A snatch of Xelor philosophy.

Sleeping around the clock: refers to the Xelor tradition of the whole family sleeping in a circle around the household clock in anxious times.

I'll be with you in a minute: when a Xelor says this, he could mean a minute, five minutes, an hour...

Clocks are a great invention as they remind you when to eat: an example of Xelors' fine sense of observation.

You can't tell the time without hands: in other words, without the right resources, it's simply impossible.

223.contentId:
Information sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Pandawa: p. 6

Typical expressions : p. 8

The Pandawa's profile

Speciality: manipulator of position and resistances

Strong points: positioning, support, hitting

Key characteristics: depends on the elemental path chosen

First spells: Boozer, Blazing Fist, Hangover

Favourite tactics:

  1. drinking like a fish or staying sober depending on the occasion

  2. reducing enemies' resistances

  3. getting rid of annoying bewitchments

  4. mastering positioning on the battlefield

  5. carrying an ally on his shoulders to protect it

Introduction

Pandawa, the Goddess who's all that!

The eternally thirsty goddess Pandawa made her disciples in her image, and they can really knock one back! They master the art of emptying a beer mug, a tankard or a pint glass perfectly, and it does them good! Once it reaches the drunken state, a Pandawa can go wild and do anything with his body! He can even do anything with others' bodies, both good and bad. It all depends on whose side you're on...

If Kralsburg did pandas...

Pandawas are much appreciated for their unusual martial arts techniques. Although they seem to be drunk, they can get one over on you, one moment escaping like water running through stones, the next smashing skulls like a brute! Handy with axes, and gifted with an unfailing sense of humour, they take every chance they can get to fight, even if it's just for a laugh. Those who persevere in the martial arts path become great masters and people travel from far-off lands to learn their teachings.

The Worship of Pandawa

The Goddess Pandawa

Very few people know this, but the goddess was here when the World was created! Back then, she was a lot less powerful and was part of the vast group of lesser gods. One day, pondering on how to go about making people adore her, she found the remains of a Blop that had died from a squirt of Sporm. The whole thing was almost liquid and a cloud of Crows were stumbling around it. To her great surprise, the black feathered creatures were all drunk, staggering and unable to fly. This was an epiphany, and her powers started to grow as she experimented in the art of fermentation. She tried it on everything: plants and creatures, organs and peels, they all became liquids with unique flavours, and anyone who drank them would find themselves in a trance, leaving the goddess free to wrap them around her little finger! Soon everyone around was drunk and convinced that the goddess Pandawa was fabulous! She became so famous that she took what she believed was rightfully hers: a place within the gods' pantheon!

The Pandawa Temple

As soon as their island opened up to the rest of the World, the Pandawas built a temple on the continent. This sacred place devoted to their goddess is inhabited by the spirit of Pandawa to such an extent that specimens of flora from Pandala Island started to grow next to the temple spontaneously. From a botanical point of view, these plants are very peculiar, as the vapours they give off seem to make people euphoric. Must be the goddess's aura!

Typical expressions - How to speak Pandawa

Give me a shot of that means "let me have a go", but in taverns, it can be misunderstood, which only leads to more merriment.

Drink and be merry: some people say this expression is missing something, but Pandawas don't really care.

One last drink for the road!: Heard often, honoured rarely.

To be as clear as fermented mud is said of a situation that is difficult to understand, especially for a Pandawa.

To be an old cask: to be expert in the art of war.

Thirst has no ears: that is to say, when a Pandawa is thirsty, he'll pay you no heed until he has something to drink.

To stand your round of drinks: a smart way of getting rid of your opponents.

He who drinks will get drunk: you must accept the consequences of your actions.

Beer-goggles: something you don't need, because Pandawas are cute as buttons, but which makes life more interesting!

To have bottle: to be fearless in any situation.

A rasper: a Pandawa whose voice is worn out by too many fermented drinks.

224.contentId:
Information Sheet: pg. 3

Introduction: pg. 4

The Worship of Eugor (aka Sram): pg. 6

Typical Expressions: pg. 8

The Rogue Profile

Speciality: thief and explosive tactician

Strong Points: binding, hitting, support

Key Characteristic(s): intelligence, agility, chance

Primary Spells: Detonator, Explobomb, Extractor

Favourite Tactics:

  1. making the area into a minefield using bombs, then detonating them whenever they want
  2. sending enemies on wild goose chases by creating replicas of themselves and teleporting
  3. moving bombs so that they keep threatening enemies no matter what happens
  4. sacrificing their ability to move to do more damage
  5. making themselves (or their allies) invulnerable to explosions set off from a distance

Introduction

The Meaning of Family

The most important thing about being a Rogue is being part of a clan whose members all share the same values. And not just any values! The most important one is to steal from the rich without giving to the poor. All the same, even if Rogues work for a shared cause, they're not just Gobblies! The clan might seem like a big family, but Rogues also have an independent side and interests of their own...

Speaking of relatives, family reunions tend to be... peculiar. Don't expect conversation to centre around little anecdotes and how wonderfully the meat is seasoned. Generally, it's more to do with planning the next robbery!

Cheating, tricking, sneaking, lying – you get the idea, Rogues love anything underhanded. Remind you of anyone? You have to admit that they sound an awful lot like Srams! So one wears a cape and one wears a hood, big deal! They're like peas in a pod!

Rogues of a Feather...

If Rogues have one good quality, it's impressive organisational skills: be it a little ruse or a huge conspiracy, they'll have it right down to the letter. They may be as cunning as Lenalds, but even Rogues have to resort to outright firepower sometimes. And if a simple blow isn't enough, they'll hurry to their workshops to concoct complex explosives and fireworks! For them, bombs are the bomb, though their enemies don't always agree... Water bombs, Explobombs and Grenados, they're all on hand to send adversaries flying into the air.

The Worship of Eugor

The God Eugor (aka Sram)

For a long time, there was a big difference between Rogues and other adventurers. In fact, they only worshipped Raval, the founder of their clan, which they dedicated to him. But no matter how much the Rogues kept their work hidden in the shadows, there was one god who, as usual, didn't miss a trick: Sram. Nobody knows exactly how this god ousted the protector of Septangel, but somehow he managed to steal the Rogue disciples for himself. He named himself the Rogues' only god, using the pseudonym Eugor, and convinced everyone that Raval was a mere representative. Little by little, less and less was heard of Raval, until eventually the Rogues started to believe in Eugor. Finally, at the height of his glory, Eugor revealed who he really was. You have to admit that tricking not one but thousands of Rogues is no mean feat! As a result, the Rogues didn't take the deception badly, but admired their new god all the more for it.

The Rogue Den

The legend goes that it was Raval who led Vil Smisse to what is now the Rogues' Den. Hidden within Amakna Cemetery, the hideout's entrance was carved into the trunk of an old tree. Under the chest room, filled with loot plundered from a great many adventures, an underground lake provides a route to Astrub. Once you've reached the underbelly of the mercenary town, a staircase within a cavern leads you to a ruined chapel where Eugor's statue stands. And for those who aren't afraid of getting wet, you can go straight to the Bistrogue by way of a well near Amakna village!

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Rogue

To blow a fuse: to become extremely angry.

Watch out, she's gonna blow: for you, this means run. The explosion could come from a bomb or from the shouter's intestines, but it's going to be dangerous.

Speak to the cloak: expresses a deep lack of interest in something someone else is saying. Example: "Honey, could you clear the table please?" "Sure thing... right after you speak to my cloak!" This will probably earn you a slap.

That's the bomb!: an expression used to point out an explosive previously mentioned in conversation, or just to voice one's enthusiasm about something.

Hoods up: an order given by the leader of the group just before everyone sets off for a heist.

To drop a bombshell: either to announce a piece of shocking news or, er, to actually drop a bomb on an enemy.

To cost a bomb: to be very expensive. This expression is often used, usually as the preface to a theft proposal, since funds will need to be topped up again after shelling out for the item in question...

Button your hood: a hastily delivered remark that usually means that someone's in the middle of giving away the secret details of a Rogue plan and would do better to stop, immediately.

To be the Shushu: refers to someone who is seen as receiving special treatment or privileges.

Share the dynamite: expression used to remind allies that the bombs were set for all opponents, and none should be left out of the fun. A closely related expression is "That bomb's big enough for everyone!"

225.contentId:
Information Sheet: p. 3

Introduction: p. 4

The Worship of Masks and Sadida: p. 6

Typical Expressions: p. 9

The Masqueraider's Profile

Speciality: versatile, mask-wearing warrior

Strong points: tank, support, hitting

Key Characteristic:agility, strength, chance

First Spells:Martelo, Reinforcement, Coward Mask

Favourite Tactics:

  1. Using the Coward Mask to keep a distance between them and the enemy
  2. Using the Psychopath Mask to increase their damage and that of their allies
  3. Using the Classic Mask to prevent the enemy from running away, whilst taking damage in the process
  4. Running away from the enemy at the same time as attacking it
  5. Protecting themselves and their allies with vitality shields

Introduction

The mask is coming for you...

Sometimes cowardly, sometimes sneaky and sometimes totally crazy: the one thing that Masqueraiders aren't is boring! Apart from that, we don't know all that much about these strange masked figures... Some claim to be the bearers of a sacred magical power, a power which they control using their masks. That would certainly explain why they're so sought-after! Some people say that if all the masks were assembled, the consequences would be disastrous. Just imagine all that uncontrollable ancient power set free to wreak havoc...

Of course, other people reckon these are just rumours invented to frighten or mislead inhabitants of the World of Twelve. It's up to you to decide who you believe!

Moody Warrior

You've got the picture by now, Masqueraiders are crazy. They change their faces more often than they change their pants (although that's not saying much). On the battlefield, they can pass from Coward to close combat fighter in a matter of seconds – you never know what you're going to get. Talk about confusing the enemy! Shrewd strategists will know how to turn the chaos to their benefit. And you must admit that, when faced with their very unique combat technique, most of their enemies are somewhat unsettled! One thing's for sure: if you like battles with a lot of twists and turns, you need to take on a Masqueraider!

Masqueraider Worship

The God Sadida

When you hear the word "mask", you automatically think of Sadida. And for once, you're not totally wrong! Indeed, it would seem that the god of nature played a certain role in the Masqueraiders' story...

The legends speak of a living doll and a toddler. But we're not talking about stories for little kids here! This wasn't a perfect, cute little baby, it was a ferocious, destructive beast! The child was a threat to the entire World of Twelve! Wherever it crawled, the grass stopped growing! It destroyed everything, killing, burning and snarling... until the day that Sadida decided to step in.

Discovering that the little brat was invincible, he decided to split its soul and seal the different parts into masks, which in turn were hidden deep inside a cave guarded by a YeCh'ti... that'd teach him! The plan worked perfectly... until a sneaky blacksmith came to distract the guard... and since then, the masks have been scattered all around the World.

These days, people say that the Masqueraiders have become the guardians of the ancient power, on Sadida's behalf.

The Masqueraider Refuge

The Masqueraiders surfaced in a lost village deep in the mountains. People say that before this time, the area had been home only to a blacksmith and his family. Karai, for that was his name, had been more or less rejected by his peers and worked day and night on a secret project. But what could a blacksmith be up to that was so secret? Could he have been the very first Masqueraider? Even today, nobody knows for sure...

Over the years, the mask-wearing community grew and grew, until it extended right up to and over Crackler Mountain. It was in this region's terrain that the Masqueraiders took refuge. Right up at the top, a carvers' workshop can be found. Perhaps Karai built it... Another mystery for you junior detectives!

Typical Expressions – How to Speak Masqueraider

Masks off! is cried when one Masqueraider invites another to lower his weapon. Er... well, his mask, but you know.

Mask a pony: Masqueraiders' favourite cheese, and a party game in which young Masqueraiders have to pin a mask on a picture of a horse.

As naked as a maskless 'Raider: a poetic expression sighed by dreamy Masqueraiders when describing their (imaginary) romantic adventures. "Ahhh, and there she was, naked as a maskless 'Raider..."

The right mask for the fight means enemies in flight: Masqueraider proverb used as a reminder that every opponent needs to be fought with the right strategy.

A mask alone doesn't make a Masqueraider: an old saying often mentioned in discussions on the Masqueraiders' origins. More generally, the saying is used to encourage people to never give up, even when the going is rough.

Mask up! is the slogan of an advertising campaign aimed at freshly incarnated Masqueraiders... The poor little mites don't realise that if they don't use their masks, they won't last long in the real world!

Could really do with a mud mask: a whispered comment on another Masqueraider's physical appearance. Some Masqueraiders never ever reveal their faces for fear of hearing this.

To change masks more than one change's one's pants: this is a huge compliment because it indicates that the Masqueraider in question is a very effective fighter.

226.titleId: The Greatest Adventure of All Time
226.contentId:
There is a dedication on the first page of the book, written in strange-coloured ink:



To a faithful and captivated reader,



Magically yours,



Herdegrize the Mystic

Preface



To my marvellous readers,



As I write, I have just finished writing what I am convinced will be the start of a highly successful series. The masterpiece of which I speak is the very first work of a genre I have named "Science Friction". Understand by this masterly term that as you pass your fingers over the pages of my book, you'll live the greatest adventure of your life!


In the pages which follow, I shall unveil the start of my narrative to you... get ready to dive into a fantastic story in which a demon tries to win a place among the gods.




Herdegrize the Mystic, in the year 641

Prologue



The Inventor and the Demon



One day, as he took a well-earned nap underneath an Api tree, Jeff Stobbs, an inventor as brilliant as he was unappreciated, had a strange dream. Could it have been down to Naz T Peasawerk, the demon perched on a branch just above him? Almost certainly!



In this dream, Jeff was being celebrated as a hero by a delirious crowd. Finally, people were recognising all his hard work!



When the inventor was on the verge of awakening from his dream, Naz T Peasawerk slipped down from his branch and whispered in his ear: "All of that can become reality... All you need to do is take my advice..."

Stunned by the dream and the promise it seemed to hold, Jeff took the demon up on his offer.


He got down to work. His first creation was a device which could tell whether the cawwots were cooked. It proved to be an unprecedented success!



The demons promises came true. Jeff, the hitherto unknown inventor, soon became a genius admired far and wide.

The Gods' Unease



But I know what you're going to say: but Herdegrize, what did the twelve Gods think of all this?



Realising that Jeff Stobbs's cult was taking on considerable proportions, the gods became scared that he would somehow reach their pantheon. The arrival of a new god didn't pose a problem in itself, but the presence of a demon at his side would be a decidedly bad omen. So they decided to take action.



Not wanting to intervene directly, the gods hatched a plan.

Each one designated a faithful follower to be named Hero. Knowing that these representatives would not be enough to stop the inventor and his demon, they united their powers to create a being in the form of a dragon, which they named Animakhal. They gave him an extraordinary power: he could create clones in the image of the Heroes. In this way, he would be able to build an army strong enough to stop Jeff Stobbs and Naz T Peasawerk.



The future of the World of Twelve was now in the hands of these worthy Heroes...




...and in your hands too, sublime readers! Do you want to know the rest of this heart-stopping story? Do you too want to fight epic battles alongside Animakhal? Then don't delay! As soon as you can, procure the full version of my book! Accept no substitute: demand the best... Science Friction!

On the last page of the book, a paragraph in very small writing can just be made out:



The bearer of this work is sworn on his honour, his life and his eternal soul not to read or use in any way the odious writings of the equally odious Acidrik Gutsplitter. Any breach of this promise will cause cataclysmic consequences, such as beard hair loss, Gobball breath and inopportune itching.
