Guardian of Javian

JIVA

The Wise

Jiva the Wise is loyal to the gods, and, in particular, to Xelor. She moves at the speed of thought, which enables her to keep the gods up-to-date with what's happening down here. Jiva did not end up as the guardian of Javian by chance: as beautiful as she is fearful, her terrible task is to prevent the month of Descendre from running over into time which does not belong to him.

Each year, Jiva fights a gigantic battle against Djaul, and the two guardians need a certain amount of time to get over their confrontation. Even though Jiva always beats Djaul (though maybe not forever?), the outcome of the victory is often uncertain. Sometimes, Djaul manages to steal a few days back for Descendre, but Jiva earns the respect of the inhabitants of Bonta and Amakna due to the strength and energy she shows during these fights.

Guardian of Flovor

SILVOSSE

The Master of Cuttings

Silvosse, the master of cuttings is a robust being who may seem rude at times, but shows a great sensibility towards the world of vegetation. He makes sure the souls of the flora that have been sapped by the cold winters get to heaven, and gives strength and life to the trees who have managed to resist the freeze. He continually paces through the forest, and knows the names of each creature of the vegetable people.

The rare beings who have approached him consider him surly and unsociable. To tell the truth, Silvosse is unfathomable and it is impossible to figure out what he's really thinking. One thing's for sure: Silvosse hates lumberjacks and never misses the chance to punish one of them... The Soft Oak is his friend, and Silvosse is one of the rare few who are able to approach this venerable creature.

Guardian of Martello

ULGRUDE

Of Thunder

Ulgrude is the herald of spring. With its downpours and its unseasonal hails, this month is just like its guardian: capricious, but generous because he presides over the resurrection of the vegetation.

Ulgrude of Thunder is a versatile entity, who can go from anger to tears faster than you can say 'mood swing'. Hails, thunder and other adverse weather conditions are dependent upon his emotions. Fundamentally good, but ignorant of the strength he possesses, Ulgrude has a pure and childlike spirit. He can be easily manipulated by any ill-intentioned being...

In love, but spurned by Jiva, Ulgrude will do whatever it takes to please her... The god Iop, who is very attached to him, often asks the goddess Eniripsa to ensure that nobody gets hurt as a result of his emotional outbursts.

Guardian of Aperirel

SILOUATE

The Minotoror

Aperirel does not bring as much wintry weather, but fine rain still drizzles down over the countries: "Spring has sprung!" say the farmers, visibly enchanted. Their enchantment wanes, however, when they see Silouate the Minotoror's silhouette... He's not really a bad guy, though: he wanders through the world, making sure the cold is slowly retreating from its countries. Of course, the image of a Minotoror chewing grass during a full moon isn't exactly reassuring, especially not for a farmer on his way back from the tavern... Any adventurers who wish to come face to face with the Minotoror should note: don't be taken in by his bovine air. At the slightest sign of hostility towards the guardian, a whole herd of bulls with descend upon you to teach you thing or two about life...

It has been said that Silouate is one of the wise men of Amakna who decided to hide the Dofus away from covetous eyes of the adventurers. Silouate is also friends with Sumens, the Protector of the month of Junssidor.

Guardian of Maysial

ROSAL

The Master of Flowers

Rosal, the Master of Flowers, is different from the other protectors because he has a very singular outlook on the world around him. He's telepathic and can clearly read the thoughts of others.

Maysial's Protector has other extra-sensory gifts too, like elemental vision, which enables him to see how sensitive a creature is to the elements, and empathy, a gift (or a curse, according to some people) which enables him to feel another being's feelings exactly as they do. Empathy is an important tool for him to complete his task. Rosal is responsible for giving life to all the plants and animals.

No creature can hide their intentions from him, be they bad or good. His acute sensitivity can be the source of good or evil... although, as far as Rosal's concerned, there's no such thing as good and evil: the most important thing for him is that they grow, regardless of whether they prefer the light or the shadows.

Guardian of Junssidor

SUMENS

God Enutrof's Supporter

As a loyal servant of Enutrof, Sumens has been bestowed with a special gift from his god: he can transform anything he eats into precious stones. This would be enough to thrill any Enutrof worthy of the name, if only creating them wasn't so painful...

During the first few days of Junssidor, it is not unusual to hear the pained groaning of old Sumens, coming from behind a bush or a tree. This unusual gift has earned him a fair few nicknames from some of the more facetious adventurers: Greedy Guts, Smart Shite or Preparation Rich depending on whether they were sympathetic or mocking.

What few people know is that Sumens is a sort of living Midas, capable of transforming something vile into something noble and precious, whether it's a prestigious weapon or a special item.

Guardian of Jullier

HECATE

The Mystifier

Hecate was once nothing more than a minor god to whom people addressed prayers to keep Moskitos, which are particularly vicious during the hot Jullier nights, away. Hecate is a creature of the night and is able to find and destroy a Moskito from the slightest suspect "bzzzz". Each summer, she carried out her mission enthusiastically, but got depressed when the excitement she felt faded at the end of the hot season.

When suggestions were being made for the guardians to take Xelor's place, Sram suggested Hecate, pointing out her merits. It was also a self-interested move on the skull god's part: he, too, reigned over the shadows and the invisible, and didn't want someone like Hecate to become a goddess... in case her nocturnal talents overshadowed his own. And so that's why Hecate was named Guardian of Jullier.

By day, Hecate wanders the world in various disguises because she has the power to transform herself at will. Sometimes, she spies her neighbour, hidden in the branches of a tree or at the entrance of a cave. She forms alliances with whoever she feels like, whenever she feels like it.

Hecate is secretly in love with Ulgrude, but he doesn't know it.

Guardian of Frauguctor

POUCHECOT

The Fruitcake

Pouchecot is a very old soul, who could write an encyclopaedia on the universe and the worlds that live in it, and who has a very unusual sense of humour.

In fact, Pouchecot is the only being who can boast about being able to bend the Soft Oak - have it bent double in laughter, that is. In fact, during one particularly memorable evening, the laughs of the Soft Oak rose to the heavens and the Sadida god asked Pouchecot to tell him one of his jokes in person... the god was caught in such a fit of laughter that he had trouble getting over it.

After this, he offered Pouchecot a chance to become one of his followers, which Pouchecot politely declined. Sadida, although disappointed, rewarded him with great mastery of the vegetable kingdom, telling him it was only a small part of the power he bestowed upon his disciples and that he could always become one of them if he so desired.

And this is how Pouchecot became the guardian of the month of Frauguctor and presides most notably over the ripening of fruit.

Guardian of Septangel

RAVAL

The Terrible

The Protector of Septangel knows how to swing from one extreme to the other and, as long as it's a worthy cause he's defending, he is unyielding. His powers can cause even the most seasoned warriors to break out into a cold sweat and he is sometimes compared – unfairly – to the vampires of the Tortured Cemetery, or even to the Reaper himself... His task may seem sinister, but it's a necessary one: he goes around the world, chasing out the luxury of Frauguctor and sucking the vital fluids out of the flora and fauna.

During the Crimson Dawn, Raval resurrected the Knights of the Order of Thunder to ensure the survival of the month of Septangel. The skull of Menalt, the Centurion and the former Protector of Martello, is embedded in his sceptre. Raval can use this to summon ghosts.

Guardian of Octolliard

MAIMANE

The Stabiliser

Maimane is a loner who appreciates tranquillity.

After having taken part in the battle of the Crimson Dawn, he was convinced that the world was subject to the survival of the fittest and he would fall prey to whichever of his emotions was the most violent. As a result, Maimane decided to entomb the memories of all living creatures and seal them under slabs marked with black and white diamonds: they would only be available to those with pure enough hearts to be able to find them (and enough courage to look!).

Maimane's actions calmed the violent fervour of the Bontarian and Brakmarian warriors for a while. His wisdom earned him the nickname of "Maimane the Stabiliser""from the goddess Feca.

Ever since then, each day that passes in Octolliard moderates the excesses of Septangel and Novamaire; it's also the last appeal to clemency and leniency before the world comes under the yolk of Brumaire and Djaul...

Guardian of Novamaire

BRUMAIRE

The Dark Bleeder

The sight of Brumaire alone is enough to turn your blood to ice: cold and pitiless, he is the Protector of Novamaire. When the time comes for the big freeze, he goes through the world with his pack of ice-coloured creatures. Anyone who crosses his path should beware, because he doesn't think twice about giving them frostbite!

Brumaire is only interested in serving his own interests, but he is also an opportunist: he may be Djaul's ally, but that's only because the Protector of Descendre amplifies Novamaire's cold and prolongs its effects.

Guardian of Descendre

DJAUL

The Great Flounderer, Rushu's Loyal Follower

Djaul is uncompromisingly loyal towards Rushu, his Lord and Master. As one of the rare demons the gods have authorised to set foot in the world, he is behind a great many underhand acts, vileness and hatred such as did not exist before the creation of Brakmar... This city, dedicated to Rushu's cult, allowed Djaul to keep all his loyal followers in one place. Djaul is also responsible for the birth of Bolgrot, the dragon who inflicts misery on Amakna and the rest of the world...

Djaul doesn't worry too much about Descendre because the devastating effects of this month serve his purposes.

242.contentId:
Protector

Silvosse, the Master of Cuttings

Master of the Order

Ebru of El

Description

Pssst, soldier!

Would you rather march in silent slippers than hobnail boots?

Do you always sleep with one eye open and one ear to the ground?

Do you like listening at doors?

Come and join the Sharp Eye!

Our order, dedicated to Silvosse, unites all Bontarians who have a penchant for spying. Qualities such as discretion, prudence and loyalty are essential if you want to join us. Apart from the fact that they have an insatiable love of gossip, all of our followers are very respectful of nature: they don't trample flower beds or walk on lawns unless it's absolutely necessary.

The members of our order are spies. They start off with the rank of Disciple. In time, they will become Silent Spies, Renegade Hunters... and the very best will reach the ranks of Supreme Assassin and Master of Illusions.

As followers of Silvosse, you will be given an exceptional gift: the Art of Camouflage. You will be able to pretend you're something you're not... If you stay completely still, you will be mistaken for a rock! It will even be possible for you to make yourself invisible. The most gifted will also be able to take on the appearance of any follower of the twelve gods, or even a Brakmarian!

Do you still think you've got the talents we're looking for? Go and speak to the Master of the Order and share in the secrets of the Order of the Sharp Eye!

243.titleId: The Legend of Grozilla and Grasmera
243.contentId:
Preface

This book is a collection of notes made by P. H. Lavcroft, the erudite Osamodas fascinated by myths and monstrous creatures. Over a period of many years, Lavcroft committed himself to the study of Dreggons. He was also extremely interested in Grozilla and Grasmera and was a keen collector of legends about them.

Shortly after his arrival on Vulkania, Lavcroft started having strange dreams in which two enormous beings would appear before him. Believing these dreams to have been conjured up by the God Osamodas himself, he understood them as a sign that Grozilla and Grasmera were going to return.

Lavcroft disappeared into the depths of the Pinki Crater to try to find out whether his understanding of the visions was correct, and was never seen again. This collection is dedicated to his memory.

First Notebook:

Current Knowledge about Grozilla and Grasmera

The Origins of the Myth

According to the oldest tales, Grozilla and Grasmera are descendants of Crocabulia the dragon.

Other sources do not mention such family ties, and claim that the two monsters were summoned by the god Osamodas in order to help Crocabulia to fulfil an important task: watching over the Dreggon Sanctuary.

Whether Crocabulia was their mother or not, Grozilla and Grasmera are often considered to be dragons. Certain Dracologists vehemently reject this belief, arguing that these two creatures have very little in common with beings such as Grougalorasalar or Terrakourial, and even less with Osamodas' divine dragons.

Perhaps various types of dragon exist? Personally, for the time being, I have remained neutral regarding this debate.

Appearances in Amakna

All the recounts have Grozilla and Grasmera down as guardians of the Dreggon Sanctuary. The two monsters supposedly slept underground for centuries, only very occasionally waking.

The first time they awoke, it led to the destruction of the original Amakna village.

Some adventurers claim to have encountered the two guardians many years later, in 637, when exploring the sanctuary's depths.

The second verified appearance arrived in 639. Following the destruction of the Sauroshells which had appeared in great number on Dreggon Peninsula, Grozilla and Grasmera came out into the open. There followed epic confrontations in which the titans took on huge groups of heroes from all walks of life. At last, after much bloodshed, Grozilla and Grasmera left the area.

The Invasion of Kwismas Island

People thought that the two dragons had retired to the underground areas of the Dreggon Sanctuary, but they were wrong: the pair had set off to explore new horizons.

Taking the last Sauroshells with them, Grozilla and Grasmera swam until they reached Kwismas Island. They stayed there for some time, wreaking havoc which cannot be described in words.

According to accounts, this finished in a cataclysm: apparently, the Sauroshells, which the monsters had placed safely in a cavern, reached maturity and exploded with such incredible force that a piece of the island itself was sent flying up into the air!

Following this event, Grozilla and Grasmera disappeared once again... until now.

Discovery at the Centre of the Earth

It was only when the McGraff-Hartvigg expedition set about exploring the underground depths of the Pinki Crater at the heart of the Vulkanian archipelago that the next chapter was opened. Rummaging through the caverns, the team made an extraordinary, astonishing discovery: Grozilla and Grasmera, asleep in the middle of a load of Sauroshells!

As part of the expedition group, I was present when this unexpected discovery was made. It was a historic moment. Of course, we didn't really have time to stop and look around, because we had to run for our lives... but at least I had the chance to see the mythical beasts with my own eyes!

Second Notebook:

Dragon Dreams

Scaly Visions

A few days after arriving on Vulkania, and many moons before my run-in with Grozilla and Grasmera, I started having unnerving, recurring dreams.

Each night, visions would come to me, misty visions of two giants sleeping under the earth's surface. I could hear countless eggs knocking against one another and whispering in the gloom. I could feel the noxious breath of Crocabulia's descendants on my skin. I could make out the scaly bodies of Dragostesses moving behind the screens of steam.

I might have believed that these were merely due to my imagination. But deep down inside, I knew that it was more than that. I thought that they were messages sent by the god Osamodas, to warn us of what was going to happen...

The events which followed eventually proved me right. The dreams were premonitions.

The Coming of the Lords of Vulkania

How did Grozilla and Grasmera get to Vulkania?

Basing my reflections on my knowledge as well as the dreams I had been having, I tried to imagine what might have happened.

After the explosion on Kwismas Island, Grozilla and Grasmera felt a deep bitterness. They had wanted to protect the Sauroshells, and in fact they had condemned them to death! These eggs had been very valuable to them, because the Sauroshells had been laid by the Sanctuary's Dragostesses in their honour.

From his celestial throne, the god Osamodas took pity on the two overwhelmed monsters. He blew an inspiring image into their scaly noggins: a volcanic island, a paradise on earth far from any ship's regular route. Grozilla and Grasmera swam to the island in question. There, deep inside the volcano, they found something they never could have imagined: five Dragostesses waiting for them.

Beyond the Veil of Sleep

That's how the new Sauroshells were conceived – a new Vulkanian variety. After an idyllic existence which lasted for some time, Grozilla and Grasmera started to feel weary... the Dragostesses and their offspring were growing more numerous every day, and requiring more and more energy. They decided to take a nap.

And it was this restful sleep that the pair were enjoying when the expedition team stumbled across them.

Many questions remain unanswered. For the moment, we have only found Sauroshells on the island. Where are the adult Vulkanian Dreggons hiding? What about Grozilla and Grasmera's partners, the Dragostesses? Despite long and arduous searches, we haven't managed to find them.

I fully intend to solve the most recent mysteries in the Grozilla and Grasmera story, even if it means going down into the unfathomable, hitherto unexplored depths...

244.contentId:
Warning

This book, written for amateur Dracologists, explains certain principles to do with Dreggon reproduction. Readers are advised that although these principles have been verified many times, they are still subject to debate within the scientific community. I leave it to the reader to form their own conclusions by consulting this and other works on the subject.

If you're an adrenaline junkie, you might prefer to explore certain theories for yourself by heading to the Dreggon Peninsula and smearing yourself liberally with Dragostess slobber. The author accepts no responsibility for the potential reactions of males passing by at the wrong moment.

On Dreggon Reproduction

Dragostesses lay eggs. Each egg, when fertilised by a Dreggon warrior, hatches into an immature Dreggon, which will become a Dreggon or a Dragoss.

Unfertilised eggs usually finish up in omelettes, but some of them become explosive or healing shells. The explosive type explodes when it reaches a certain age.

Sauroshells

The first Sauroshells were eggs laid by the Dragostesses who had fallen head over tail for the enormous Grozilla and Grasmera. Since the two great brutes were fast asleep, the eggs couldn't be fertilised to give life to new Dreggons. Nonetheless, the Sauroshells could reach an impressive size, and their explosions were sometimes very dangerous.

Vulkanian Sauroshells

Two types of Sauroshell can be found on Vulkania: explosive Sauroshells, also known as "Raw" Sauroshells, and elemental Sauroshells, which have various powers.

The elemental Sauroshells are actually fertilised eggs, and thus are a new type of immature Dreggon. Budding scientists who wish to distinguish them from Raw Sauroshells may wish to refer to them as "Dreggshells", "Saurovulks" or something similar.

Vulkanian Dreggons

Once Vulkanian Sauroshells have reached maturity, they must be coaxed out of their shells. They are shy by nature and don't like coming out when there are lots of others around... and since Vulkania is home to so many Sauroshells, it's more or less impossible! So they tend to stay as moving eggs, becoming Venerable Sauroshells and not grow any bigger. That's why a controlled hunting campaign, over a limited period of time, doesn't do any harm!

Once the height of the summer season has passed, the most audacious Sauroshells leave their shells and grow up to become Vulkanian Dreggons.

We know very little about these Dreggons, because they live deep inside Vulkania's rocky mass. Only one or two islanders have spotted them. Their descriptions vary, so it may well be that several varieties exist. Perhaps one day, the Vulkanian Dreggons will come out into the sunlight... but perhaps it would be better if they didn't.

Madreggons

This is a species of Vulkanian Dreggon that is a little less fierce than its cousins and that has already been captured and even domesticated. Treated as petsmounts, Madreggons are sterile, and all attempts to breed them have failed miserably.

Even although Madreggons are less aggressive than their continental relatives, they still have an appetite just as healthy as that of any other Dreggon. Their favourite dish is elemental Sauroshells. Madreggons don't have much family loyalty...

About the Horned God, Osamodas

The episode during which Osamodas became enraged and punished the inhabitants of Amakna is widely known. What with Madreggons being domesticated now, do we need to fear the fury of the Master of Beasts once more? Or, on the contrary, should we see this event as a cautious start to forgiveness granted by the Celestial Tamer? Osamodas's ways are unfathomable... but just in case, it may be wise to make generous offerings to him, because you never know. There is an altar in Vulkania; do not hesitate to pray there fervently and to leave a contribution on your way out.

245.contentId:
Well, this is it: we're setting off today!

Almost all of the members of the expedition team are on board. The two Sacriers, Stok and Stak, are full of beans; they seem to be used to journeys like this. I had no idea they were cousins!

Tristan Zubert, the wildlife specialist, is really nice. I can't say the same for Tom Stone. The guy seems kind of shady... he says he knows a lot about old stones, but it seems to me that he's really talking about the jewels he's hoping to get his mitts on.

Ava is just excited as I am about our departure. If only her grandfather were here to see her now, I know how proud he'd be!

Ivan Hartvigg was the last to arrive, as usual. Apparently, his lateness was down to the fact that he left his bag at the inn and had to go back for it. Honestly, that fellow will forget his own head one of these days!

Next stop: the mysterious island!

***

I'd started to believe we'd never make it... but we have! We've found Vulkania!

We almost missed it. The fog banks were so thick that I couldn't see my fingers when I held my hand out in front of me. Once we've gotten closer using the rowing boat, we'll have to remember to designate a meeting place and light a fire there to mark the spot. Maybe later on, we could even build a lighthouse!

I keep thanking Enutrof for having guided us this far. Finally, I won't have to listen to that Sram groaning all day long... What kind of person comes on a trip like this knowing that they get seasick?!

***

Vulkania is a geologist's dream! The variety of mineral structures takes my breath away. The tranquil atmosphere is awe-inspiring. If it wasn't for the waves crashing, I reckon you'd almost be able to hear the rock all around slowly cracking.

Seismic activity here seems limited. We've already spotted a number of craters in the forest. Stok and Stak went to investigate further. Soon, we should be able to draw up a rough map of the island.

We all went down into the first crater. It was magnificent. The size of the crystals is something else. Hartvigg and Ava couldn't believe their eyes!

Zubert got excited too when he spied some kind of creature in the cavern. I don't know what it was, but it was quite shy: the animal fled as soon as Zubert tried to get closer. It was the first big animal we've seen. Let's just say that Vulkania's forests weren't made for hunting.

***

We've been here for a good while now and we're getting to know the archipelago's terrain quite well.

Zubert thinks he's identified the species of creature that we see from time to time: they're Dreggons. He has a friend who specialises in these animals, and he suggested we invite him to the island. I gave him my approval.

I had an idea, which I explained to the rest of the team: what if we made Vulkania into a big natural park, so that everyone could discover the delights this extraordinary place has to offer? Hartvigg was up for it immediately – probably calculating how much gold a park like that might rake in. Stok seemed hesitant, however; he'll take some convincing. He's probably scared that the place will be completely overrun with tourists! I'll need to reassure him about that, because it's not at all what we have in mind.

***

To pass the time, we've already starting brainstorming about all the interesting attractions we could offer visitors. Things like "underground monsters and legends", "flight over a crater" or "journey not quite to the centre of the Earth". The most important thing is to keep it educational, so that visitors to Vulkania can learn things while having fun.

***

Tristan Zubert's friend arrived this morning. He seems a little strange – very pale with bulging eyes – but he's very polite and well educated. I think he just has trouble sleeping.

Zubert's in his element; we've started seeing Dreggons in the forest. Zubert says they're immature, which is why they're still in their shells.

We've welcomed the first visitors to Vulkania. Having them here enables us to test out the first activities that we've organised. For the moment, they seem to be enjoying themselves, so we're optimistic about keeping the project going!

***

I don't know where to start... Something terrible happened today.

We had gone down into the Pinki Crater to make some observations. It's the island's smallest crater, but the caverns it leads to are enormous. We went further than we had the other times... and it got hotter and hotter. We went through a kind of passage formed naturally in the rock... and there, in a big, rocky room... we saw them. Two enormous monsters, fast asleep, and all around them... hordes of Dreggons, still in their shells. The Dreggons started to get agitated, the noise was deafening... and the two giant creatures woke up.

I truly thought we were going to die down there! By Enutrof, I've never been so frightened in all my life!

Zubert's friend told us that the two creatures we had disturbed were Grozilla and Grasmera, and that they were most likely the Dreggons' fathers!

Grozilla and Grasmera... what does this mean for everything we've started here?!

***

So many things have happened... all our hopes have crumbled like a sandcastle washed away by the waves.

Several members of the expedition have disappeared. Tristan Zubert, his monster-obsessed friend, and my dear friend Ava... They went down into the Pinki Crater and they haven't come back. I tried to talk them out of going... but they wanted to see what there was beyond the den. I have given up hope of seeing them return alive.

The "Sauroshells", as Zubert called them, have come out of the deep caverns and are now roaming around the island's forests. We've had to start hunting them, because there were more and more of them.

Alas, the opposite is true for the number of park visitors; fewer and fewer people arrive each day. As for the park's maintenance costs... well... If things don't sort themselves out, we're going to have to close the island off.

***

Hartvigg thinks he's found a way to save Vulkania. Apparently, he received a message from someone who might be able to help us.

It's our last chance, because our situation couldn't be more hopeless. In the last few days, we've fallen victim to a number of thefts – as though a natural park were the place for thieves to hang around! I even have a hunch that some of our equipment has been sabotaged, because there have been several accidents. I don't understand any of it. It's as though fate has it in for us...

***

Today we met our "saviour": Charlie Endstown-Smisse. This gentleman, who appears to be most influential, has offered to take charge of everything. He said we needn't worry any more and that everything will be "just hunky-dory". Hmmm. I don't know why, but the whole thing makes me uneasy. I think the other members of the team have their doubts as well, but they haven't said anything to me. In fact, they don't talk much to me at all any more.

***

Everything has changed. My dreams are shattered.

I find myself wondering why I'm still here. That maggot Endstown-Smisse assigned me to watch over the Puerto Beacon lighthouse. No doubt he wants me out of the way. If that's the case, he's succeeded... Thankfully, I have Dekster here to keep me company.

The old expedition members eventually accepted the jobs that the Agents offered them. I'm not really in close contact with any of them these days. I thought we were in it together... but it turns out it's every man for himself.

Now, Charlie's Agents control the whole island. The new employees are on their way now... and hundreds of tourists will be on the next boats.

I don't feel like keeping this journal any more... I think I'll even get rid of it: it brings back too many memories.

What will become of Vulkania? I ask myself that question every single day. But since I'm here... I'm jolly well staying!

246.contentId:
You know them for their fantastic Adventure Destinations and organised dungeons. Now, Charlie's Agents are proud to present a brand new summer trip: Vulkania, Land of Adventure!

Located just south of Otomai Island, the Vulkanian archipelago is a place like no other. With its white sandy beaches, tropical forests, smoky craters and crystalline caverns, there's something for all nature lovers!

If action is more your thing, then you can hunt Sauroshells to your heart's content!

Even the most intrepid adventurers will meet their match: they'll have to face the Lords of the Island. Two veritable forces of nature; two legendary titans who shook the World of Twelve, leaving terrible destruction in their wake. That's right: Grozilla and Grasmera are back!

If you've ever dreamt of fighting these legendary monsters, now's your chance! We've done all we can to ensure that you can enjoy this intensely frightening experience!

List of Activities on Offer

Sauroshell Search*

(daily)

Tail these wild animals in their natural habitat of forests and craters! Collect the resources dropped after fights to create exclusive sets!

Shell Hunt*

(daily)

Hit the beach in Vulkania, and get collecting! If you're fast enough, you'll win the collection contest!

Tour of Vulkania*

Explore the island and discover forests, craters and many other equally beautiful sights!

Totem Erarious Game*

Will you manage to reconstruct the Totem Erarious? If you succeed, you'll gain access to the Pinki Crater, the first step towards earning the right to face the Lords of Vulkania!

Vulkanian Shplinters*

Let off some steam in the underground caverns, do battle with Raw Sauroshells and bring back their Shplinters as trophies!

Surf the Waves

Due to a technical issue, this activity has been withdrawn.

Heart-Breaker

(group challenge)

This first group challenge must be completed each year in order to open up the doors to the Den of the Lords of Vulkania. You'll have to collect a whole load of Sauroshell hearts, so why not try hunting in groups to fight more efficiently?

The Chthonian Slabs Enigma

(group challenge)

Just like the Heart-Breaker, the second group challenge must be completed every year to open Grozilla and Grasmera's Den. The slab rooms will require several dozen participants... Holiday-makers, unite!

Crossing Nomads' Land

This is the last stretch before the Den of the Lords of Vulkania! Nomads' Land is a warm-up before the final battle.

Grozilla and Grasmera: the Ultimate Combat

(daily)

Push open the doors to the den, gather all your courage and challenge the Lords of Vulkania! If you come out of this difficult battle victorious, you'll win emotes as well as a Madreggon or Krolimea Token (or more than one, if you're lucky!). You can also build an exclusive set using the resources dropped after the fight.

The Soul Safari

Designed for the most skilful hunters, this safari will require you to capture the souls of most of the Sauroshell species present on the island... and that includes the really rare ones! What's up for grabs? Only a Grofus, a genuine Vulkanian Dofus!

The Kilobuds Contest

(weekly)

Every week, champion swimmer (and tanner) Bo Pye competes with his rival, Disparate Don, in a rather peculiar contest: the first one to reach 3,827 kilobuds wins! Are you a medal-wearing tourist who's ready to weigh up the pros and cons? Well, come and help Vulkania's most sunkissed Ecaflip hold onto his title!

Vulkorog vs. Otomaisle

(weekly)

Red for Vulkorog or yellow for Otomaisle? Choose your island and your side! Help your team hunt Sauroshells and collect Rock Crystals – as well as being able to lord it over the losers the following week, the winning side will gain access to Maimane Rock, where they'll learn how to play an interesting variant of rock-paper-scissors... You'll even earn precious Vulkomaikens to spend on exclusive Corktails and Sauroshells with dragoonic effects!

Madreggons: Prestigious Companions

All-Vulkanian creatures, Madreggon are pets... that you can mount! Sitting firmly on the back of your Madreggon, you'll look swell, and you'll be the envy of all your friends.

If you accomplish all the activities marked with a star above (*), you'll receive a Happy Camper Medal. This Vulkanian decoration will be required if you want a Madreggon to take home with you. Medals are awarded by Tony Bleurgh, the head of the village, and remain valid for one whole summer season.

You'll also need to defeat the Lords of Vulkania a number of times to win the tokens you need to exchange for a Madreggon.

Krolimeas: Vengeful Companions

Krolimeas also belong to the Vulkanian Dreggon family. Far more aggressive and unpredictable than their Madreggon cousins, Krolimeas won't let anyone on their backs – but you can always adopt one as a pet instead.

Krolimeas suffer from a constant feeling of rejection and insecurity. Mix that with their insatiable thirst for revenge and you have a tough cookie on your hands. Aside from all that emotional turmoil, they're pretty cute companions.

Just like for Madreggons, you'll need to be a Happy Camper if you want a Krolimea to take home with you. You'll also need a certain number of special tokens that you earn by defeating Grozilla and Grasmera.

Services for Holiday-Makers

  1. A regular link between Madrestam Harbour and Halcyon Harbour.

  2. A hospitable inn surrounded by charming scenery.

  3. A place in the cemetery in the event of accidental death, and access to a Phoenix statue for more tenacious tourists.

  4. The chance to taste typical Vulkanian drinks and dishes at Bar Racuda.

  5. A fairly-priced souvenir stand.

  6. An altar for offerings to Osamodas.

Good Tourist Guidelines

When tourists arrive on Vulkania, they must agree to abide by the island's rules and regulations. These guidelines – also known as the GTG – are on display in the village, and should not be overlooked by any holiday-maker. Now you know where your first stop on the island will be!

All set for adventure? Enjoy your stay on Vulkania!

247.contentId:
Introduction: p. 3

Petsmounts: p. 4

Feeding Your Petsmount: p. 5

Treating Injuries: p. 6

Your Madreggon's Diet: p. 7

Using Your Petsmount in Combat: p. 8

Favourite Area: p. 10

About the Bow Kennel: p. 11

Introduction

First and foremost, to take good care of your petsmount, you must love it, otherwise your petsmount will not love you.

This book doesn't provide any tips or advice on how to love your petsmount, however, as that cannot be learned. Instead, we're going to look at the second most important condition: proper feeding.

This guide tells you how to feed Madreggons, fearsome soul-eating critters!

Petsmounts

Madreggons aren't pets, they're petsmounts – faithful companions that you can count on in any situation, but that you can also ride!

Seated on your Madreggon's back, your hair blowing in the wind and the reins between your teeth, you'll no longer have to cross the wide World of Twelve all alone. You'll be able to flounce around Astrub's little squares smiling haughtily amidst the envious gazes of your observers. Not everybody is talented enough to have a petsmount, y'know!

You've probably grasped by now that your petsmount is a very special creature. You'll need to feed it, cherish it and treat it properly if you want it to stay in good health.

Feeding Your Petsmount

Soul-eating petsmounts are quite unique, to say the least. They generally harbour an impressive amount of ill will for their own, and they can only feed on vengeance.

And so, to gain nourishment, soul-eaters need only to accompany you when you kill monsters of their ilk, at which point they will feed on the souls you've freed.

Soul-eaters will gladly consume the souls of their own species at any time of day or night. They can fast for long periods, and are also able to devour large numbers of souls in a very short amount of time. It is impossible to make a soul-eater overweight or underweight.

After eating a certain number of souls, your Madreggon will see their characteristics increase.

Treating Injuries

When injured, your Madreggon will need to follow a special diet of Eniripsa Powder, which can be used to heal petsmounts. You can purchase this powder from the Bow Kennel.

If you haven't located Eniripsa Powder yet, you can bring your wounded petsmount to the Bow Kennel to keep its condition from worsening.

Your Madreggon's Diet

The Madreggon's diet consists of the souls of creatures of its kind.

This diet enables it to be more powerful.

Here is a list of the various creatures whose souls Madreggons can eat:

Muddy Sauroshells

Moist Sauroshells

Incandescent Sauroshells

Insipid Sauroshells

Dry Sauroshells

All of these Sauroshells live on the Vulkanian archipelago.

Some souls are richer than others, allowing your Madreggon to develop more quickly.

Using Your Petsmount in Combat

Your petsmount will typically assist you in combat by defending you or helping to make your attacks more effective.

Be sure to keep a close eye on your petsmount, though, because it will be injured every time you lose a fight against a creature.

If you don't heal it after each loss, it will eventually die, and you'll have to find a way to revive your petsmount.

In general, the only way to heal a petsmount after losing a battle is to feed it Eniripsa Powder.

Customarily, when adventurers fight one another, petsmounts are never targeted. Therefore, they cannot be injured, even in the event of a defeat.

If you want to be sure your petsmount doesn't get injured, simply keep it in your inventory rather than having it by your side during combat.

Favourite Area

All petsmounts have a favourite area.

Whenever a petsmount is in its favourite area, all the benefits it gives its master receive a bonus. The bonus changes from petsmount to petsmount, but it can be very large, so don't forget to take advantage of it by fighting in the area!

Madreggons' favourite area is the Archipelago of Vulkania.

About the Bow Kennel

The Bow Kennel is a place generally reserved for raising petsmounts.

You can leave your petsmount there so it's safe and well-fed while you are away. However, your petsmount will not improve while in the Bow Kennel, as it is away from its master.

You typically have to pay a fee to drop off your petsmount, and then another fee when you pick it up later.

The amount you have to pay will depend on how long you're gone for. The longer your petsmount stays in the Bow Kennel, the steeper the fee.

The Bow Kennel is also where you can buy Eniripsa Powder to heal your petsmount.

The most well-known Bow Kennel is usually marked on adventurers' maps. It can be found next to Sufokia Gate.

In conclusion, we must point out a physical limit to your Madreggon's constitution.

Once its growth is complete, its capacities will have reached their maximum and it will be difficult to improve it further.

Good luck to you and your soul-chomping petsmount!

248.subTitleId: Rules governing your stay in Vulkania
248.contentId:
It is understood that all tourists arriving on Vulkania during the summer season (Jullier and Frauguctor) agree to abide by the rules and regulations set out in this declaration and detailed below:

Article 1

Tourists are expected to remain courteous at all times, to respect the pleasant and warm atmosphere which reigns over the island during the summer season.

Article 2

In order to preserve the site's beauty, it is forbidden to throw greasy scrolls, empty flasks and other used items onto the ground. Bins have been provided for tourists' use and scavengers' pleasure.

Article 3

Tourists are informed that site employees have every right to "keep the change" following commercial exchanges, even when they have not been asked to.

Article 4

Whilst it is not necessary to complete every activity to make the most of the park, having fun is obligatory.

Article 5

For obvious security reasons, queue-jumping whilst waiting for activities is strictly forbidden.

Article 6

Activities are available at all times during the park's opening season. However, we recommend that even the most industrious tourists take a little break from time to time, especially to avoid unfortunate hunting accidents caused by fatigue.

Article 7

Meals served at Bar Racuda have been approved by nutritionists in accordance with the official "Eat, Exercise, and Spend" campaign. Serving sizes are based on the energetic requirements of the average tourist. The Agents accept no responsibility for allergies exacerbated by spicy dishes, 100-year-old eggs or Bow Meow hairs.

Article 8

Alcohol abuse is dangerous to the health, which is why the Corktails available only contain a small amount of alcohol (non-alcoholic drinks are also available). That means you can drink them all day long. And don't forget, you get a free smile from the waitress with every one hundred drinks!

Article 9

Pets and mounts are allowed all over the island. Please be aware, though, that animal owners take all responsibility for their companions, as well as for any kind of trouble they may cause. You may be asked to make use of a muzzle. Shovels of all sizes may be used to keep the island clean.

Article 10

Tourists are advised to use the canoes and oarsmen provided to travel to other parts of the Vulkanian archipelago in order to prevent pollution caused by algae-covered corpses being washed up on the beaches.

Article 11

Making fun of employees dressed as Raul Mops is forbidden. However, you may punch them as much as you like.

Article 12

Before leaving Vulkania, tourists are required to sit a tanning test. If their skin isn't golden enough, they will be asked to sunbathe a bit more so as not to tarnish the Agents' reputation when they parade around in front of their friends on the continent.

Article 13

All tourists accept that they have been duly informed of all the dangers they may encounter during their stay on Vulkania. They must solemnly swear, or even Pinki-promise, not to take any legal action against the organisers, which would in any case be futile, for incidents such as sprained ankles, groins crushed by falling rocks, unexpected death and various burns.

Should any guideline established in this, the GTG, be disrespected, the holiday-makers in question will be asked to pack up their sandals and their tasteless holiday wardrobes and go back to the Amaknian continent immediately. Perpetrators may be subject to tarring and feathering, depending on the Agents' judgement of each case.

Any complaints deemed worthy of reading should be sent within 3 days of the questionable incident to Charlie's Agents' headquarters. A special investigation squad will then be assembled to sort out the problem.

Protector

Menalt, the Centaur Warrior

Master of the Order

Justfa Lafs

Description

Proud Member of the Militia!

If you prefer the clatter of weapons to Piwisong...

If the view of your enemy's blood only increases your thirst for combat...

If the tainted breath of cursed creatures doesn't make you run for the hills...

Come and join the order of the Valiant Heart!

Our Order is dedicated to the late Menalt (may his name be honoured a thousand times!) and brings together all the Bontarians who have the soul of a fighter. Strength, tenacity and courage are the virtues we share. Endurance and self-denial are also qualities we appreciate. As for the rest, it will come with time.

The members of our Order are warriors. They start off with the rank of Disciple, and, as they progress, they may become Squires, Knights of Hope... and the most seasoned will become Marvellous Champions or even Legendary Heroes!

As a follower of Menalt, you will be given several gifts: the Guard power to attack your enemies, even if they are hidden from view, as well as the Weakening power, which will punish them thoroughly if they are defeated.

What's that, Soldier? Still not sure? Go and talk to the Master of the Order and see the ranks of the Order of the Valiant Heart grow!

Devoted Member of the Militia!

Are you attentive to the well-being of those who follow the path of Light?

Do you like to relieve the pain of others?

Do you have more faith in the power of the ancients than in the wielding of weapons?

Do you think you've found the path you wish to follow, Soldier? Go and speak to the Master of the Order and join in the charitable work of the Order of the Salvatory Spirit.

256.contentId:
Charlie's Agents invite you to spend the summer season on the Archipelago of Vulkania this Jullier and Frauguctor.

You can get to the archipelago by talking toCaptain Jane Away at Madrestam Harbour.

To find out more about this event, head to the official DOFUS site.

257.contentId:
It's said that the fussy fellow Leon Napo once stepped up before the crater with a long speech about centuries and contemplation and stuff, but that all he managed was a faint "Jeez..... !" as he slipped off the edge.

The dangerous creatures living in this crater will provide a challenge for adventurers of level 50 and below.

Any individual found infringing the GTG will be severely punished with shovel blows, pickaxe hacks and jack-hammering.

258.contentId:
It was at the edge of this, the Seeyu Crater, that famous writer Herdegrize gave his famous inauguration speech made up of 77 parts.

The end of the speech is still shrouded in mystery, because nobody was able to stay awake to hear it, including its author.

After that sleep-inducing incident, the site was renamed the Paleozoi Crater, Seeyu being judged too frivolous and lacking in educational substance.

The dangerous creatures living in this crater will provide a challenge for adventurers of level 150 and below.

Any individual found infringing the GTG will be severely punished by way of loud ranting and interminable prosopopoeiae.

259.contentId:
This was the site of the titanic battle between three hundred mercenaries and thousands of Sauroshells. Just before the final push, the leader, Kaz Rednys, is said to have rallied his troops with the cry of "It's in the bag, lads!"

He probably wasn't implying that the very same evening, he would be in a body-bag awaiting burial, just like the rest of his company. But not everyone was born a prophet

The dangerous creatures living in this crater will provide a challenge for adventurers of level 100 and below.

Any individual found infringing the GTG will be coated in a mixture of Snapper oil and Lousy Pig fat and thrown into the Pinki Crater.

260.contentId:
An open-air concert was arranged near this crater to celebrate the opening of the park. A few short minutes after the show's opening chords, all the Sauroshells who lived in the caves underneath came storming out to complain about the noise.

The last words of the special guest who had come from the continent especially for the concert were, "My heart will go ooooooon aaaand oo....". She met her end crushed under the weight of all the Sauroshells that had jumped on top of her.

The unfortunate minstrel was buried in Billabone Cemetery, but when a petition started going round, she ended up being removed and transported elsewhere. The residents of that estate, too, found their neighbour too noisy.

This crater is open to adventurers of all levels who have completed the Totem Erarious game.

The management of Charlie's Agents would like to remind all holiday-makers to adhere to the Good Tourist Guidelines. Anyone found infringing the GTG will be tied up and forced to listen to a Jon Lemon concert in its entirety.

261.contentId:
A curious individual in yellow pyjamas was taken in for questioning by Security after being found teetering precariously just at the edge of this crater. When asked to move away from the edge, he refused, claiming that he needed to be in the right place when "Mr. Scootie activates that darn teleporter."

Babbling nonsensically about a "mission to explore strange new worlds", the fellow, who called himself Captain, went boldly where no honest man had gone before... Astrub jail.

The dangerous creatures living in this crater will provide a challenge for all adventurers.

The management of Charlie's Agents would like to remind all holiday-makers to adhere to the Good Tourist Guidelines. Anyone found infringing these rules will end up far beyond the final frontier, thanks to our catapult.

262.contentId:
Winner of the first season of Amaknian Idle, and thus one of the land's best-known freeloaders, Pandalida was the first celebrity to taste Plimok Soup, and as she dined, she was seated in our very own Bar Racuda.

Trying her hand at the Sauroshell Hunt activity a few hours after her meal, she emitted such a great quantity of methane whilst standing amidst a pack of Incandescent Sauroshells that she set fire to part of Spartania Forest.

She gracefully accepted the advice given by the team of specialists appointed to deal with the situation, and returned to Pandala to prevent any similar catastrophes.

Since this incident, it has been generally advised never to eat Plimok Soup before going hunting, especially if you suffer from chronic intestinal troubles.

263.contentId:
Following the example of all the VRVIPs (very rich and very important people, since we all know you rarely find one quality without the other) invited for Vulkania's inauguration in Junssidor 641, Divad Dleifrepok, master of the Order of the Unsound Mind, made the most of his stay, since all expenses were paid by Charlie's Agents. Obviously, only poor people have to pay their own way, which is why they remain poor.

In any case, Divad Dleifrepok surprised his crowd, not by performing one of his famous magic tricks that only snobs and Quaquacks find entertaining, but by drawing attention to his superb powers of observation. He pointed out that you can't judge a book by its cover, except when you can. Since this had never occurred to anyone present before, his intelligence and astuteness were heartily applauded, even by the hypocritical Bontarians who had shown up for the occasion.

264.contentId:
In 641, Sumens, protector of the month of Junssidor, was invited to the island's opening ceremony reserved for VIPs (Very Important People). Incidentally, they were also VRPs (Very Rich People), but it would be politically incorrect to emphasise such futile details.

It was here, therefore, at the ceremony held to baptise what was to turn into the disastrous event known as the "Treasure Hunt in the Raw Sauroshells' Den" that he declared the following words, filled to the brim with wisdom: "Money can't buy happiness for the poor, but it already has for the rich."

265.contentId: It was on this beach, as Junssidor 641 was drawing to its close, that Sumens had a lengthy discussion with Charlie Endstown-Smisse about Vulkania Park's chances of success. As the head of the Agents kept blowing his nose all the time, Sumens tried to lift his spirits by pointing out that money doesn't smell, especially if one's nose is blocked. To be honest, when it came to humour, Sumens wasn't a patch on Pouchecot the Fruitcake, especially on an empty stomach.

266.contentId:
Otomaisle was briefly occupied by Otomai's disciples, who had devoted themselves to learning new survival techniques. Their main problem whilst on the island was using its natural resources for shelter and provisions, and surviving with only Grills Beer to drink.

Agitated by a racket which could be heard from Vulkania every night and which eventually started carrying on long into the daytime, red creatures decided at some point that they had had enough and invaded Otomaisle to chase its inhabitants away.

Agitated by a racket which could be heard from Vulkania every night and which eventually started carrying on long into the daytime, red creatures decided at some point that they had had enough and invaded Otomaisle to chase its inhabitants away.

267.contentId:
OVulkorog was named after Korog, the Iop poet-warrior. Like most Iops, he didn't burden himself with pomp and ceremony – he ate when he was hungry and fought when he was angry – but he recounted Iop exploits (and especially his own) like no one else.

One of his greatest accomplishments was the rediscovery of the Sword of Iop with his companion Yorf, but his best known deed remains the sacrifice he made during the oft-neglected battle of Jammadar. Taking on all the enemy troops alone, he allowed his allies to rest long enough to gather their forces for the final push. Iops will remember him forever as a warrior who stayed noble until the very end.

268.contentId:
This sandcastle is not like other sandcastles: it was built by Aasimar himself. The short-sighted architect was sick to the back teeth of everyone making fun of his poor vision, and decided to show them what he was worth by constructing a miniature fortress in incredible detail, with tiny figures the size of ants. This show of technical prowess and artistic skill was completed, moreover, in a single day, using only a bucket and spade.

Whilst he was adding the final touches to the fortifications, his chin in the sand, Aasimar is said to have uttered the following words: "When up against the wall, it's much easier to see it."

So that his masterpiece could be destroyed by neither time nor tide, the architect varnished it using a secret concoction he had brewed himself, whose main ingredient is rumoured to be a mysterious liquid that amateurs of natural remedies use to cure stings from poisonous sea-creatures.

269.contentId:
There is an old legend which confirms that giant monsters used to roam Vulkania, long, long ago. Nobody knows what these creatures really were. Relatives of Grozilla and Grasmera? Dreggons with over-developed growth hormones? Huge Crocodyls? Enormous, genetically-modified lizards? The mystery has still not been solved. All the clues suggest that they chose this area to die, which is why there are so many remains scattered about. That's why it seemed a natural choice to place the island's cemetery here.

A few bold, if not deluded, characters have proposed another hypothesis as to the origin of the bones: a titanic battle between numerous dragons, in which many of them lost their lives. Perhaps there was a Dofus at the root of the affair...

Of course, dracologists say that this version is poppycock, but who knows?

270.contentId:
The paladin Galahed Furst was running like mad towards the gateway to Ponifar Forest when he took a tumble off this walkway. The unfortunate fall wouldn't have had any serious consequences (except making his friends laugh at his clumsiness) if only the noble Iop had been dressed appropriately for the season. Unfortunately, Sire Galahed refused to leave his cast-iron armour at home, even in the middle of the summer holidays. The weight was too much for the poor Iop, who sank like a stone and drowned just metres from the bank.

Ever since this regrettable incident, holiday-makers have been advised not to run on the walkways unless they are wearing non-slip sandals and inflatable life vests.

271.contentId:
As soon as he arrived on Vulkania, Davie Crackrockett decided to take Nevark the Hunter up on his challenge, and set his heart on completing the great Soul Safari.

Realising that he was going to have to spend some time on the island, Davie converted a barnacabin into a hunting lodge. Since he loved showing everyone what a great hunter he was, he decorated the walls with all the trophies he had won over the years. He didn't just hunt Gobballs – he went after everything that moved! He had ripped the centrepiece of his collection off the Minotoror with his teeth. Davie was very proud indeed of this catch, and showed it off to anyone who stopped by.

In the end, his boastfulness started creating problems: when the ex-owner of his pride and joy learned that Davie was bandying about what used to be his, he took a trip to Vulkania to demand his property back in no uncertain terms.

Davie Crackrockett was forced to leave the island in a hurry, with the Minotoror hot on his heels. The hunting lodge has remained uninhabited ever since.

272.contentId:
