322.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume I
322.contentId:
Gobball

21 Martalo – 20 Aperirel

The Gobball is the first sign of the Doziak And was the first ever constellation to have lit up the gloomy sky. Legend says that Osamodas had a Gobball called Gobby that he loved very much. He would often walk with him across the fields and prairies, letting him graze tufts of the most exquisite grass. But one day, while the god was taking care of his other pets, he left Gobby all alone in his meadow.

A rather hungry Iop disciple happened to pass by and decided Gobby would make a delicious lunch. This Iop's name was Gragrantwa and he was a mammoth of a being who was hungry all the time, even after lunch! Hopping along like a Wabbit, but much slyer, he caught the Gobball and devoured it in one. Other than a few crumbs of horn and a ragged carcass, nothing remained of the poor beast. Burping noisily and with great satisfaction, Gragrantwa, now well fed, laid his head down to rest.

Later, Osamodas returned to his beast only to find the poor Gobball's skeleton and the Iop napping contentedly nearby. The horrified god released all his fury; with great strength and force, he cracked his whip, killing Gragrantwa in one mighty blow. He turned to the remains of his Gobball and glumly gathered them together before sticking them up in the vault of heaven, transforming them into honorary little stars. Thus, the first constellation of the Doziak was born.

Born Under the Sign of Gobball:

Adventurers born under the sign of Gobball are impulsive. Confronted by the smallest obstacle, Gobballs will charge, heads down, even if it means chipping their horns on the way. Their spontaneous character sometimes drives them to commit acts that they may end up regretting. Gobballs are known to go against their parents and become the Black Gobbly of their family, but don't automatically think they're bad people. No. They'll be happy enough following the herd without further questions. The only thing that worries a Gobball, deep down, is eating and drinking, and if it's a free bar then all the better!

In love, Gobballs behave just as they do everywhere else; scarf everything down without even looking at the menu! This lack of judgement sometimes comes back around to bite them in the butt! Because of their trusting nature, they often find themselves being pushed around by malicious strangers who wouldn't think twice about shearing the wool right off their back!

323.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume II
323.contentId:
The Minotoror

21 Aperirel – 19 Maysial

The terrible Minotoror used to live way out, far west of Amakna, on an isolated island, and many that ventured that far never returned... Every day, new adventurers would come to face him, hoping to get their hands on the Dofus that he had been entrusted with. Yet the monster was so powerful that he'd win every combat, crushing his enemies like garden peas. Over the course of time, as you can imagine, he ended up with a particularly large head!

Then, one night, while zealously oiling up his muscular body, something in the sky caught his eye: a star had just lit up for the very first time! Then another... And then another! The first constellation had appeared before his very eyes! However, the Minotoror noticed that it represented a Gobball and this did not please him one little bit! What?! How could some vile, grass-chomping beast have his place in the sky when the Minotoror was at least one thousand times more powerful?!

Enraged, the monster began to chew the cud and crushed a good dozen Tofus under his hoof to take his revenge. Then, in a fit of anger, he raised his hoof in the air and began launching the little creatures up towards the celestial Gobball, trying with all his might to bring it down. With ten times more power thanks to the Dofus, his shots were hitting straight on target... well, almost. The Minotoror was extremely strong, but he couldn't aim very well, and it was the Tofus that ended up crashing instead of the Gobball! To the Minotoror's surprise, the poor creatures transformed into stars and started to emit a faint glow. Thus, by accident, as a result of several badly-aimed shots, a new constellation was created.

Born Under the Sign of Minotoror:

Adventurers born under the sign of Minotoror are full of themselves. They have a tendency to believe that nothing can resist them, and more often than not, they're right! Propose a difficult quest and they won't think twice about taking the Minotoror by the horns! Send them on an exploration mission and they'll call on their sharp sense of direction to make their way out of even the most tortuous labyrinths!

As for love, Minotorors are not very hard to please: they only love themselves! They'll happily spend hours in front of a mirror polishing their horns, flexing their muscles, and touching up their bell. At least they'll never get their hearts broken...!

324.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume III
324.contentId:
Dopples

20 Maysial – 21 Junssidor

The venerable Sumens, protector of Junssidor, had the power to transform whatever he ate into jewels or gold. He would often walk along the steep paths of the Cania Massif after eating and do... well, you know what. There's nothing better than a walk in the fresh air to satisfy your primary needs!

There came a day when Sumens was stuffed after a big, hefty meal, feeling like he had an almighty weight on his stomach. Off he went to relieve himself of his heavy load, yet his efforts were to no avail. He pushed and pushed, as hard as he could, but not even the smallest ruby, emerald, or golden nugget came out. He rubbed his belly and twisted every way he could but still didn't manage to free himself up. Suddenly, when he was just about to give up, he felt his muscles sharply let go and an enormous mother-of-pearl appeared from his lucky guts! Unfortunately, what with the altitude, the enormous stone rolled onto its side and hurtled down the mountain, crushing a couple of Dopples on its course.

At the foot of the mountain, Sumens discovered, with embarrassment, the two monsters he had killed... Worse still, all the other Dopples soon began to rant and rave. To calm them down, Sumens crushed the jewel and gave them each a small piece. For the two deceased Dopples, though, there was nothing more he could do... So, to help pay for the accident that he had caused and to pay homage to the victims, he placed them in the heavenly sky above.

Born Under the Sign of the Dopples:

Adventurers born under the sign of Dopples generally suffer from an inferiority complex. They're always comparing themselves to others and adopting them as role models. They are very observant and won't think twice about copying those that they admire, to later become just like them.

When it comes to love, the Dopples have one saying, "If it looks like you, go with it!" They naturally stick to those who share their way of thinking and it is therefore common to see two Dopples together. When this is the case, you can be sure that they make a very good pair!

325.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume IV
325.contentId:
Craboral

22 Junssidor – 21 Jullier

They say that from time to time, when summer arrived, the goddess Feca would come down to the World to take a break. Apparently she particularly appreciated Otomai Island, for its beaches of fine sand and coral reefs. There, she could bathe in the turquoise waters without having to worry about voyeurs.

One day, while sunbathing on the beach, she noticed a Craboral among the seashells. The shield goddess admired the animal and its proud armour, and she said to herself that this creature would make a charming companion, perfectly symbolising the idea of protection. She tried to catch it to make it her pet, but the crab became jittered. Annoyed to have been woken from its sleep, it closed in on the goddess's foot and pinched at her toe before scurrying away. Feca jumped with surprise, furious at having been attacked, and chased the crustacean. Grabbing her trusty staff (that was always conveniently at her side), she swooped and gave the Craboral an almighty whack. Once her anger had subsided slightly, she sat down to gently rub and soothe her throbbing toe.

Some moments later, the incident forgotten, the goddess was able to return to her sunbathing. But once night had started to fall, she noticed that a new constellation had formed in the sky. She made out the form of the Craboral that she had, in a fit of rage, unintentionally launched beyond the stratosphere. Thus, the crustacean with the beautiful shell came to find its place on the starry canvas.

Born Under the Sign of Craboral:

Adventurers born under the sign of the Craboral are timid by nature. They won't think twice about forming some kind of shell to protect themselves against life's little surprises. Preferring meandering paths to straight lines, they endeavour to avoid any situation that may put them in danger.

In love, as in life, those born under the Craboral are prudent. They primarily aim to protect themselves, and they trust their loved ones with difficulty. To seduce a Craboral, one must pinch its heart; it's the only way to lure them out of their shell!

326.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume V
326.contentId:
Bow Meow

22 Jullier – 23 Frauguctor

They say that back in the day, on the lands of Amakna, there lived a magnificent Bow Meow with long angora fur. Some people say that the god Ecaflip took it under his wing and made it as beautiful as the sky itself. Never had there been such a beautiful, graceful animal as this superb, silky-coated feline. Its eyes were as green as emeralds and its little ears were soft and warm. Its claws and teeth looked almost ivory and its fine whiskers were like little zither strings. Its joyful meow was sweeter than a Tofu's melody and its purr would soften even the most ferocious of Boowolves.

With such perfect qualities, it was hard not to love this Bow Meow – the females of the species certainly had trouble resisting him. But having been flattered and wooed by all the other kitties, this superb puss ended up getting a bit too big for his boots. Whenever he passed a mirror he would have to check himself out, convinced he was a lion-like king. To retain his majesty and make sure he gave off a good image, he'd spend every moment shining his coat. He shined and shined so much so that eventually his shimmering fur almost blinded on-lookers.

One day, wanting to shine even more, he licked his coat so hard that his tongue ripped it off. All that was left of his fine coat was a mere cluster of ruffs, and he watched painfully as small tufts of fur flew about in the air and were carried up to the sky by the wind. These tufts transformed into little stars as the bald pussycat looked on in dismay.

Born Under the Sign of Bow Meow:

Adventurers born under the sign of the Bow Meow are very charismatic. Inveterate seducers, they don't hesitate to use their natural charm to get what they want. Because they're worth it! Don't be fooled by a simple flick of their hair – it doesn't necessarily mean that they're charming down to the core. You only have to scratch the surface to see that underneath they're as naked and vulnerable as a Blue Larva.

As for love, Bow Meows aren't complicated: they like to be rubbed up the right way. Admire them, compliment them, adore them and they will soon be eating from the palm of your hand!

327.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume VI
327.contentId:
The Bworkette

24 Frauguctor – 22 Septangel

Raval, the protector of Septangel, was always a sad and depressed man. Not one day passed that he didn't sit there thinking his dark thoughts. However, this sombre character once tried to chase away his melancholy with marriage. What better way, you might think, to make your melancholy disappear than to unite with a woman?

Yes, Raval was far from being a great seducer, and he had no idea where to find his true love. And thus he decided to trust in fate, and swore to marry the first woman who crossed his path. He blindfolded himself and walked blindly, and after a moment he came across the Bworkette. The vile creature adopted a sweet voice and asked the visitor what he wanted. Raval, believing himself to be in the presence of a young lady, hesitated not an instant before declaring his love: "I have come to marry you!" he said directly, then he removed his blindfold to behold his love. He immediately understood his mistake, but it was too late. The Bworkette, enchanted, was already devouring him with her eyes.

Raval realised that he would have to be crafty if he was to get out of marrying her. He got to work on flattering the creature, complimenting her "pretty" face, before telling her that he had regretfully made a mistake: "No man, not even me, deserves you! You are so beautiful, so charming, and so, so pretty. You emit enough beauty to light up the sky and shine down across the whole world. That way, the entire world could admire you!" No sooner said than done. Raval created a constellation with her hideous features and swore he would never so much as even think about marriage ever again!

Born Under the Sign of Bworkette:

Adventurers born under the sign of the Bworkette are very naive. Blessed with a rather limited intellect, they're constantly being taken advantage of by ill-intentioned people. And when they spot the trickery, it's usually too late. At these times, they can enter a blind rage and are capable of massacring whosoever passes within their reach.

In terms of romance, Bworkettes aren't terribly difficult: they marry the first comer, mostly out of fear that the opportunity won't present itself again!

328.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume VII
328.contentId:
Kilibriss

23 Septangel – 22 Octolliard

Once upon a time, on Otomai Island, a young Kilibriss was vexed by his size. Perched on an itty bit of Palmflower, he dealt with the mockery of his siblings. Because they had all chosen long and beautiful bits on which to perch and do acrobatics. But this type of exercise requires balance and stability! Except our Kilibriss, up on his high perch, never stopped falling. So he found himself a smaller one, to avoid falling quite as much.

It didn't take long for him to become tired of his siblings constantly looking down on him and laughing at his stature. He looked at the sky and imagined himself climbing up to the starry heavens and the marvel it would cause among his bullies. That would certainly be an acrobatic feat! At least from up that high he wouldn't hear them laughing at him. But how could he become an acrobat pro while he was stuck on a tiny stalk? How could he launch himself that high into the sky when he could barely even keep his balance?

The Kilibriss racked his brain, but didn't come up with any ideas for reaching the sky. So in despair, he started moaning, and Maimane heard his sighs. The Protector of Octolliard, guardian of stability, took pity on Kilibriss and decided to help him. He lifted him high into the air, and sent him flying over his peers to amaze them. Then, in a gracious and majestic display of acrobatics, he launched him into the sky and changed him into stars.

Born Under the Sign of Kilibriss:

Adventurers born under the sign of Kilibriss are eternally dissatisfied. No matter what they do, they'll always want more. They like to be the centre of attention (and gravity!) and never miss the opportunity to boast or flaunt themselves.

When it comes to love, Kilibrisses look for a certain stability. They naturally work their way towards people who'll stand up to them, seeking the perfect balance. But once they've found this balance they don't hesitate in devoting themself to crazy acrobatics, just to keep things nice n' spicy!

329.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume VIII
329.contentId:
Scurvion

23 Octolliard – 21 Novamaire

Brumaire, the merciless protector of Novamaire, is cunning, treacherous and perverse. His only pleasures are causing chaos and spreading confusion. They are the only things that bring him satisfaction. One day, he even went so far as to try to wreck havoc in the starry heavens! He chose a ferocious, venomous Scurvion at will and launched it into the air in a flurry of whizzing wind.

Henceforth, chaos was caused across the Doziak: the signs became as agitated as twittering Tofus. The Scurvion landed on the Gobball, who, on the attack, tried to break his neck. The Minotoror, furious for having been bothered, got his hooves at the ready, preparing to crush him. The Scurvion fled and took refuge with the Dopples but they gave him a couple of kicks, preferring to stay alone. With rage, he then tried to attack the Craboral, but wasn't able to block his ginormous pincers. The Bow Meow, watching from afar, started meowing in fear, so loud that the Scurvion sank into a torpor. Unsteady, he made his way to the Bworkette, but was taken aback with horror with the sight of her face. Armed with his staff, the Kilibriss battered him back and prevented him from passing. The exhausted Scurvion let out a rattle and finally transformed into stars himself.

Thus he found his place in the sky, to the left of the Kilibriss and his loyal staff. Nowadays, he tries to break through, but each time, his neighbour keeps him in check.

Born Under the Sign of Scurvion:

Those born under the sign of Scurvion really are venomously intelligent little pests! They will jump at any opportunity to rock the boat. They fill conversations with small, snide comments and will crack jokes about the speaker as soon as they have the opportunity.

In love, Scurvions are as relentless as in day-to-day life. They react with their partner as they would with prey: once they have touched the heart and inoculated the poison of their love, their poor victim will have no chance of escaping them!

330.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume IX
330.contentId:
Centoror

22 Novamaire – 21 Descendre

In the frost of a winter's day of the kind that only Djaul knows how to truly appreciate, the protector of Descendre strolled peacefully across frozen fields. To pass the time and entertain himself a little, he decided to exterminate a little Piwi or two. Before he knew it, he had exterminated thirty of the terrified tweeters. He was delighted to discover that amongst the entrails of the last bird was a pair of wonderful sandals.

As he freed the shoes from the Piwi's carcass, an imperious voice boomed out from nearby: "Stop! These spoils are my spoils, get your hands off!" It was an arrogant, cheeky Centoror, used to extorting adventurers' findings. "I am the Perceptor and you owe tax on this land. Give me those sandals. Make it snappy or you're in for it!"

The protector of Descendre let his rage get the better of him. How could this Centoror be so haughty, while he himself was a formidable demon? The creature needed to be taught a lesson! "You want these sandals? Well, have 'em!" he told the Perceptor, pressing them up against his nose. Then, he launched himself into the staggering Centoror, delivering an almighty kick to the rear. Swept away by the momentum, the unfortunate creature was launched high into the blue sky. Crushed against the heavens, his body exploded into dozens of stars. Thus the Centoror constellation appeared next to the Scurvion and its golden pincers.

Born Under the Sign of Centoror:

Adventurers born under the sign of Centoror are born "takers". That means that they have an annoying tendency to take others' belongings for themselves. Their motto is: "All that is yours is mine – especially if it's valuable!" If they're unlucky enough to be an Enutrof disciple too, this character trait will make them the biggest skinflint known to man!

In love, Centorors prefer playing alone, occasionally cracking the whip and heading off on wild rides, but always champing at the bit!

331.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume X
331.contentId:
Seadragon

22 Descendre – 20 Javian

If there's any time of the year that Jiva hates, it's the beginning, because each time, the infamous Djaul does all he can to throw it all up in the air. Every year, to try and steal a few days from Javian, the demon faces its guardian in a battle of the titans. Fists, headbutts, scratches, and kicks: the hidings and other wallops come thick and fast!

One year, while fighting in this annual brawl, Djaul hit Jiva so hard that he catapulted her all the way to the southern seas! Javian's guardian, completely knocked for six, sank into the abyss and almost drowned. Fortunately, a Seadragon was passing by and recognised Jiva. It grabbed the guardian in its jaws and swam with all its might to bring her up to the surface.

On the surface, Jiva regained consciousness and rushed towards Djaul to wreak vengeance. Feeling stronger than ever, it didn't take long for her to get one up on him as she drove her knee into the one place it hurts the most. Finally, the demon was temporarily incapable of hurting a Piwi, and the relieved Jiva let out an almighty sigh. Then, she remembered the courageous animal that had saved her from the abysmal depths. To thank it and congratulate it on its courage, she decided to decorate the sky in homage. Her fingers still wet with seawater, she took some droplets and magically transformed them into stars to place in the sky. Thus, the Seadragon had its own constellation, and everyone in the lands could now honour its name.

Born Under the Sign of Seadragon:

Adventurers born under the sign of the Seadragon have bravery in their blood. Saving a widow or an orphan comes naturally to them – an admirable quality, as long as they don't get too bogged down. Come hell or high water they'll do their best to help others, but might wind up being left in troubled waters themselves.

In love, Seadragons have one creed: things will always go swimmingly if you're not afraid of getting your feet wet. That might mean crossing oceans for love, or drowning your partner under a flood of presents and sweet words.

332.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume XI
332.contentId:
Puddly

21 Javian – 18 Flovor

Anyone who knows their legends well will tell you that Puddlies are real wet blankets. As soon as they feel any danger, they start shaking, turn into liquid, and run away to hide. Even if they need to stand up and be courageous, their initiative generally finishes in an upset state...

That's how it went down when one day, one of them decided to fight for love. For a while, a dreadful Trool had been roaming the neighbourhood and was causing terror for all. The Puddly hoped to impress the one he had his eye on by defeating the Trool. The task was arduous for such a frail being, but our hero was determined. He also made it clear to his loved one that nothing could stop him, and left, armed only with his courage, ready to face the terrible monster and save his village.

Opposite a furious Trool, with neither faith nor law on his side, the poor little Puddly just didn't weigh up, And once he'd challenged the horrible monster, full of confidence, it wasn't long before he had what was coming to him. A punch, a kick, two headbutts: in just a few seconds, our viscous hero was pulverised into droplets. Carried by the wind, the small drops of his body flew up and reached the sky where they stayed. Thus, the unhappy Puddly, killed by his own bravery, found his way into the night's canvas.

Born Under the Sign of Puddly:

Adventurers born under the sign of Puddly like paradoxes. In daily life, they avoid getting wet and look to avoid conflicts at all costs. However, they sometimes get a boost of pride, which pushes them into unforeseen actions, like, for example, facing the Minotoror with their bare hands, or telling a Bworkette that she's fat.

In love, Puddlies are particularly shy. It's not rare to see them well up at a simple smile from someone they don't know. Oh, and as soon as they get their grips on a loved one, they become as full-on as an army of Jellies.

333.subTitleId: Signs of the Doziak - Volume XII
333.contentId:
Snappers

19 Flovor – 20 Martalo

Ulgrude of Thunder, master of showers, is an impulsive young man with a spontaneous character.

When he wants something, he'll do whatever he can to obtain it. When he's angry, he's capable of terrible things. And when he falls in love, nothing can hold him back: suitor of the beautiful Jiva, he's lost count of the number of times he's tried to seduce her!

One evening, a long time ago, after a lovely dinner, Ulgrude lay down in the grass to digest and started to think about his beloved. Up in the sky, the constellation of the Seadragon, placed by Jiva in her infinite kindness, was shining brightly. At the sight of the twinkling animal, Ulgrude suddenly had a brilliant idea: as the guardian of Javian loved stars, he was going to decorate the sky with a new astral pattern! And then, when his beauty saw it, she'd be really impressed by his talent!

Ulgrude, as always, was impatient, and wanted to crack on with his plan straight away. Only, he couldn't find any animals around him. There was nothing he could change into stars, not even a Moskito! Despite his lack of resources, he decided to improvise and gathered the small bones of the Snappers that he'd just eaten. He told himself that it would be enough and launched them into the stratosphere. Transformed into a constellation, these "Snappers" found their place in the Doziak, and Ulgrude ran to see Jiva, convinced of his aphrodisiac power. Unfortunately for him, all he got from the guardian of Javian was an almighty slap!

Born Under the Sign of the Snapper:

Adventurers born under the sign of the Snapper are far from bull-headed. On the contrary, they tend to just go with the flow and are rarely the masters of their own decisions. This means that, since they laze around while others act, they often end up being "eaten alive".

As for love, Snappers appreciate strong temperaments and, in the company of weaker people, feel like Snappers out of water! When they come across a rare pearl, they'll look at it with fried Snapper eyes and will keep as quiet as an Ediem Carp!

334.contentId:
Signs of the Doziak

  1. Gobball (21st Martalo - 20th Aperirel)
  2. Minotoror (21st Aperirel - 19th Maysial)

I am Yova Etna, seer of the Trool Fair, teller of adventures, good and bad, qualified reader of Tofu entrails, expert in divinatory poker and official member of the Seven Crystal Balls Club. I also read soles, Bwork runes and Feca markers.

As a highly reputable astrologer, I would like to respond to the recent declarations of certain scientomagi who have been spreading absurd theories about the nature of our universe. The Krosmoz, they say, is a sort of cosmic egg, or an astral omelette... I can't remember which exactly. Let's be honest... That's all a bunch of nonsense! Why not a celestial poultry party, whilst we're at it?! Hahaha! But seriously, any sane adventurer knows full well that the World of Twelve is flat and that the sky is a round, solid archway that a giant firefly, the Sun, crawls round and round on! No need to be a scientomagus to work that one out!

Hmmm, but since these cheap theorists believe they can just go around telling lies, I need to set a few things straight. As I was saying just the other day to my colleague Paro Cabanne, not enough people know what goes on up in the sky. Take these Doziak constellations, for example. I am absolutely alarmed to learn that they aren't common knowledge for all! Some people don't even know what the Doziak is! That's just outrageous!

That's why I, Yova Etna, great sibyl approved by the Amaknian Horoscopists League, grant you my great bounty of knowledge, to light up your lives. As you surely already know, the celestial archway spans the World of Twelve and orbits around it as the seasons pass. If the stars look like they're moving, it's only because they're stuck up there on the canvas and follow its every movement.

Every day the Sun makes its way across the sky with its great golden firefly feet. But, far from blindly feeling for its way, it follows a predefined path, occasionally dwelling on certain constellations. It especially appreciates the company of animals, given that these constellations represent the creatures that you will find in our world. Together, these clusters of stars, twelve in total, form what we call the Doziak. It's as simple as that!

Let's get on to the practical aspect and see how all this concerns us directly. When an adventurer is incarnated, the position of the Sun in the Doziak will indicate which astrological sign it will be. For example, if the Sun is in the Gobball constellation when you are incarnated, in astrological jargon we would say that you were born under the sign of Gobball, or, simply, that you are Gobball.

Fret not, you're hardly going to start grazing grass! No, knowing your astrological sign simply allows a qualified astrologer (such as myself!) to give you a heap of information about you as a person: the day you'll have your first Tofu-burger, the hour of your 34th defeat, the name of your first Bow Meow, the year of your first holiday on Otomai, the colour your toe will go when you get stepped on by a Crackler and all those kind of things, you know? You have so much to learn before you can start calling yourself a dignified adventurer!

To sum it up, the signs of the Doziak can teach you various things about yourself. Once you know who you are and what your future holds, you'll have no reason to fear the Dragon Pig... or getting into a passionate relationship with a charming Sadida clairvoyant weighing in at 110 kilopods! Oooh... cheeky!

335.contentId:
Every year at the end of Octolliard, the curse of Al Howin takes over the World of Twelve. Its nasty tendrils transmogrify the gentle Tofus and Gobballs into frightening, blood-thirsty creatures. Take heed, this curse is catching, it can easily jump from monsters to adventurers!

But how did it all begin?

It all started with a contest... Not very long ago, in a region not very far from you, there was a contest to see who could grow the biggest Pumpkwin in Lousy Pig slurry. Extremely renowned among the farmers and fans of succulent squash in the region, this contest was a springboard to wealth for all Pumpkwin farmers. Indeed, taking home first place guaranteed the winner would have a monopoly over the Pumpkwin trade for the whole year.

That year, the competition was stiff, and no one could predict with certainty how the contest would end. Al Howin was among the favourites, however, and he was expected to perform very well. Indeed, he had taken home the trophy fifteen years in a row. And he was used to proclaiming that he was, quite simply, the finest Pumpkwin grower the continent had ever seen... and no one could contradict him on that point. Unfortunately for the Pumpkwin champion, his harvest was late this time, and his Pumpkwins were far from ripe. In truth, his fields were full of ridiculous tiny Pumpkwins. He was going to be the laughing stock of the Pumpkwin-growing profession, and was at risk of losing his unique source of wealth forever... For Al Howin, that was unacceptable.

What people do not necessarily know is that even a trade as consuming as Pumpkwin farming leaves plenty of time for thumb twisting. And Al Howin had been twiddling his thumbs in all the wrong places of late, mostly as the apprentice of a certain Bwork Magus.

Terrified by his looming defeat, and refusing categorically to go back to the mediocrity of run-of-the-mill dirt-farming, Al Howin asked this Bwork Magus to try an untested incantation on his Pumpkwins. The results were not slow in coming. In the space of a few seconds, Al Howin's field turned a deep orange colour...

Al Howin watched his Pumpkwins grow, and grow, and grow... until they were so huge they rivalled the backside of a Mama Bwork. Victory was within his grasp, and more than that: Al Howin was on the path to glory!

When the day of the contest came, the deliberations were rapid. Not a single farmer even came close to rivalling Al Howin and he took hope the Golden Pumpkwin trophy once again.

There was a great feast after the festival, and Al Howin was far from modest in sympathising with the competition. But rather like a carefully crafted sword in the hands of a murderous champion, the Bwork spell did indeed have a double edge: Pumpkwin growth was not the only thing affected by the incantation... While he was celebrating, Al Howin's unwatched fields began to rustle with another kind of life altogether: Gobballs. They were hungry and they were mindless and all they saw were the enchanted Pumpkwins. One bite was enough: they were immediately transformed into hideous, deformed creatures... Panicked and outraged by their new appearance, the Gobballs attacked, spreading panic throughout the festivities. Just when it seemed it could get no worse, it was discovered that the curse was contagious! Simple contact with the beasts was all it took to be transformed in turn!

The panic eventually died down and, after several days, it was noted that the transformation was only temporary... A cure to the "curse-that-could-get-no-worse" (as the papers called it) was also discovered, quite by accident when a child tried to hide in a hollow Pumpkwin. Indeed, the effects of the curse could be reversed by wearing a healthy Pumpkwin on one's head. The Bwork Magus works in mysterious ways... And luckily so.

Al Howin's cheating was soon unmasked, and his association with the Bwork Magus soundly condemned. The famous farmer was banished forever from Amakna, and he fled far from its borders, out of sight and out of mind... Nobody knows where he went or what became of him... but every year since then, when the anniversary of his last fateful and shameful victory approaches, his presence comes a-knocking once more, and the old misery befalls the creatures of Amakna once again!

341.contentId:
Introduction

Since Magus Ax's revelations in Septangel of 642, adventurers can pay tribute to the Meridia, the godly Keepers of the Days. The Almanax Sanctuary is visited on a daily basis, and the influence of these formerly little-known divinities is visible across the whole of the World of Twelve.

The powers of the Keepers of the Days can be witnessed by way of the Meridian Effect, which can take several forms that will be explained in more detail within this guide.

Types of bonuses

The daily bonuses are a result of the Meridian Effect. Each one fits into one of the following categories:

  1. Experience bonuses
  2. Loot bonuses
  3. Star bonuses
  4. Challenge bonuses
  5. Harvesting bonuses
  6. Crafting bonuses
  7. Breeding bonuses
  8. Special bonuses

Bonus values

Many bonuses are expressed in percentages. A value of 100% means a bonus equal to twice its original value.

Example:

Kamas gained are increased by 100% (which means that each gain will be doubled).

Bonus accumulation

Meridian Effect bonuses can stack with other advantages, such as bonuses won by completing challenges or experience multipliers applied to accounts with multiple characters.

Experience bonuses

Experience points

These bonuses can apply to monster families, specific monsters or all the creatures present in a particular area of the game.

Certain bonuses, especially those linked with holidays, focus on monsters that all have something in common (all are pirates, for example) or need a certain item to be equipped (like a pair of briefs for Captain Chafer's Panty Party).

Examples:

Monster family bonuses

Experience gained by fighting Pandala ghosts is increased by 75%.

Specific monster bonuses

Experience gained by fighting Crocodyls is increased by 150%.

Bonuses from all monsters within a particular area

Experience gained by fighting monsters in the Dark Treechnid Forest is increased by 100%.

Mixed pirate bonus

Experience gains and the chances of dropping loot are increased by 75% against all monsters considered to be pirates.

Warning: The names of certain monster types include a reference to a geographic region (for example: the Asparah Gorge monsters), but they define the monster category rather than the area. When the bonus mentions the area in its descriptive text, it takes effect in a region of the game for all types of monster that can be found there.

Profession experience

These bonuses can either apply to all professions or be limited to certain categories, such as harvesting professions.

Example:

Experience gains are increased by 50% for all craftsmen who can make consumables (baker, butcher, handyman and fishmonger).

Quest experience

These bonuses can either apply to all quests or be limited to certain categories, such as alignment quests.

Example:

All experience given as a reward for quests is increased by 100%.

Dragoturkey experience

This bonus applies to Dragoturkeys used as mounts.

Example:

Experience gained by Dragoturkeys is increased by 200%.

Kolossium experience

This bonus applies to all Kolossium fights.

Loot bonuses

Loot

These bonuses increase the chances of dropping loot (not the quantities dropped). Just like the experience point bonuses, they can apply to certain types of monster, specific monsters, geographical areas or, more rarely, groups of monsters which all have something in common.

Example:

The chances of obtaining loot from Grassy Plains monsters are increased by 75%.

Greedy Perceptors

These bonuses increase the amount of loot obtained from Perceptors. They are active in certain dungeons.

Example:

The loot generated by Perceptors is increased by 300% in the Kimbo's Canopy dungeon.

Star bonuses

Lucky stars

Stars appear on monsters that haven't been defeated for a certain length of time. They allow players to gain more experience and increase their chances of obtaining loot. Monsters can have up to 10 stars at a time, at a rate of 1 star every 10 hours.

Star bonuses reduce the amount of waiting time between two stars: when they are active, players will need to wait between 5 and 15 minutes (according to the power of the bonus) to see another star appear.

These bonuses apply to all creatures present in an area.

Example:

Stars will appear on monster groups more quickly than usual in the Labyrinth of the Minotoror area: one star will appear every 5 minutes. The bonus does not apply to the Inner Labyrinth.

Challenge bonuses

Extra challenges

These bonuses create a second challenge at the beginning of combat. They do not apply to dungeons.

Example:

An extra challenge is generated for fights against monsters in the Otomai's Ark area.

Increased challenges

These bonuses increase the gains obtained from completed challenges. They allow players to gain more experience points and increase their chances of dropping loot.

Example:

Bonuses gained by completing challenges are increased by 200% in the Tynril Lab dungeon.

Harvesting bonuses

Plenty of wood (lumberjack)

Plenty of ore (miner)

Plenty of fish (fisherman)

Plenty of game (hunter)

Plenty to harvest (farmer)

Plenty to pick (alchemist)

These bonuses apply to these six professions and increase the quantities of resources obtained from harvesting.

Each bonus can apply to one particular resource, several resources or all the resources linked to a particular profession.

Examples:

The quantity of Oak Wood harvested by lumberjacks is increased by 150%.

The quantity of Dolomite and Obisidian harvested by miners is increased by 175%.

The quantity of meat harvested by hunters of all levels is increased by 100%.

Generation of resources

These bonuses reduce the time it takes for resources to appear between two harvests. They apply to five professions – hunters cannot reap the benefits. The bonuses can be limited to particular areas.

Examples:

Fish of all types will reappear 100% more quickly than usual.

Resources will reappear 150% more quickly than usual in the Cania Fields area.

Crafting bonuses

Production line

This bonus applies to the handyman profession as well as the three food-making professions. It grants an extra chance to create a second item for each item crafted.

Example:

For each item crafted, butchers have a 25% chance of creating a second one.

Saved ingredients

This bonus grants you the chance to save some resources for each stack of ingredients used in a craft. A saved resource is not consumed.

The possibility of saving resources depends on the number of resources in the given stack: the higher the resources in the stack, the higher the chance of saving an ingredient.

Therefore, a bonus of 10% applied to a stack of 10 resources guarantees 1 resource saved. The same bonus applied to a stack of 5 resources would give a 50% chance of saving 1 resource.

The bonus can be limited to the workshops present in a particular area.

Example:

Harvesters and craftsmen save 15% of their ingredients when they craft items in the Lonesome Pine Trails area.

Item quality

The quality of items crafted in a particular zone is increased. When an item is crafted, the bonus will be applied separately for each characteristic roll, without being able to exceed the maximum value threshold. Thus, a roll which would result in a value between 21 and 30 will increase to a value range of 23 to 30 (the bonus being calculated using the difference between the minimum and maximum values) with increased chances of obtaining a 30.

Example:

The quality of items crafted in the city of Brakmar is increased.

Breeding bonuses

Dragoturkey Breeding

These bonuses are active on the 10th of every month. They are most commonly linked to a particular colour. Dragoturkeys of this colour that give birth on that day will produce an extra offspring.

All Dragoturkeys of the colour stated will benefit from this advantage, whether they're single-coloured or double-coloured species.

Example:

All varieties of Golden Dragoturkey will give birth to one extra baby.

Special bonuses

These bonuses are often associated with holidays. They can concern kamas, archmonsters, mounts, Kolossokens, resource protectors... They can even introduce NPCs who propose blessings for adventurers.

They can also take the form of surprise items added to monster loot.

Examples:

Our Miss Triste blessing

Our Miss Triste is waiting by the fountain in Amakna Village to give adventurers ugly-overs. Her blessing will transform you into a Crocodyl (a temporary effect which will disappear when you enter a fight) and leave you Butt Ugly (bonus of50 Power and 10 fixed damage for 15 fights).

Devout Dragoturkeys

Bonuses awarded by Dragoturkey mounts are increased by 100%.

Surprise gifts

Trikortritt Surprises have been added to monster loot. When you use one, you'll either receive an Al Howin's Treat or be turned into a Little Borbkin.

Repeatable quest

These special quest bonuses can only be completed for one day. They can be repeated as many times as you like and vary in level according to the adventurer (with a minimum level of 10). Characters that complete these quests also have the chance of obtaining experience scrolls.

Example:

A special repeatable quest is available today near the statue of the god Sram in Astrub. It is available to players of level 10 or higher and is not attached to the offering quest.

343.contentId:
Toucantankerous feeding research

This Toucantankerous caused me a lot of problems, but I think I've finally understood how to feed it.

It seems to have a fixed elemental resistance, a bit like the Croum, which has a certain elemental resistance calculated as a percentage. However, it's never happy and categorically refuses to learn how to advance by fighting just one family of monsters, unlike the Scarador, which loves solely fighting Scaraleaves.

I originally thought that, being a cousin of the Kidos, it would want to feed on the Grassy Plains of Otomai Island. Not only did it refuse to learn anything but Earth resistance here, it was also only interested in two monsters from the area!

It was through trial and error that I learnt that each area of the island affected a certain element and that the Toucantankerous was only interested in the master of the area and one of its subjects.

Thus:

- Beating the Great Coralator and its Coralators will teach it Air resistance.

- Beating Silf the Greater Bherb and his Kidos will teach it Earth resistance.

- Beating Gourlo the Terrible and his Barbrossas will teach it Water resistance.

- Beating the Perfidious Tynril and its Dark Treecklers will teach it Fire resistance.

- Beating Kimbo and his Light Treecklers will teach it Neutral resistance.

I hope this information will help adventurers completely miffed by such a cantankerous creature!

Oshimo

347.contentId:
Long, long ago, there lived on the edge of the Evil Forest a cruel witch named Badmorva. After the terrible battle of Nackmoor, the sorceress was burned alive as punishment for her crimes against humanity.

In order to banish her soul from the lands of Amakna once and for all, her ashes were dumped in a distant, cursed land commonly known as Alma's Cradle.

Since these events, the dark witch has all but vanished from popular consciousness.

Good riddance to her.

348.titleId: Extract from the register of agricultural donations, dated Octolliard 552
348.contentId:
The last flask of Ulgrude's Juice was given to Ed Othnas after a recommendation made by the Lattecup family. Ed Othnas owns a field to the east of the Farmers' Workshop. His farmland has been duly registered in the official archives as a patch dedicated to experimental planting.

The one hundred flasks of magic fertiliser supplied by Count Harebourg last year have all been distributed.

A request for further flasks has been transmitted to Nikos Mahdman, superintendent to the Count. His response is expected in early 553.

349.contentId:
I recently received the report Mina Spirit wrote about the details of your investigation.

So you succeeded in getting in contact with Hazieff Taroun. He may be partly to blame for our situation, but it's also thanks to his knowledge that we have been able to thaw out part of the Icefields, around Permafrost Port. For this reason, I do not consider him one of our foes, and I believe in what he says.

If there is a way to avoid a temporal cataclysm, we must find it at all costs.

You absolutely must speak to Nileza the Alchemist and convince him to help us. If he really has managed to create a Longevity Potion, bring me back a sample.

You are free to use force if you see fit.

Cantile, Mayor of Frigost

352.contentId:
Nobody knows much about Doctor Gobotnegg and where he came from. His extraordinary IQ has led many to believe that he's related to DuhBrane, but neither of the two Goblins has ever confirmed this hypothesis. After the mines on Sakai were abandoned, he slowly went mad and started to transform little creatures into mechanical creatures. Formerly Sylargh's apprentice, he tests his inventions on other Goblins and any adventurers unlucky enough to cross his path.

In Summary

He's hiding somewhere in the Snowy Forest.

Wanted for wanton mechanisation and creating chaos.

Sentenced to prison on Frigost.

Can be captured by seasoned sprinters.

REWARD

1860 doplons & 4 ice kamas.

Search for Doctor Gobotnegg

353.contentId:
This giant Bearbarian and his ever-buzzing accomplice have been seen near Nileza the Alchemist's greenhouses. Did they sneak out of their hive to enjoy a little gardening, perhaps? Rumour has it that they're searching for a mysterious nectar.

Tourists who have come to visit the castle are vigorously encouraged to stay out of Bearendizer's way, especially during certain lunar phases. Indeed, our team of Bearbarian ethnologists has noticed that Bearendizer and Actahive are doubly active when the moon is red. Stay well away if you can't handle them, as they will take no prisoners.

In Summary

He is somewhere in the Winter Gardens.

Wanted for trampling flowerbeds and picking plant species that are protected by law.

Sentenced to imprisonment in the Tower of the Guard of the Day Without End.

Can be captured by adventurers intent on defending their country against invaders.

REWARD

2040 doplons & 5 ice kamas.

Search for Bearendizer

354.contentId:
One stormy night, as the rain hammered relentlessly on the walls of Harebourg Castle, lightning struck Sylargh's warehouse. His latest prototype took the brunt of this burst of energy and turned on by itself. E. Roes was in the middle of tidying up the warehouse at the time and watched, gobsmacked, as the scene unfolded. As the mechanical creature lumbered away from the warehouse, the imp felt a sharp pain within her skull: for the first time in her life, she had had an idea.

Quickly, she unrolled the plans for the Mekstagob and created a female version; not to keep the original company, but to prove her talent to Sylargh. Unfortunately, E. Roes wasn't as bright as she had hoped, and she had to leave the unfinished Mekstagal on the scrapheap. Ever since, the Mekstagob has been trying to track down its artificial soul mate, wreaking utter havoc as it goes.

In Summary

Can be found somewhere in the Windblast Barricade area.

Wanted for attempts at non-consensual relations with artificial creatures.

Sentenced to imprisonment in the Tower of the Guard of the Day Without End.

Can be captured by adventurers who know how to think on their feet.

REWARD

2040 doplons & 5 ice kamas.

Search for Mekstagob

355.contentId:
Out of a desire for perfection, Klime decided to create a creature capable of thinking as he did. His struck gold with his very first experiments. One of them in particular, the Psychopump, was especially perverse and sadistic. As time went by, however, the Psychopump ran out of guinea pigs to torture. His behaviour as a whole seemed to indicate that he was becoming more and more dejected, until the day he embarked upon what he believed was a mission from the gods. The gods had spoken: they wanted him to guide deceased spirits to the afterlife. And of course, this meant sitting them down in his torture chair to atone for their sins.

In Summary

Can be found somewhere in the Scarlet Tannery.

Wanted for sadism and defective spiritual guidance.

Sentenced to imprisonment in the Tower of the Guard of the Day Without End.

Can be captured by adventurers with morally sound pasts.

REWARD

2040 doplons & 5 ice kamas.

Search for Psychopump

356.contentId:
After going missing following the big freeze, the Ice Knight's remains somehow found themselves ensconced in a suit of armour. A great deal of investigating revealed that Missiz Freezz was the cause of his unexpected return. It seems that she's looking for a way to extract his knowledge of low-temperature smithmagic, but is currently stuck in a stalemate with Moomoo, the Meridia of Forgetfulness, who has the aforementioned secrets under lock and key. The Frigostians fear that the knight's memory might come rushing back to while he's in Missiz Freezz's hands, and they are trying desperately to capture him, but in vain.

In Summary

Can be found somewhere in the Bleak Legion Bastion.

Wanted for holding secret information on weaponry and harming Frigostian well-being.

Sentenced to imprisonment in the Tower of the Guard of the Day Without End.

Can be captured by adventurers who are wrapped up warmly.

REWARD

2040 doplons & 5 ice kamas.

Search for The Ice Knight

357.contentId:
After the curse hit Frigost Island, Count Harebourg started to find the days very tedious indeed. To while away the time, he decided to make his own Fleaster Egg. Likely because no one had ever given him one – a source of incredible pent-up frustration. Drawing upon his extensive knowledge of manufacturing Sinistros and his childhood fondness for roly-polies, he had soon knocked together a totally unique Fleaster egg of which he quickly grew very fond. Very fond indeed. Ever the perfectionist, he even crafted an artificial heart to go inside. Fleaster came and went. The Count grew tired of his plaything and started cuddling up to an old dishcloth at night instead. Nowadays, the abandoned Sinistro haunts the cogs of the Water Clock, hoping to find another owner in need of affection.

In Summary

Can be found somewhere in the Water Clock Tower.

Wanted for shamelessly trying to smuggle itself into unsuspecting backpacks.

Sentenced to imprisonment in the Tower of the Guard of the Day Without End.

Can be captured by adventurers who know a rotten egg when they see one.

REWARD

2040 doplons & 5 ice kamas.

Search for Erotegg

358.contentId: The rose is wilting. The research carried out in Bisale's greenhouses turned out to be very promising, but nothing came of it. A certain alchemist has the missing ingredients, and I am banned from going to see him, but I have no choice. I must go to Count Harebourg's Castle and visit the greenhouses there.

359.contentId:
21st Javian 552

I may have discovered something very important today.

I had assumed that Jiva came in order to act against Djaul's influence over Frigost and to remind me who was in charge. But she may have had another reason...

I asked her whether she was afraid that the other Protectors might show themselves when the Water Clock started working again. After all, Brumaire can't possibly look favourably upon the island's climatic changes. And if Jiva's influence is allowed a look-in on Descendre, then the other Protectors might start fearing for their own months and decide to come and stand their ground, or accuse her of sticking her nose in.

Jiva told me not to worry, adding that she was not acting for herself, but for another Protector... Then, all of a sudden, she stopped herself and turned away, as though she'd said too much.

I didn't ask her any more. I know that the immortals are secretive beings.

Still, I hope I find out more about this...

360.contentId:

Jacquemart Astron Harebourg, Count of Frigost.

Appearance

Wanted for

Accused of high treason towards the Frigostian populace, mental manipulation of crowds, contempt for the winter authorities, abuse of magic powers, unseasonable defrosting, global warming, troubling the climatic order, illegally downloading high temperatures, black ice on the public highway, not helping frozen people and heinous crimes.

361.contentId:
"The gods invented water so we could wash our feet with it. If you want to quench your thirst, there are plenty of other drinks to choose from." These were the wise words pronounced by Chief Brutas when one of his lieutenants offered him a swig from a jug of water.

The city of Astrub was named after Brutas. Initially, it was little more than a camp to be used as temporary lodgings. With time, and under the firm command of their mercenary leader, the camp grew to become a hamlet, then a village, then a town, and finally the bustling city well-known all over the World of Twelve.

The Council of Astrub is pleased to erect this statue in memory of a man who was a visionary, a valiant hero and an all-round decent bloke. Cheers, Brutas!

362.contentId:
Well hello there, little Kokoko! If you're the kind of person who likes to party all year round, then you'll love my new compendium! It contains everything you need to know about the folklore and traditions of the World of Twelve, and I've even thrown in some celebrity gossip for free! I spoil you, really I do.

Anne Thrope-Oloji,

folklorist and gossip columnist.

Javian

Javian marks the beginning of the new year, and what better way to start it than by waltzing gracefully around the Clockwork Ball?! Throw some shapes on the dancefloor and show the god Xelor you can stick to the beat! And... one two three, one two three...

If you don't know how to dance, don't worry! You can always console yourself with a Thwee Kings Cake. This delicious, Cawwot-based pastry is traditionally eaten on Javian 6th. Legend has it that long ago, three wise Wabbits went in search of new lands, and were lost at sea for ten long years. Running desperately low on supplies, they decided to make a cake with the last few Cawwots in their sacks, but the vegetables had gone off! The first bite broke the poor Wabbits' teeth, which is why it has been customary to hide a Wabbit tooth in the cake ever since!

Flovor

In Flovor there's still a real chill in the air, and if it doesn't kill you, it'll certainly make you stronger! Well, that's what the disciples of the goddess Sacrier like to tell themselves, anyway. If you want to see just how accurate their proverb is, visit the Flovor Bawl on the first of the month and find out for yourself!

If you'd rather warm yourself up with a banquet than with a Bawl, then Stove Yumday on Flovor 2nd is not to be missed! This ancient tradition, hailing from the Amaknian countryside, is a simple one: make a huge pile of pancakes, and then give them all to a Gobball. If it eats them all, it's a sign that spring is about to arrive. If not, it's probably because your batter has gone off... or that the obese ovine has already eaten!

Be careful not to overdo it, though, because there's another feast to come! Flovor 14th is Ballotwine's Day, when star-cross'd lovers send each other chocolates. And if you count your suitors by the dozen (like the charming Louse Degraine), you'll pile on the kilopods faster than you can blink. You'll end up with nothing but a big belly for your trouble - and gods help you if you clock those delicious doughnuts at the Too Faux Karnaval as well...

Fortunately, every four years, you can take part in the world-renowned Krozolympik Games. Flovor 29th is the perfect opportunity for you and your fellow competitors to get your hearts thumping and legs pumping, and to burn off a few calories while you're at it!

Martalo

In Martalo, the rain keeps pouring - and so does the drink! Saint Potrick's Day falls on the 17th of the month, and venerates the goddess Pandawa and her love of bamboo milk. It's not unusual to see other classes joining her disciples for an all-day (and all-night!) party - the Eniripsa Pinta Gone is a regular. Every year, he dresses in green and takes part in all the drinking competitions, even imbibing the infamous Grinness, a drink made from macerated clover. Needless to say, many people end the night in a very sorry state. When the participants start to look a little green around the gills, it's customary to wish them a happy Saint Potrick's Day before helping them into bed.

St. Potrick's Day also marks the beginning of spring, with birds chirping in the trees and flowers springing up in the fields. It's no surprise that after such a drunken evening, it's customary to deposit some natural fertiliser on your neighbours' flower beds. But be careful; it may be a generous gesture, but it's not to everyone's taste...

Aperirel

On the first of Aperirel, zany pranksters try to stick Snappers on your back without you noticing. This may sound like harmless fun - but nothing could be further from the truth! A source of bitter dispute (‘You know where you can stick your Snapper, you old cod!'), and salacious scandals, this tradition can cause the unwary all sorts of trouble! Take Magus Ax, for example. He had a Gudgeon stuck to his cape for two weeks, and the wise old sage's reputation has never recovered from the accusations of dubious personal hygiene. So, a word to the wise: prudence.

Speaking of personal hygiene, I remember one particularly rainy Aperirel when Don Rouann, a playboy by profession, was caught naked in the Amakna Village fountain with only a young lady and her blushes for company. There's an old saying; “Aperirel showers bring Maysial flowers”, but in Don's case, those showers brought him nothing but trouble - a terrible bout of pneumonia! Rushed urgently to the nearby Temple of Eniripsa, he was unable to take part in any of the Fleaster festivities.

The Fleaster egg hunt is a much-loved tradition in the World of Twelve, and usually takes place in the gardens of Amakna Castle. They say that one year, King Allister hid a golden Dofus amongst the traditional Fleaster eggs. No one knew if this story was true, or just a legend, but suffice it to say that plenty of Srams, Rogues and Enutrofs took part that year!

Speaking of Enutrofs, Aperirel is the month of the Fabrikamation, the day when they pay homage to their god. More often than not they'll send a little prayer his way, asking him to bring them luck, but they certainly won't get carried away. As well you know, Enutrofs are particularly stingy with their time, because time, after all, is money!

Maysial

Fairy Lax spent her days blowing herself up so that other people could have some fun, but one Maysial she decided she'd had enough. She fancied a holiday, and so she went on strike, managing to convince all of her Fairy colleagues to do the same. In memory of their struggle, it was decided that the first of Maysial should become a bank holiday, so this month, why don't you kick back, relax and enjoy yourself?

A week later is the Maysial Munch - goodbye scrapping, hello scoffing! This celebration, in honour of the god Iop, is the perfect opportunity to make peace with your enemies by inviting them to share a delightful eight-course meal at your table! A friendly and peaceful occasion... until dessert, at least - because once the eight courses are gone, the plates are sure to fly!

Anyone unlucky enough to be injured by this cascade of crockery can get their treatment for free on Healy Thursday. This celebration, honouring Rosal, protector of the month of Maysial, invites healers to volunteer their services for the good of their peers. The Eniripsas are going to have their work cut out!

If scoffing, scrapping and throwing plates isn't really your thing, why not head over to the Super Gobbowl and soak up some of the atmosphere (and celebrate the team spirit!). This event, which takes place on Maysial 15th, is the sporting event of the year, and is not to be missed!

Junssidor

Ah, it's Junssidor at last, when everyone heads outside to enjoy the sunshine and get some much-needed fresh air. If you like gardening, and prefer your vegetables organic and straight out of your garden, Plantalot Monday is the day for you! If you'd prefer a picnic, or a quiet walk through a beautiful, blooming garden, try the Guardian Party instead, which takes place on the 4th!

But the event of the month is undoubtedly Gobbstock! On the 21st, musicians across the World of Twelve will fill your heart with joy! This event is the perfect opportunity to dust off your flute or your zither, and organise an impromptu concert with your friends! Who can forget Jon Lemon's concert in the Bonta Arena? The ageing crooner performed some of his greatest hits, ‘A Migraine' and ‘Jailhouse Guy' being particularly well received.

Take my advice and make sure Yo Kohono isn't on the bill, though, or the concert might end earlier than expected!

Jullier

If you were born on the 4th of Jullier, like Tom Crust, then you're going to love Ultra Super Amakna! Originally organised by the famous Captain of the same name, this super event showcases everything that's super about the super city of Amakna. Super! So strap on your red, white and blue shields and dive right in!

But if patriotism isn't your cup of tea, then maybe Jullier 14th is for you! On this day, a handful of revolutionary peasants commemorate the day of the Taking of the Pastille, a tragic episode where King Allister, suffering from a sore throat, nearly choked to death on a cough sweet, which would have led to the collapse of our beautiful monarchy! Every year on this date, rebellious opponents of the current regime throw Fairyworks from the castle walls to celebrate this symbolic event. Don't be surprised if you see the royal guard wandering through the fields!

If you're looking to unwind and enjoy a moment of tenderness with your pet, then the Society for Partying and Caring for Animals' festival, held on Jullier 23rd, should be right up your street! It was created to honour the God Osamodas, and also to give thanks to the devoted owners of Bow Meows, Bow Wows and other domesticated beasts for their kindness towards their loyal companions. Make sure you pack your wellington boots though, as some of the animals can get a little over-zealous when marking their territory!

And finally, to close this summer month in suitable fashion, take a trip to the Trool Fair on Jullier 30th, when we celebrate the anniversary of its founding. With Gladiatrool fights to sate your bloodlust and Trool burgers to sate your hunger, there's something for everyone on Trool Day!

Frauguctor

Head north to the City of Angels on Frauguctor 3rd, where the great Festival of Bonta will take place! Take part in peaceful demonstrations to prove to your friends that the world is a kind, caring place, not forgetting to randomly hug strangers in the street...

But if you'd prefer to unwind on a deserted beach with only shellfish and crustaceans for company, then no problem! Frauguctor 15th is the Star Lazing festival, the perfect opportunity to spend all day snoozing beneath the red-hot sun and topping up your tan. And at night, after a good long nap, let the festivities begin! Fairyworks light up the sky, sparkling and shimmering like the stars - and the best part is, you don't even have to get up off your sun lounger to watch!

Septangel

If Septangel's longer nights and shorter days are getting you down, there's only one thing to do: take part in the festivities of Konval Essence Day! With all the celebrations planned in honour of the goddess Eniripsa, you're bound to find your maudlin mood is lifted!

Especially given that on the 12th, you're likely to need something to pick you up again: on the anniversary of the Crimson Dawn, the atmosphere is far from jovial. Be careful, because the day which commemorates the terrible battle between Bonta and Brakmar is often the opportunity for simmering feuds to spark and for old wounds to be reopened. Prudence, once again, is the watchword.

Fortunately, the festivities of the following week should lift your spirits a little. Every 19th Septangel, the pirate Seth Halitosis organises a special event: the Me Hearty Party. The famous filibuster promotes the use of pirate lingo and more... how can I put this... florid expressions. So if you love Greedo Rum and have a potty mouth that'd make a Brakmarian trooper blush, fill your boots!

Octolliard

The goddess Cra is the focus of attention during the month of Octolliard, and on the 3rd (All Arrows Eve), there's an archery competition. It was created at the behest of a man named Bill Tell, and if, like him, you have the soul of an archer, why don't you try your luck?

Or maybe you'd prefer to go adventuring through strange new lands, in which case wait for the 12th and Bamboozle Day! Take a small detour to see Charlie's Agents and hey presto! You're ready to play at being an explorer, just like Kris Tofcolon!

Octolliard is also the month when Chafers come crawling out of the closet, and Al Howin's Gobballs make their appearance - watch out for the latter, because they're definitely more ‘lick then eat!' than ‘trick or treat!'. The only way to escape their curse is to wear a hat carved from a Pumpkwin. Here's a tip: stock up next time you're at the grocer's!

If you've not had your fill of vegetables, then I'm sure you'll have room for a slice of roast Dragoturkey to celebrate the festival of Hank Skivin. Unless you're a follower of Skank Hivin instead, in which case you'll have to wait until the following month!

Novamaire

The beautiful month of Novamaire begins, aptly enough, with Captain Chafer's Panty Party! Every year, in tribute to this mysterious, long-lost Chafer, people dress up in tight leather panties and dance a feverish tango by the light of numerous Fairyworks. This is a prestigious event, and guests are hand-picked for the occasion! Ztiv Oztin and Setsinbol, for example, are regulars, but don't expect to spot them - this is a masked ball, after all, to ensure the safety of the celebrities taking part. With their identities hidden, they can let their hair down and throw some shapes on the dancefloor in total anonymity.

If the idea of hanging out in your pants doesn't really tempt you (maybe you're shy, or have a few too many hang-ups about your body), you can console yourself on Novamaire 11th, when it's Our Miss Triste's Day. This is the date of the World of Twelve's largest ‘who is the ugliest?' competition, and a simple glance at the participants will have you feeling much more attractive!

But that isn't the only day when you might come across some rather unsavoury characters, because on the 15th, it's the Night of the Bandeads! The meanest of the god Sram's disciples, thieves, scoundrels, faithless rogues and lawless Srams are on the prowl, so keep your wallet, your hands and anything else that isn't tied down in your pockets and pray!

And finally, if you didn't celebrate Hank Skivin in Octolliard, you can celebrate the festival of Skank Hivin this month instead. Custom dictates that adventurers should gather around a stuffed Dragoturkey and share a good meal together - after all, as the saying goes: 'In Novamaire, Dragoturkeys beware!'

Descendre

If the streets seem unusually quiet on the 6th Descendre, it's because all the children are inside, trembling in their beds, for the day is Father Whupper Day! This infamous miscreant punishes any child who has been naughty rather than nice - which has the Brakmarian populace trembling most of all!

On the 12th, it's the Bontarians' turn to worry, because it's the day of the Brakmarathon - the official festival of Brakmar. Drunkenness, debauchery and lewd behaviour are the order of the day, and opportunities for malicious mischief-making are legion!

Fortunately the atmosphere is a little more relaxed during the rest of the month. The 18th is Play Day, a day devoted to Ecaflip, when devilish dares and crazy challenges abound. There's nothing like a good game of dice or a risky bet for warming the blood!

But most of all, Descendre is all about Kwismas! As well as the traditional pilgrimage to the island of the same name, the most common tradition falls on the day of the 25th, when adventurers decorate their Kwismas Itztings with beautiful garlands, and enjoy a meal of Dragoturkey and chestnut stuffing with their friends. Indigestion ahoy!

363.contentId:
There are only a few scraps left of the entries Wabewt Scoot made in his travel journal. As you skim through them, you learn that the Fallen Pwinces are said to have formed a pact with a Shushu – a real dastard of a Shushu, at that – to acquire abominable powers allowing them to control dead creatures and vengeful spirits. You stamp your foot in rage as you reach the spot where the Shushu's name should have appeared – the paper is ripped.

A little further on, you find notes on the excavations the explorers carried out on the site of the Lenald temple on Gwimace Island. From what you can tell, their research points to the existence of abandoned laboratories housing terrifying creatures. The corpses of Wabbits used as guinea pigs seem to have been dumped unceremoniously around Gwavestone Island, only to be brought back to life by their tortured spirits. There are notes about the archaeological digs at the Lenald temple on Gwimace Island and the discovery of Abandoned Labowatowies full of terrifying creatures.

As you struggle to decipher the rest of the journal, you realise that it mentions a secret passageway. Apparently some of the members of the expedition party set up camp nearby. You reckon the blotchy writing refers to the junction between Cawwot Island and Gwavestone Island, but the rest of the page is illegible, so you can't be sure.

Look for the explorers' camp.

364.authorId: Makia Velik, on behalf of King Allister
364.contentId:
People of the World of Twelve,

On this day of Junssidor 25, 643, it is with great pride that I unveil the Edict of Velik. This decree is based upon the agreements laid out in the Treaty of Six, which was signed several weeks ago by the six major states of the World of Twelve.

The representatives who signed the afore-mentioned treaty are as follows:

  1. Danathor, steward and representative of the High Council of Bonta
  2. Amayiro, head of the Bontarian militia, also representing the High Council of Bonta
  3. Oto Mustam, master of Brakmar, representing himself (woot woot) (sic)
  4. Grandapan, mystical chief of the Island of Pandala
  5. Viktoria Punkhurst, representing the Sufokian Sea Council
  6. Captain Ardier, local councillor for Frigost Village, the capital of Frigost Island
  7. Makia Velik, representing His Majesty King Allister, sovereign of Amakna

Right of Conquest for Alliances

By this edict, the signatory states agree to grant right of conquest to all guild alliances recognised by the kingdom of Amakna.

The right of conquest applies to almost all the territories of the World of Twelve, including the wild provinces that do not fall under the jurisdiction of any state.

This right does not, however, apply to territories that fall under the jurisdiction of states other than those involved in the Treaty of Six.

Any alliance can impose its right of conquest and take control of a territory. When this happens, the alliance will be free to utilise as it sees fit any resources and methods of transport available within the borders of the territory.

Conquest and Sovereignty

Right of conquest has no bearing on the sovereignty of states. When an alliance takes control of a territory, it is considered to be an ally of the sovereign state that administers that territory. Should the conquering alliance fail to respect the laws of the sovereign state, its right to conquest may be withdrawn. If this happens, members of the alliance will be considered outlaws.

Please note that the High Council of Bonta reserves the right to launch a call to arms if any of the geographical areas in the White City's administration should fall into the hands of an alliance that is known to be Brakmarian.

Oto Mustam, supreme ruler of Brakmar, insists on a similar reaction in the case that a Bontarian alliance has the bare-faced cheek to take control of Brakmarian territory.

Guild Alliances

In order to be officially recognised by the kingdom of Amakna, the formation of an alliance of guilds must be authenticated using an Alliagem. The alliance name must be registered in the archive found in the ancient temple of Sebklav, which will now be known as the Alliance Temple.

Once created and given a name and an emblem, an alliance is at liberty to accept new guilds and expel guilds that no longer serve its needs.

Guild leaders will be held responsible for the behaviour of their members. Should the citizens of a state feel the need to complain, the guild leaders may be summoned by the authorities in order to address the problem.

Guild Wars

If tensions arise between two or more guild alliances that wish to take control of a single territory where right of conquest is applicable, it is the responsibility of the guilds involved to settle the conflict. The state under whose jurisdiction the territory falls will not intervene.

War veteran Hal Ions has been designated by the kingdom of Amakna to advise alliance members on which strategies to adopt during guild wars.

Complaints and Grievances

All complaints, recriminations, accusations and other grievances must be addressed to an official agent of the kingdom of Amakna to be deemed valid. All the administrative procedures must be completed by the wronged party, who must also pay any fees required.

Please be aware that, as the number of available agents is limited, any requests submitted are likely to be subject to a considerable delay before they are addressed.
